name: Movie
speaker: DAN
text: About him?

name: Movie
speaker: DAN
text: He'll show up.  C'mon, what's really wrong?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Nothing...it's just...I didn't see my father at the ceremony.

name: Movie
speaker: DAN
text: Okay, babe.  What's the matter?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I know.

name: Movie
speaker: DAN
text: They're coach seats, but the plane lands in Paris.  It's gonna be a helluva summer, hon!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: The tickets.

name: Movie
speaker: DAN
text: Sorry, babe.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Jesus!  Don't do that!

name: Movie
speaker: DAN
text: Hi, beautiful.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: Now.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: But Dad --

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: No!  I won't have you running around in the middle of the night.  You're coming home.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I've got to go.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: Alice!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: No, I'm not.  I sort of hope it's a boy. Be nice to have a boy playing in the house again.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: You disappointed in me?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: Since my little girl became a mom...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Since when are you such a smart shopper?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: Alice...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Very funny.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: Sobering...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: How was the meeting?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Daddy, he's coming back...Krueger's coming back.  Make them understand.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: I'm so sorry, honey...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: It's just across the park.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: You sure you don't want a ride to work?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Thanks for everything, Dad.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: To take a picture.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: Where are we going?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: It's the model you've been saving up for. I wanted you to have it for your trip.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Dad!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: No.  A deal's a deal.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: That's in the past.  Unless you've stopped going to the meetings.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE'S DAD
text: I watched from behind the stands.  Didn't want to embarrass you, ya know.  "The drunk showed up", that kind of thing...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I was afraid you weren't coming.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: That's okay.  He's got the rest of his life to catch up on his sleep.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: He sure loves to stay awake.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: So did Dan.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: You do good work, Alice.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: We've got to go to the asylum and find her body.  Mark said her soul's trapped with it -- that's why she can't come to me.  It must be!

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: But how are we gonna --

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Jacob.  We've got to get to Amanda before it's too late.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: If they actually bothered to bury her.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: You think that's the place she's buried?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Yeah...So that's him.  And you're not crazy.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Are you alright?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: That's the only reason you're alive...

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Look...we're all tired.  None of us had any sleep since Friday night...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Goddamn it, Yvonne!  You don't just run away from this guy!  He finds you in your dreams.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: All I know is that you are not doing yourself or the baby any good by acting like a crazy woman.  Why don't you take off - leave Springwood and cool out somewhere for a while?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: What do you think I'm doing?  Look.  Whether you believe it or not, Krueger is back.  He's after the baby and if I don't try to do something about it, who will??

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: And so is your baby.  You've got more than just yourself to think of now!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Krueger is reality.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: I am your friend, and I'm worried sick about you.  But, you're like a locked safe.  You've gotta start dealing with reality.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I just can't figure out how he's getting in when I'm awake...

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: I really think you need to calm down now, okay?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Mark knows I'm not crazy.  Ask him to show you his hands.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Oh, Alice...no.  Honey, I love you but you're going to have to get a hold of yourself...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I think Krueger's trying to do something to it.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: You had me scared on the phone.  What's wrong with the baby?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Why don't you two stick to reality.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I don't understand what's happening. Krueger has to use my dreams, but he got to Dan and Greta while I was awake. How's he doing it?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: No accident.  I tried to warn all of you about Krueger.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: It was just an accident.  Like with Dan.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: When Dan died you weren't even asleep. You said so.  End of story.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: What's that got to do with it?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: They're waiting for us...but let's keep this dream stuff between you and me.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Did everyone call everyone?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: He must've wandered up from the children's ward.  I just wondered what was wrong with him.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: There aren't any little boys on your floor.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Have you visited the little boy on my floor?  Jacob, the one who looks kind of sad?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Alice, it's no dream.  I'm sorry...Dan's dead.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: It was no accident.  It was Krueger.  He used to get in through my dreams, but not anymore.  He's found some other way.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Yeah, before they revoke his diploma.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Good to see you again, Mr. Grey.  I've got to go find Dan.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: No, the Dan part was nice...

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Dan keeping you up again?  Put a lock on that window, girl.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Had kind of a long night.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Hey, what's wrong with you -- let's see a smile.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: She killed herself.  Her soul's gonna be in torment.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I don't understand.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: No shit.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Poor woman...

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Empty plot.  Memorial stone.  Vacant. They never did put her under.  Cool, huh?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: But I've seen her grave.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: They couldn't prove it.  No body!  Nuns bumping themselves off is bad for business.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Meaning?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: That's what the newspapers thought.  She spent the rest of her life in the asylum. After Krueger's trial she flipped out and hung herself, so they thought.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: No, it's our problem, Mark.  If I don't deal with this, they really might try to take Jacob.  You said she committed suicide?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: That's their problem.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: They think I'm nuts.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Then we'll find another way.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I couldn't do that, Mark.  He's my last link with Dan...No, I want him.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: I'm going to see what else I can find out about Mr. Fred Krueger

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Where are you going?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I don't know!

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Whoa, slow down.  How're you gonna hide from a guy like that, leave the planet?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: What, you named it already?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: My baby!

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Who's Jacob?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Why don't I go make some coffee.  There's a lot to tell.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Tell me some more about this Krueger guy.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: It wasn't her mother.  The only reason we're still here is that none of us has slept since the grad party.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Maybe it was her mother who killed her, with all that Polly Perfect shit.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Nobody thinks that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Do you think I'm an idiot...for being in love with her?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Mark!

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Then get out!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: She must've fallen asleep at the table...

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: I thought about that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: I'm very fucking sorry, but Greta is dead today.  Could we interest you in someone else?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I want to talk to both you guys about Greta.  And...

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Yeah.  I'm just aces.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Mark, are you okay?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: That's why it's my fault Dan's dead.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: I've got to write some of this down.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Well we gotta do something!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: My dad's got this thing about drinking in the house.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Greta, come on.  One burger with me?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Not to mention the heartbreak of psoriasis.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: I think I'm starting to wear her down.  Have some anyway.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Give up, Mark, it's hopeless.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: I don't believe this... All that gore you paint in the comics and you're squeamish?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Oh man!  I could've gone all night without looking at that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Oh, he was this ancient guy I read about who like, killed his kids 'cause they didn't want to run the kingdom the way he thought they should.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Who?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: He's right.  Sometimes I feel like I'm living with Melicertes.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: You know my mother -- get real.  What about Alice's?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: That club sucks, they card everybody. Let's just party at your place.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Pimples, heartburn, cellulite... and no modeling career.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Meet me later.  Milkshakes.  Cherry pie. Banana splits.  And no mom!

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: My undying love.  Have some.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Next life.  Oh, what's that?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Yeah, when are you gonna come to your senses?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: All of us.  Right?

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Bottom line, Alice.  Anybody, supernatural or not, that wants to hurt you - he'll have to go through us first.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Pushy parents can make you more than a bit crazy.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Look.  Dan's parents were pushing him. Pushing him hard.  He was bitching about it at the party last night.  He was under pressure.  We all are.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: I want to talk about the baby.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Stop saying that, it's bullshit.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Nah.  It's getting too cold for me, and my wonderful mother will kill me if I screw up my hair.  She's got some model agency guy coming to dinner tomorrow night.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Naah, I'm done.  Got to be on shift in a couple hours.  Aren't you going in?

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Have another one, sounds like you need it.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: That means they're gonna give me the key to the pool so I can lock up when I'm done.

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: Yeah...

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: All right kids, I tell you what we're gonna do.  I've got swimming practice until six-thirty today...

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Makes you look like a nun--

name: Movie
speaker: GRETA
text: These things are wild...  What do you think?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: He invited me to his house last night.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: You, too?

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Stick around, please?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: It's okay.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: I can't listen to this.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: I'm not finished - I loved Greta.  A lot. And if maybe, just maybe, someone or some thing killed her, I'd like to hear about it!

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Mark...

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Why don't you shut up and let her talk! Two of us died in the last two days, does that strike you as particularly normal?!

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Faint.

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Vomit?

name: Movie
speaker: YVONNE
text: Two hours a day, six days a week.

name: Movie
speaker: MARK
text: Dan.  And he's taking Alice with him -- pretty good dive Yvonne.  You've been practicing.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: And his 'egghead' son!  We'll give 'em a <u>rough</u> <u>reception</u>, won't we?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: I wouldn't worry.  So long as we have boats like the Tiger Shark - and people like you, the Skipper, Dave, Kent, Sir Ian and my father -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I don't know.

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: But if they <u>do</u>?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Maybe - just 'maybe' - when their ship doesn't return - they'll decide not to come here, after all.

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: Which is the one - we have to worry about?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: They're so remote - cold - beautiful, the stars.  But now - I wonder -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I'd sooner swim!

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: However our ideas disagree, as I've said before, I'm <u>not</u> a coward!  And it happens you've got no choice:  Either <u>I</u> take you down there, in the Lungfish, or you don't get there -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: - any more than being the son of Captain Neilsen does!

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: That's enough, Holloway.  I've told you before, wearing boards on your shoulders, and parading with a stiff spine doesn't auto- matically endow you with back- bone - !

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Then...this is a 'flying saucer?'

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: Unidentified Flying Objects.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You may not <u>win</u> them.  But without men like your father, to 'degrade' himself by fighting to preserve them - or as much as we have of them - they'd have disappeared, <u>long</u> ago!

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: Peace - the dignity of man - the destiny of the human spirit!  Show me a man who says you win <u>those</u> by fighting wars, and <u>I'll</u> show you an idiot!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You mean <u>nothing</u> is worth fighting for?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: Perhaps.  But the idea of willingly going to <u>school</u> to spend my <u>life</u> at a Paleozoic pastime that should have disappeared with the thunder-lizards - I'm referring to War - <u>that</u> strikes me as the <u>worst</u> cowardice of all - being spiritually yellow!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You're really a mixed-up oddball, aren't you?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: That may be.  But Dad stays where <u>he</u> is, and I'm staying here!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: We're <u>all</u> risking our lives!

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: Wearing a uniform doesn't bestow an automatic monopoly on courage, <u>Commander</u>!  It just so happens I'm <u>not</u> a coward - physical or mental - and before I'd risk my father's life...

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: <u>You</u> said it.  But I won't argue -

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: You 'trade school boys' are all alike, aren't you?  Anybody who doesn't happen to think like a little gold-braided puppet is, ipso facto, a coward!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Your father can be in Nome, Alaska, tomorrow.  We have two choices: Ask them to send him out in a 'copter', and take you off, or the Shark can put back into Nome...

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: What did you mean:  I'm 'out?'

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Dead?  Matter of fact, he's much better. He's left the hospital.

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: My father!  He's not - ?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Your 'out.'  This came for you.

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: Not in two days.  Look:  Do you think I <u>wanted</u> to come?  If it didn't mean so much to Dad - proving his depth-explorer - it's the last thing I'd want!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You could train someone else.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: And they thought <u>you</u> could re- place the Skipper?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: It was moderate.  He'll be all right.  But it was out of the question, his coming along.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: How is he - ?

name: Movie
speaker: CARL
text: It was supposed to be.  Dad had a heart attack, two days ago.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I should have suspectcd, when I heard that 'Doctor.'  I thought it was your father.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: What's goin' on in here, Lad? What - ?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Dave - !

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Oh it does???

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Here - keep these.  It wants me to come alone.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: I'm with <u>you!</u>

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Well?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: We'll have to look for them later.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Wonder where Powell and Carney are?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Somewhere down there?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Where do you think the voice you heard was coming from?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: The sound again?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You hear that?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Let's get back to work, and maybe we <u>will</u> be, soon.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: And if I didn't <u>know</u> better - I'd swear we were moving!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You know - it <u>is</u>?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Hey - you know somethin'?  It's getting lighter in here!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Strange you didn't hear it. OMIT 274F

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: I don't hear anything.  Maybe you've been down here too long.  Why don't you go back up and -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Listen!  Hear that?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Yeah?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Go back and tell Dr. Neilsen. Have him report to the Skipper.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: I think you're right.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: What's more important - there's our problem.  The bow ram - the sawteeth are holding the Shark in the break. If we can cut the ram, the Shark can pull herself loose!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: How about that! The bow drove half through her, but she sealed herself right up.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Not <u>alone</u>, you're not!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You all wait here.  I'm going inside, take a look.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Reef and I can take the Explorer down, clamp it around the eye, and ---

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: 'Us?'

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: You've got to let us try, Skipper --

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Skipper!  Look at the depth gauge!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: We're stuck tight!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Sounds like it!  Distress call, from a small freighter, between Ellesmere Island and Greenland. One mayday, then...nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Cyclops?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: 'His' side?  I've seen it, all right. A nice, bright yellow!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Have you ever talked to Carl - tried to see his side?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: But <u>they're</u> not Skipper Neilsen's son!  It broke his heart.  Then when some newspapers called Carl 'the honest, sincere son of a war-mongering father' - Captain Neilsen resigned from the Navy.  Oh, he still keeps his hand in - playing around with projects like the 'Lungfish' - but it broke him, all the same.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: A lot of people think like that.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: So all of a sudden his only son drops out of school, be- gins making noises like a pacifist.  A real egghead, do-gooder, and crackpot!  'Ban the atom tests!  Junk the nuclear subs!  Spend the mili- tary budgetfor peace!'

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: So?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: One of the finest men, and officers, alive.  A real hero - in the best sense of the word - in World War Two.  He taught us Engineering and Design. Fought like a demon to develop atom subs.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: I guess.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I guess Skipper Neilsen re- tired before you enrolled at the Academy, didn't he?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I might have a son like <u>that!</u>

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You've asked why I stay a bachelor? There goes the best reason I know!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Disappointing a <u>big</u> girl!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: What could be worse than disappoint- ing a little girl?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: <u>That's</u> the worst possible moment?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: At the worst possible moment. Tomorrow is Janie's birthday. Poor little kid has looked forward for two months to having her Daddy home.  Now -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: So they caught up with you, too?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Reef!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Helen.  I appeal to you -

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: But Julie's a nice girl, and I've seen you work.  She deserves a fighting chance!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Now, Dave Old Buddy, you know you're exaggerating -  What do you think of this husband of yours?  On most boats a certain loyalty exists between the Exec and his Navigation and Firing Officer.  But unfortunately, in the case of Lieutenant Dave Milburn of the Tiger Shark and myself -

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: We hope!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Sidearms?  But the saucer's dead.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: With their underwater experience, they'll be invaluable.  Take sidearms, and flare pistols --

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: The frogmen?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: You better take Powell and Carney with you --

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Right at our one-eyed friend!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: What course, Skipper?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What???

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: A mass of jelly-like stuff came out of the thing, and caught our torpedo!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Speed...about twenty-two knots. Course...due north!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Course and speed?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: I...don't know!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What about down?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Seems to be all around...

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Is there any way out of it?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVE
text: Right, Skipper.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Get ready.  We shove off as soon as Griff reports all the crew aboard.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What????

name: Movie
speaker: GRIFF
text: We're dead in the water.  But it indicates we're moving!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Why do you say that?

name: Movie
speaker: GRIFF
text: The inertial navigation system. Must have been knocked out in the crash.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Something wrong?

name: Movie
speaker: GRIFF
text: Skipper - could you take a look here...?

name: Movie
speaker: GRIFF
text: All internal repairs completed, and Frogmen report exterior damage minor.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Yes, Griff?

name: Movie
speaker: GRIFF
text: Excuse me, Skipper---

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What about time...?

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: It's possible I could adapt one of the torpedo guidance systems to the ICBM - so it would 'home' on the saucer when he rises from the Pole.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Anything ---

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: Excuse me, Captain - there may be one last, desperate chance - a one-in-a-thousand shot...

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: Radiation level...constantly rising...

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Now they feel it...down below.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: That's wonderful, Carl!  Reef thinks they can clear the Shark bow so we can pull ourself loose!

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: Wonderful!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: We read you!  Go ahead, Doctor!  They're inside the saucer.  It's filled with breathable air!

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: As ready as we <u>can</u> be!  I'll report to the Skipper.

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: All ready?

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: There is.  I believe our friend...Cyclops... is returning to life!

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: There's got to be an explanation!

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: As we near the Pole...

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: What direction does the system indicate?

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: The radiation level - from the saucer - it's rising!

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: If we were lucky enough to catch him with his power depleted....

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: ....in such a way as to prevent his returning to it and, as you put it....  ...'recharging his batteries'?

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: The North Pole is the positive end of the biggest magnet of all - the Earth itself!

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: <u>We</u> harness energy on a small scale by cutting magnetic lines of force.  Maybe Cyclops does it on a <u>super</u> scale....

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: We took for granted his source of energy was nuclear.  But suppose it isn't at all - what if it's <u>magnetic</u>?

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: What if the Tiger Shark were to anticipate a bit?  Perhaps be lying there waiting - ?

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: Suppose our theorizing is correct? Then this <u>could</u> be the next danger point!

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: ...above Murmansk, and Finland.

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: High-intensity arcs will burn, submerged.  And millions of volts...discharged in random directions...

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: Under <u>water</u>?

name: Movie
speaker: KENT
text: It doesn't seem possible, but - could it be an electrical storm center - ?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Minus three.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What's the corrected bearing to the Magnetic Pole?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Nothing we can do, now.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Straight to the Pole - at almost fifty knots!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: If we could get inside the saucer - use our torches - maybe we could cut the Shark loose?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Suppose there's an atmosphere, of some kind, inside Cyclops?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: And we're at safe maximum depth already....  Stop engines!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: It's the screws, Skipper.  At our declination angle, running in reverse, they're pulling the Shark <u>and</u> Cyclops right to the bottom.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: A hundred and eighty fathoms! We can't be sinking that fast....

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: We can <u>ram</u> him!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: But - what can we accomplish?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: That's what I said!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Right <u>at</u> him?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Thirty-four seconds!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What's the running time?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Take a look.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: You're sure it's Cyclops?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: After torpedo room:  Report!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Determine extent of damage, immediately.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I think I should have joined the Air Force!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: What do you think?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: It'll be all right.  We're old friends!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: 'Doctor' Neilsen?  When did <u>that</u> happen?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Dr. Neilsen.  He'll be - -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Who with?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: I'm - afraid I have some bad news for you, Reef -  You'll have to share quarters, this trip.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: I met Dr. Kent, once.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: I did go.  Just back.  Reef, these are a couple of our passengers - Sir Ian Hunt, and Dr. Clifford Kent.  My exec, Commander Richard Holloway.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Thought you were going to Washington, Skipper.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: <u>That</u> might be a <u>little</u> <u>rough</u>!

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: Obviously.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: To navigate, won't you have to... see your way?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: Of course.  But it is time to be- gin the return voyage --

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: That's why no water leaked inside when we rammed you?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: It is a living thing.  When damaged - you would say 'wounded' - it immediately 'heals' itself.

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: I have selected you, to return with me - along with several other specimens, for study.  We will examine you and the others, discover desirable features to incorporate in our 'earth-colonizers.'

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Why?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: On the contrary.  I want you - unharmed - perfect.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Why not me?  What am I - the closing act?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: I am afraid not.  Therefore -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: He did!

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: Your friend was to remain where he was!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Swell!

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: - for horrors like yourself?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: My mission is to study various solar systems, and planets - select the most suitable for colonization -

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Tell me something:  Why can <u>I</u> hear you, when the others couldn't?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: Point of view is everything. To us, <u>your</u> form of life is ugly as we appear to you.

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: That's a <u>face</u>???

name: Movie
speaker: REEF
text: Come where?

name: Movie
speaker: SAUCER VOICE
text: Remove your weapons, Commander. And come here - alone!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: All right - go to it.

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: Cyclops will have to linger at the Pole to recharge his power banks.

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: Toward the Pole!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Due north.  At five knots...no, six!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: But <u>answers</u> are what we need - not more questions!

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: We've asked ourselves that - over and over - a thousand times.

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: Or, perhaps, until he gets us?

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: You plotted the course of Cyclops?  Then that's <u>our</u> course!  Wherever <u>he</u> goes, <u>we</u> go.....until we get him!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Our 'Cyclops' throws quite a thunderbolt, itself!

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: Just musing about our 'one-eyed adversary' and the legend of Homer.  'Cyclopes' were the Sons of Heaven, who forged the thunder- bolts thrown by Zeus.

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: I'll be another!

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: Well, I'll be - !

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: The pattern.  Each incident occurred almost precisely a thousand statute miles from the Pole.  A line through the points of occurrence makes almost a complete circle...

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: See what?

name: Movie
speaker: SIR IAN
text: Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: WENDOVER
text: My yeoman will show you to your quarters.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: All the figures show is that Gordon LaRiviere is going to be a very rich man using his position as Selectman. In a year or two, you won't recognize this town.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: He musta found out. They had to get rid of him. And Jack'll get blamed.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Twombley involved?

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: I went down to Concord to check it out. The president is Mel Gordon. The vice-president and treasurer is Gordon LaRiviere. Those boys are buying up the mountain, Wade. $364,000 this year. I believe that's out of LaRiviere's league.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What is the Northcountry Development Association?

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: This is from three years ago. Some difference, huh?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: As a mater of fact, yes. LaRiviere.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Has anybody offered to buy it?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I know he's due for the last two years. I was thinking of paying it when the insurance comes in.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: About Jack? No. Have you checked out the tax bill on your father's farm lately?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You don't believe me?

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Sometimes things are simpler than you think. Let me ask you a question.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: ...if Jack told the truth, he could be free by the time he's my age.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You know Jack Hewitt, the kid I work with?

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Who?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Evan Twombley, the union boss who got shot. Somebody murdered him.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Who?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: This is maybe worse than you and I are used to.  What I'm talking about, I'm talking about murder. Among other things.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Always has been.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Alma, I think there's some dirty business going on in this town.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Well, you look... sad. Upset. I don't mean to pry. I'm sorry about your mother. It was a nice funeral.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, sure. Why? I got this damned tooth, I got a few things bugging me, like everybody else. But I'm okay.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Are you alright, Wade?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No. Black.

name: Movie
speaker: ALMA
text: Been putting my files into it. You take sugar and milk?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You got yourself a computer, Alma.

name: Movie
speaker: CHICK
text: He's a Selectman. The town. He said to tell you to turn your badge in and clean out your office. I'm supposed to pull the CB and police light out of your car. They're town property.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: He can't fire me. LaRiviere already did that this morning.

name: Movie
speaker: CHICK
text: Chub says you're fired.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Tell me.

name: Movie
speaker: CHICK
text: LaRiviere says he ain't gonna pay for the fixin' of your car. A couple hundred for the clutch. I got some more bad news. Wanna hear it?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. I know about that.

name: Movie
speaker: CHICK
text: -- the bad news is there's a problem with Gordon's truck what somebody drove through the ice last night. Figured you'd know something about that, Wade.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Just tell me when you'll have it fixed.

name: Movie
speaker: CHICK
text: The good news is we haven't got to your car yet. The bad news --

name: Movie
speaker: CHICK
text: Same old shit.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What are you boys up to?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. I know. The custody suit thing was just my getting back at her. I'm not as dumb as I look. Whatever you say. I love my daughter.  I'll send you the five hundred.

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: You might be better off legally as well as financially to just go for the --

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Oh.

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: Hard to say. If we go for custody, depositions, psychiatric evaluations, it could drag on. Ten or twelve thousand dollars. She could win on appeal. If we just want to get the visitation rights redrawn, assuming they're unduly restrictive, it wouldn't be more than twenty-five hundred.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jesus. How much... how much will the whole thing cost?

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: Fine. I'll need a $500 retainer. You can mail it.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: No, not exactly. I'll look at the divorce decree, see if we can get it redrawn. Interview your daughter. Jill, right?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It looks pretty hopeless, don't it?

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: Good. It would help if there were some drug or alcohol abuse on the part of your ex-wife. Sexual problems upsetting to the child.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: This spring.

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: How soon?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I plan to. Soon.

name: Movie
speaker: HAND
text: It would help if you were married, if there was someone at home while you work.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I screwed up the divorce. I agreed with everything she said. I wanted her to like me. I just want to be a good father.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: That was me.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: We bought you.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You can't buy Wade off.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Maybe I can buy him off. I gotta talk to Mel.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Shit! What are we gonna do?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: He's on to us!

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: No, of course not. Just say it, that's all.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Lawyer? I don't need no lawyer, do I?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: You'll get your money. Don't talk to any newspapers about this. Twombley's a big deal down in Massachusetts, you know. Tell them your lawyer says you shouldn't comment.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Not exactly. I mean, he never paid me.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Might as well take the rest of the day off. You look sort of fucked up. You've been paid for the day, anyhow, right?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: This is gonna be one fucking mess to clean up. Twombley's son-in-law and daughter are up the weekend. Didn't you say you'd seen him, Wade?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Nope. Heard it. We wasn't far apart. I spotted this buck, then I heard the gun go off and Twombley was gone. I looked over the little cliff we was using for a stand and there the fucker was, deader'n shit. Called it right in.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: You see it?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: I hear Twombley got shot.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You heard the news.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: You only got a little while if you want your hundred bucks.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Fresh tracks.  Deer shit. Big one. Here's your buck, Mr. Twombley. I'll circle around.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Deers have ears too.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Sun's gettin high.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: This way.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Safety on?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Ruined my arm. Brought me along too fast. Why'd it have to be my fucking arm, I used to think. Then I realized it had to be somebody's fucking arm.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: What happened?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: The only difference between me and that Clemens on TV is luck, shit luck.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Hmm.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: They said.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Really.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Pitcher. "Best ballplayer to come out of New Hampshire since Carlton Fisk."

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Oh.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Double A. New Britain.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: You played for the Sox?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Drafted by the Red Sox.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Yeah?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I used to play ball.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Follow close. We'll cross the next meadow.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: I'm okay.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Wonderful!

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: And you'll get your extra hundred bucks.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I get it.  No sweat. You'll get yourself a deer and you'll get him dead. And you'll have him by coffee time.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: You understand what I'm saying? I want a deer, a dead one, not a cripple or whatthefuck.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Mmm.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: You take care of your end, kid, I'll take care of mine.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You might gut-shoot it or cripple it for somebody else to find and tag. Can't guarantee that won't happen, especially with a new gun. I may have to shoot it.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: You think so.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You might not kill it.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: If you get it?

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Tell you what. You get me close to a big buck by ten, kid, there's another hundred bucks in it.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Done much shooting with that rifle yet?

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Damn straight!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yep. Right about now the does are holing up in the brush piles. The bucks are right behind them and we're right behind the bucks.  This gun gets fired before ten o'clock. Whether it kills a deer or not is more less up to you. I'll put you inside 30, 35 yards of a buck the first four hours of the season. That's what you're paying me for, ain't it?

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: Guaranteed, eh?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Don't worry, Mr. Twombley, I know where those suckers are. Rain or shine, snow or no snow. I know deer. We'll kill us a buck today. Guaranteed. Before ten.

name: Movie
speaker: TWOMBLEY
text: It's not enough snow, not for tracking the bastards. No advantage there, kid.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What do you mean I got money? I'm as broke as you.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I mean it -- you got enough money now. Head out for California. Surf's up, Jack, and you're digging wells in the snow.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Open the door. We're late.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Why don't you quit now, you want out so bad?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Open the door, will ya?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Out of this fucking job. This job sucks. Working outside in the winter sucks.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Lawford?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I'm fucking out of here.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: He sure as hell won't.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Twombley sure as hell won't be shooting it again.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: There's your old twenty-gauge, and that there's the new Browning you was showing me last night. This must be Twombley's gun. Brand new. Very fancy tooling. Probably fired one time. It's a beautiful piece of work.  But what the hell, Jack, I guess you deserve it. Right's right.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Let's get the fuck outta here. You're not making any sense, man.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You musta seen him get shot. I know you did.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What the fuck you telling me, Wade? I never seen the guy get shot, I told you that.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Saw him do it?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Sure you did.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Well, I didn't actually see him do it. Like I said.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I never seen a man shot before. Not even in the service. Must be something.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Who the fuck knows? Musta slipped or something. I just heard the gun go off.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I gotta make a report to Fish and Game. I was just wondering, that's all. What'd he do, to shoot himself, I mean?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Musta... How'd I know? What're you doing, playing cop?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: On your sleeve.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What blood?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where'd you get the blood?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You stayed away?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: The ambulance guys lugged him up.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You bring him up yourself? That's a steep climb.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: A half mile in, along the old lumber road.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No, I mean whereabouts.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: In the chest.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where'd Twombley get shot?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Piece of fucking cake.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Aw, shit, she's here to get Jill. Me and Jill had a little argument. Jack, I got to get back, get back to town. Move this thing, will you? See if you can get back to the Town Hall before they get there, okay?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Shit.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Bastard's got his high beams on.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Right!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah, he'd go broke tomorrow if you quit him.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Right. The sonofabitch couldn't get along without me.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Like you and Gordon?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Gordon, he's always got some angle working. He wants to keep Twombley happy, I'm his boy.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: How'd you get the job?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Don't know about lucky. The guy's a full-blown asshole. Pay's good, though. $100 a day. I got to guarantee a kill, of course. Which I can do. There's some monster bucks hiding out up there.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Evan. He's a mucky-muck union official from Massachusetts. You're lucky.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Got a job first thing in the morning, first day of season. Saturday I'll hunt for myself. Twombley something. - Er --

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Not here.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Some job. Here, have a hit. Don't be such a hardass. I know you got problems, but everybody's got problems.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You gotta be more careful about that shit. Gordon or one of those guys sees you smoking that wacky tabacky around me they'll expect me to bust you. And I'll be outta a job.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Relax, Chief. We're leaving. You wanna toke?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I thought I told you to move that truck!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Got you for -- 450, 500 bucks?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: No brag. Just fact.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where's that gun you were bragging on today?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: LaRiviere's having a hell of a time in there. Master of fucking ceremonies.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Don't mind if I do.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Okay, let's go home, then.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I want to go home.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jill, please, it's alright. Nothing happened.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Oh.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Nope. Not anymore. I'm nothing anymore.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: You're a policeman.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I know.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: That's illegal, you know.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You can't.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I want to go home.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I don't know. For the food business. I guess. I just thought, you know, we'd sneak a Big Mac on Mommy, like we used to.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: What are you sorry for?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Please don't cry. Please, honey.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Fine.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Okay.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Nothing, I guess. I guess I can wait till we get home. Maybe we'll stop by Wickham's for a hamburger when we get to Lawford. That suit you? You always like Wickham's.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Okay. So we'll get what you want. What do you want?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I know what Mommy says. I'm in charge today, though.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Same thing, Daddy. Mommy says --

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You can't have nothing, Jill. We need lunch. Mr. Pizza?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What do you want, then?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: C'mon, we can always sneak a Big Mac. And a cherry turnover. Your favorite. What do you say?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Mommy won't let me eat fast food. You know that. It's bad for you.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: How about a Big Mac?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Oh.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Grandpa. My father. It's his.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Pop?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It belongs to Pop.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: It's pretty old.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. My car's in the shop. This'll be fine.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Are we going in this?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm glad you're here. Can you stay for a while?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Dad.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: That's fine with me too. When Mommy comes, tell her I'm up here.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Sit right there by yourself if you want. Wait for her by yourself. That's fine with me. Just dandy. I'm going downstairs.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where do you expect to wait for her? Obviously downstairs with the other kids isn't good enough.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: She won't be here for a half hour. Think you can stand it that long?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: That's all you got to say? "Yes".

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: She's gone already!  Gone already! Couldn't wait.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Well, I guess I am. I planned this, I planned all this, you know. I mean, it's sort of pathetic, but I planned it. You shouldn't have called your mother.  C'mon, we're gonna call her before she leaves.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I told her I wanted to come home. Daddy, don't be mad at me.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. Yeah, right, I'm mad. What'd you tell her, for Christ sake?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: See, I knew you'd be mad.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Come and get you! Shit! It's a damn half hour drive each way. Why didn't you talk to me about it first?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I... because I want to go home. She said she'd come and get me.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jesus, why?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What? You called Mommy? Just now?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I called Mommy.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jesus. Listen, Jill, tell you what. Tomorrow morning, you still want to go home, I'll drive you down. I'll get off work or something.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I don't want to be here. Don't worry, I love you, Daddy, I do. But I want to go home.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You are home. There are lots of kids you still know here.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: No I didn't see anybody I know. No I don't want to go to school here tomorrow. I want to go home.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No what?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Some party, huh? Sorry I lost sight of you. I had to step outside for a smoke. You find anybody you know here? There must be some kids you used to know from school. You want to go tomorrow? See your old teachers? Be more fun than hanging out with me all day.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Oh, Jesus, come on, will you? Don't mess this up anymore than it's already been messed up. Join the other kids. Do that and before you know it you'll be as happy as a goddamned clam.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I want to go home.  I don't like it here.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It's fun.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: It's stupid.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What then?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: It's not that.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Why? Why not? You know these kids from when you went to school here. It hasn't been that long.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I don't want to.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Go on, Jill. Some of those kids you still know.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: No. She doesn't talk about you anymore.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No. I didn't used to be bad. No sir. Where do you get this stuff? From your mother?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I just think you used to be bad.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What are you talking about?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I bet you did lots of bad things.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It's not funny now. I'm a cop and I gotta listen to all the complaints people make. I'm not a kid anymore. You change.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: But it's not funny now.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: To us it was.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Was it funny?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Well, yeah. Sort of. Nothing really mean. Me and my pals, me and my brothers. It was kind of funny then. Stealing pumpkins, soaping windows. Stuff like that.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Did you do that when you were a kid?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I guess they're stupid.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Yeah. It's stupid.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Break stuff?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: You know.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Do what?

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Why do they do that?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Can't you see... look out there. Nobody's got their porch lights on anymore. It's too late. Those Hoyt kids are just out to get in trouble. See, they put shaving cream all over that mailbox there. They chopped down Herb Crane's new bushes. Little bastards. Jesus H. Christ.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: I don't care. They're out.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Those are the Hoyts.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Look. Those kids are still trick-or- treating. They're still out.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: JILL
text: Who's fault is it then if it's not yours? You're the one in charge, Daddy.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm sorry for the screw-up. But I couldn't help it it's too late to go trick-or-treating now. I couldn't help it I had to stop at Penny's for the costume. And you were hungry, remember.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, you can have the key. It's the key that's kept me locked to you all these years. I give it to you with pleasure.  Now I'm free. See how easy it is, Jack? All you got to do is give back what the man gave you, and you're free of him.  I've got to call my brother.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: The key, Wade.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You two, don't you get it? He's using you. You're his slaves.  Jesus Christ, Jack, don't you see that?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Wade, you're done.  Let me have the shop keys.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Always count on old Wade for a good screwing. Why should I always pay more, sell cheap? Why should you guys make all the money. You and Mel and Jack. Right's right.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Could be.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You and Mel Gordon?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Maybe.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I won't. You interested?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Don't light that in here. I'm allergic.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Want to buy?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: What's the difference? Take my truck, take a rest -- stop worrying about Mel Gordon. Have you decided what to do with your old man's place -- he going to stay there?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: That was before Twombley was shot. Before he knew.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Mel's doing some business with me. It's nice to do favors for people you do business with. He was in a hurry. No big deal.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You? Why?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Wade, that wasn't smart. Going out right after the man's father-in-law shot himself. Let it go. Call it a favor to me.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: He say anything about the summons I tried to give him? Sonofabitch wouldn't accept it.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: So?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I saw Mel Gordon in here this morning.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Nothing, Wade, I've been thinking. You don't get enough appreciation around here and it's time we changed things a little.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What do I have to do for it?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Elaine! Call Chub Meritt and have him pick up Wade's car, fix the clutch.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: On what you pay me?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: You ever think of getting a new car, Wade?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Sorry about the long lunch. My clutch is going out again.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: You Rolfe?  I remember you from high school. You're a teacher now? Harvard?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm fine, fine.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: How you holding up, Wade?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Well, right now we're not too interested. Finish up what you gotta do, then you can get bugged on your own time.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. A few things.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Something bugging you?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It ain't done, if that's what you mean.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: What the fuck. My day's already ruined.  Give me the keys. You can go back with Jack. You still got a shitload of plowing to do.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Let's get to the top and talk to Jack first. He'll know what happened. He fucking better. If this coulda been avoided, I'll put that kid's ass in a sling.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You want me to follow them to Littleton?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: That must've been Twombley. Jesus. I bet that was Twombley.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Like hell.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: You ain't the hunter Jack is. And he can't drive the grader worth shit.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I wish you had. I'd rather be deer hunting instead of freezing my ass on that fucking grader.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: I shoulda sent you instead of Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: He more than likely just shot himself in the foot or something. That's what usually happens.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Yes, Wade, I mean Twombley. Put out that cigarette. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You mean Twombley?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Fuck. You don't know how bad or anything?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Twombley's shot. I heard that. Not Jack. He's okay, I assume.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Fuck. Turn it off.  All you heard was there was some kinda accident?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Twombley, Jesus. We got to get moving: I got to get up there. How would I know? C'mon, you drive. We'll take my truck.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I figured you already heard.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: A hunting accident. Jack and Twombley.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: What's the hurry?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: That's what I love about a small town. You know everybody.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Fuck you.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Get the grader. Go out 29 past Toby's. Don't let Lillian get to you. She didn't belong here. That's why she left.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm not saying that.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: You don't want the extra police pay?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What am I -- a security guard? You hired me, you and your Selectman friends.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Don't go playing policeman.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: At the school crossing. In his BMW. Coulda hurt some kids. I'm gonna bust his ass.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: His son-in-law damn near killed me.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Jimmy took it. Jack's out hunting with Evan Twombley.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where's the plow?

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Told you the snow was coming down. Take the grader.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: Watch this snow. It's coming down tonight.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Tomorrow, Gordon.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Got here just in time. Go ahead. Jump in line. Maybe you'll win a prize.

name: Movie
speaker: LARIVIERE
text: We're looking for the funniest costume! And the scariest! And the most imaginative! And the best costume of all!

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: You know what I'm talking about. For what you're doing to me and to the child you say you love so much. Love. You won't get away with it.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Low as what? What have I done? It's bad to want to see your own daughter?

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: You make me sick. I can't believe you've sunk so low.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No problem. Look, I...

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Hi honey.

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: See. Get your boots.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, lots.

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: Wait there. She'll be right out.  Is there snow on the ground up in Lawford?

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: Let the past be.  I'm sorry about your mother. I liked her. You never know how much women like that suffer. It's like they live their lives with the sound turned off -- and then they're gone.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It's just...

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: We've done all our talking, Wade.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: We should talk.

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: No, not anymore. It's too... it's too far.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You ever come to your father's grave anymore?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm not making it any worse. You are. Me and Jill could've worked this thing out. It's normal, it's even normal for me to get a little touchy about it. Believe it or not. How do you think this makes me look, treating her like some tragic victim or something?

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: Don't cause a scene. No one's trying to win any 'rounds'. Don't make it any worse.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I don't want her to go, Lillian.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Oh, Jesus, lay off, will you? It looks like you've won this fucking round already, so lay off a little, for Christ's sake.

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: She's grown up some, hasn't she?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: While you went off for a few beers with your friends? Is that Hettie Rodgers there, with whatzizname?

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: Where is she now? Is she in the truck with your friends?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Me and Jill, we just had a little spat. She felt kind of left out, I guess, from not knowing some of the new kids --

name: Movie
speaker: LILLIAN
text: Where's Jill?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Lillian!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: From Boston. Evan Twombley's son-in- law -- he was driving. I know where they're headed. Up the lake, Agaway. The old man's out deer hunting with Jack Hewitt, so they probably got some big weekend party planned.

name: Movie
speaker: LUGENE
text: I still don't understand --

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Mel Gordon.

name: Movie
speaker: LUGENE
text: Good. Who?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I know who it is.

name: Movie
speaker: LUGENE
text: Did you get his number?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Did you see that sonofabitch in the BMW? He could've killed somebody.

name: Movie
speaker: LUGENE
text: Are you okay, Wade? What was wrong? Why were you holding everyone up?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Don't be silly. Hi, Jill.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Don't lie to me. You're leaving me, I can see that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: I'm just cleaning out some of this stuff that's built up. For the rummage sale. And some things for the cleaners. And the laundromat.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Going somewhere, Margie?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Look, that's temporary, believe me. There's so much shit gonna hit the fan the next few days, my getting fired by LaRiviere and Merritt won't matter a bit.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: I heard you talking. You got fired this morning, didn't you?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It's my tooth! My fucking tooth! I can't even think anymore because of it.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: What on earth is happening to you? Why are you acting this way?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jesus Christ, Pop, let's go home. I got waylaid. Sorry.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: What happened?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Wade.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: This is nuts.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I don't know for Christ's sake!

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: How?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Of course! I would've heard.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Think they're alright?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Strange.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: The truck's here. Looks like they've stayed inside since the snow started.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Are you sure they're home? Did you call?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I just want to pick up my divorce papers. For the lawyer. It won't take long.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: I know your parents.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Don't you think it's proper for a fella to introduce his girl to his parents?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Did you tell them?  That we were coming?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Good.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Alright. I'll think about it.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It was to the same woman. I was just a kid...  It's not like a marriage proposal or anything, just a thought. Something for you and me to talk about and think about. You know?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You've been married twice --

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I've been thinking about it, that's all.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Oh, Wade.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: There's another thing I've been thinking about. I don't know how you feel about the idea, Margie, because we've never talked about it. But I've been thinking lately, I've been thinking we should get married sometime. You and me.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Then... I guess you have to.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm her father -- supposed to be, but I'm not able to. Yes. Yes, I am. It may be the only thing in my life I've been so clear about wanting. Even if it takes a big fight.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Don't you think, do you still think it's a good idea to press this custody thing -- just now?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: It's nice.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: After making love. I like it. It's nice to see that in a grown-up person.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: What way?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, but never what you looked like. Not really. Never really studied your face, like now. I was never able to see you as a kid when you were a kid until now, this way.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You knew me as a kid.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I can see what you looked like as a kid.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: But not now.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No. Not for money. But, if somebody'd given me half a damned excuse -- I was pretty fucked up, you know.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You wouldn't have done anything like that, shot someone for money.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No, I just know Jack's lying about what happened. He just seemed -- I know that kid, what he's like inside. He's a lot like I was at his age.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: The Mafia hire Jack Hewitt?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Lots of people. Guy like Evan Twombley, Boston union official, probably got lots of people want to see him dead. The Government's been investigating his links with the Mafia.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Jack wouldn't kill for it. Besides, who would pay him?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Everybody needs money. Except guys like Twombley and that sonofabitch son-in-law of his. People like that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Jack doesn't need money.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Money.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Wade! How can you even think such a thing? Why would Jack Hewitt do that, shoot Twombley on purpose?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I've been wondering if maybe Jack shot Twombley, instead of Twombley shooting himself. I've been wondering maybe Jack shot him on purpose.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: ...Jack's turned into one of those men who are permanently angry. He used to be a sweet kid, but it's like, when he found out he couldn't play ball anymore, he changed. Now he's like everyone else.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm sure, I'm positive it didn't happen the way Jack says it did.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: I heard he was drunk at Toby's last night and got in a fight with Hettie. He drove off without her...

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: There's something funny about that shooting. There's lots funny about it, actually.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Jack's sort of sensitive, I guess. More than most. But he'll be okay in a few weeks.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Okay.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Tonight. Let's get together.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Call me.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: The hell she isn't. Lillian's been trying to nail me to a cross since the day I met her. I'm gonna hire me a fucking lawyer from Concord and get this thing, this divorce thing, rearranged. I've been thinking about it a lot. It's like she owns Jill or something. Nobody owns nobody, especially not kids. And I pay her.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: No you don't. You're pissed, that's all. You ought to cool off for a few days then have a long talk with Lillian. You know? Work it out with her, tell her how you feel. Lillian's not out to get you.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. I mean that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You don't mean that.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm going to start one of those custody suits. I don't give a fucking shit. You know?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: I'm sorry.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Forget it.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: About you and Jill and needing a third person. She went back to Lillian?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Said what?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: I'm sorry about what I said.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You okay?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You okay?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: See you tomorrow, maybe.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Don't worry. I can protect my virtue. I mean, c'mon, Wade, give me a break.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You two want to do anything tomorrow and need a third party, give me a call, okay? I'm off.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Okay. She's fine.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: How's she doing?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: For a while.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: New hat?  Jill's up, I see.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Makes me sad it was her. Instead of me. I shoulda froze.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Can --?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: It makes me sad.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Is...? She's dead then?

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: When did she die?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Coffee's perked.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Maybe Wade should take a look at it. Your pipes'll freeze.  Wade, would you do that?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: It's broke I guess. There's an electric in the bedroom.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: You're not using it today?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: There's a furnace.

name: Movie
speaker: MARGIE
text: Have you been heating the house? Not just with the stove.

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: You get the hell out of my house now, asshole. And know this -- you are going to be a lucky asshole if I haven't got you fired before the day is out. I can do it with one phone call, and I'm pissed enough to do it now!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yes. Here's your ticket.

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: Doing your fucking job. I know. I watch television too.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Don't give me a hard time, Mr. Gordon. I'm just --

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: You're talking about a goddamned ticket, from when I passed you at the school where you were deciding to hold up traffic while dreaming of becoming a traffic cop or something?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Don't ever put your hands on me, Mr. Gordon.

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: Hold on!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yesterday morning, you passed a stopped school bus, which was flashing its lights, then you--

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: Moving violation! I just got out of bed and you're telling me you're giving me a goddamn speeding ticket? Now? Are you nuts? Is that it, Whitehouse? You're nuts?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm issuing you a ticket. Moving violation.

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: What the hell are you talking about?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jesus Christ. Mr. Gordon, when I come all the way to serve somebody a summons, I don't call ahead for an appointment.

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: I said, 'Next time, phone ahead.'

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: How's that?

name: Movie
speaker: MEL GORDON
text: Whitehouse. Next time, phone ahead.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. GORDON
text: Can't it wait, then?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Oh, no. No, it's a... it's a traffic thing. No big deal.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. GORDON
text: Something about my father?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Well, yeah, I suppose. Sure. I just had a little business to settle with Mr. Gordon. I'm the local police officer.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. GORDON
text: Mrs. Gordon. Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Well, yes, I'm... I want to say that I'm real sorry about your father, Mrs. Twombley.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. GORDON
text: He's asleep. We were up very late.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I was... I'm Wade Whitehouse. I was wondering, is your husband here?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. GORDON
text: Who are you?

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: No, he's out now. Somewhere on the mountain. I'd stay away from him if I were you. He's real pissed.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: He got his deer yet?

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: Well, I guess -- that's what he said.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: His office. You mean my old office.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: Wade, I got a message for you.  Jack Hewitt, he's looking for you. Wants you to clear your stuff out of his office in Town Hall.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: It's called a grilled cheese sandwich, you dub.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jillie, you want a cheese grilled sandwich?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No, I... I've been out on the grader all morning. Twombley's summer people. Massachusetts. Friend of Gordon's. It was his idea for Jack to take him hunting.  I gotta go.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: CB. Little while ago. One of the boys on the way in picked up Jack on the CB calling for state troopers. I figured you'd know what really happened. The fucking guy kill himself? This Twombley, who the fuck is he, anyhow?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where... how'd you hear that?

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: The other guy.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: The fucker shot himself. Ker-bang! That's what it sounds like. Not on purpose. I assume accidental.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Not since last night. He took a guy hunting.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: You talked to Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: Marg! You got orders!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: That goddamned woman. Thinks she can cart Jill off and leave me alone like this. I'm more than pissed, Margie. I'm a whole lot more than pissed. I been that plenty and I know the difference. This is different.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: Marg!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Aw, c'mon, I was only saying there's something wrong with "Home Made Cooking", that's all. The sign's fine. What it says is wrong.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: This town sucks.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I'm not finding fault. It's a good idea, good for you, good for the town. Real modern too.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: Fuck. Wade Whitehouse. It's people like you that keep this fucking town from prospering. Whatever somebody does to improve things around here, you gotta find fault with it.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: The sign. It looks like it's spelled wrong or something.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It don't look right.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You be careful of that little bastard. He's dying to get in your pants, you know.

name: Movie
speaker: NICK
text: Take care, Wade.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I don't know you. My goddamn father and I don't know you.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Nothing in the fucking house to drink. Not a fucking thing. My house, my money, my truck -- stolen!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Crawl!

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Where the Christ you going? You sonofabitch, you leave my fucking truck where it is! I need... Give me the Goddamn keys! I need to get me to town!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You and me.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Bang!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Everything you know is from me.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Call it what you want.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Love! I'm made of love!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Love! What the fuck do you know about love?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
