text: Nah-nah-naw! You done done finally done it! Like a man done it. Done it right. I love you, you mean sonofabitch!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You don't know me. You don't know me!  So fuck you. Fuck you.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: You! By Christ, you -- I know you.  Yeah, you goddamn sonofabitch, I know you. You're a goddamn fucking piece of my heart!

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: You think you can take me now? Come on, try.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Pop, for Christ's sake!

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Come on, smart guy. Tell how it's no big deal. Tell me how a single one of you is worth a single hair on that woman's head.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Listen, it's no big deal, Pop.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Wade. I thought she was alright. Till this morning she was.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Why didn't you call and have the furnace fixed?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: In the living room.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Is there something wrong with the phone?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: I checked on her. She had the electric heater. Cold don't bother her as much as me. Which is why I give her the heater.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: She's coming.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Where's Ma?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: We're alright. Your Ma's sleeping. You want me to get her?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: How you and Ma doing? Haven't seen you in town for a while.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: From Wickham's. Been a while. Like some coffee?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You remember Margie Fogg?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Sleeping.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jesus, Pop, how can you stand the cold, dressed like that? Where's Ma?

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: You no-good pup!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: What was that?  You got something to say, say it! Say it!

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: Atta-go.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Just do it.

name: Movie
speaker: POP
text: A lesson in work and its rewards. You'll thank me for this one day.  Sally, turn off that TV!

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Rolfe.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Take care of the little things first, the things that are distracting you from taking care of the big things. Call Chub Merritt, get your car back, call a dentist, for God's sake, and get your tooth pulled, don't trust the locals, get your facts straight and go straight to the state police. Let them work on this.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: To help, Jack, of course -- and to nail those sonsofbitches, the Two Gordons. That's what Alma calls them. Jesus, Rolfe, whose side are you on?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: For what?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I know what it means. I'm just running out of ways to use it.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: But you gotta hear this. You won't believe it. Mel Gordon had come by to visit LaRiviere and so now I'm in his office.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Wade, are you alright?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Then you accidentally see your body, or your face, or whatever, and you don't know who the hell it belongs to. Strange. It's the business with the old man, I know, and how incredibly pissed I was at him, and also chasing Jack Hewitt like that, and the Goddamned truck going through the ice, not to mention Margie's being so upset -- one thing on top of another.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: That's what you think.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: I remember clearly cause when I heard I became real careful around Pop. I was a careful child and I became a careful adult, but at least I wasn't afflicted by that man's violence.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Well, I never heard that one.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: And Elbourne and Mom took you to the doctor and told him you fell from the hay loft.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: We'd have to go digging in Vietnam to ask him.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: It wasn't me. I wasn't there, but I heard about it. When I heard about it, it was about Elbourne.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: You think I wouldn't remember a thing like that?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: It may have happened, but not the way you said.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Of course it happened. Why would I lie about it?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: I hate to disappoint you, but I don't think it happened.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: I was thinking about that story you told me, about Pop and chopping the firewood out of the ice and after.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: I care about what happened. The truth. I'm a student of history, remember?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Right's right, goddamnit! Don't you care what's right?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Not particularly.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It's too neat. Things ain't that neat. It makes me mad. That somebody can pay to kill somebody, his own father-in-law, and not be punished for it. Don't that piss you off?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Shit, around here, you shoot somebody in the woods, you say it was an accident, you get fined fifty bucks and your hunting license lifted. Jack's probably saying the guy shot himself cause he ain't got his deer yet and don't want his license pulled.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: A hunting accident is perfect.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: So Mel Gordon wouldn't want a professional hit. That'd make the feds dig deeper. He wants an accident.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Here's my theory. Twombley, unaware of illegal union loans or whatever, starts nosing around cause of the investigation and finds out. Finds out his son-in-law is involved.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, the guy with the BMW I told you about. I did, didn't I?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Okay. It's likely there are people in the union who don't want Twombley to testify. They probably include his son-in-law who's vice-president and will probably be the next president. I read that in the papers. What's his name, Mel Gordon?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I don't know. You tell me.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: They wouldn't deal with a guy like Jack. Who else benefits if Twombley is suddenly dead?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Who'd pay him that kind of money? Not the mob. They got their own guys. Specialists.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Money.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Motive. You gotta have a motive.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Well, your friend, I think. Jack Hewitt.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Then who shot him?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: That it wasn't an accident.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Which is?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: I think your first response to the Twombley shooting was the correct one.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Find them everywhere.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Want to know what I think happened?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I guess it was an accident, like everybody thinks.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Anything new about the shooting? Twombley?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I want to let the gas run out. I don't want the bastard driving drunk, and he's always drunk now. After, we'll hide the keys.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. She'll probably quit her job and stay out here with Pop. We can't leave him alone here, he'll set the damn place on fire. With Jill here a lot, it'll be good to have Margie around. Things are going to change in that department, by the way. I got a custody lawyer in Concord. I'm gonna see him tomorrow. All hell's gonna break loose, but it's worth it.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Well, do you still plan to get married?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: What about her?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: What about Margie?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah. I forgot.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: No thanks. I don't drink.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Anyone else want one? Rolfe?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: What about Jill? Is Lillian bringing her?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Pointless to stand around in church with nothing to do, I guess.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No, no, I haven't. Not really. I've growled a little, but I haven't bit.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Haven't you already done a bit of that?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: I get to feeling like a whipped dog some days, Rolfe, and some night I'm going to bite back. I swear it.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Get some sleep.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, I guess.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Don't think about it. You're exhausted.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: A divorce lawyer. A custody lawyer. You know, 'cause of Jill.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: What happened?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Jill. I was thinking of getting a lawyer. Maybe you can help me.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Who?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Picked up Jill. She was supposed to visit for the weekend for Halloween. She wanted to go home.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: How was she?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: The night before the shooting.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Lillian was here. In Lawford.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: They were out deer hunting, right? Jack probably heard the gun go off, then came back and found the body.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Well, it was an accident.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: You think Jack shot him?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No shit.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Twombley.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Who?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: He was scheduled to testify for a committee investigating organized crime in New England and the construction business.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: It'll come out Jack lied and the kid'll get hung for it.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: No, not tonight. I'm in bed too. I'm calling because I need you to listen. You're supposed to be a smart guy. You're a professor. I got this theory. Jack says he didn't see Twombley shot but he did.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Wade, it's late. I know you're probably at Toby's, but I'm in bed reading. We got different habits.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, I know him -- the kid that was with him. Maybe you do too. Jack Hewitt. He works for LaRiviere with me. He's my best friend.

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: There was something. It happened up your way.

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Yeah, brother, look, I was calling cause -- has there been anything on TV in Boston about a hunting accident with a guy named Twombley, Evan Twombley?

name: Movie
speaker: ROLFE
text: Wade?

name: Movie
speaker: WADE
text: Rolfe.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Jim... for godsake!

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Daddy. Daddy, please...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I'm sorry I was so mean to you earlier.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Yes dear?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Mom?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Big secret.  You said the same thing to Newsweek.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: You're right and I'll tell you a secret.  I know exactly how you feel.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: That's not really the point.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Some kids were teasing you?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I know...  But lotsa times I feel like it's me versus the world.  Some kid at school teases me and the same day a plague breaks out in Bangladesh.  I mean it doesn't take a genius to figure which is more important.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Your father never means to be so...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: When I write my memoirs I think I'll devote an entire chapter to the cocoa aboard Air Force One.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: No, it's okay.  After all, he is the President, right?

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: I'm sorry, honey.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: He's in a meeting.  He can't be disturbed.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I know, Mom.  It was great... really.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: We'll talk at home.  You know, most girls aren't as lucky as you.  For most girls seeing the Bolshoi ballet would be the experience of a lifetime.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Back at The Fishbowl?

text: You're jet-lagged.  We'll talk about this back...

text: Mom, just this once, give it a rest.

text: Alice...

text: Hey Joey, how `bout a cocoa, double whip cream.

text: I'm sure he's busy.

speaker: ALICE

name: Movie

speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: You are a resilient man, Mr.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: He didn't leave us.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: It would be a pity to squander such a strong personality.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Fuck off, you stupid asshole.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: That's the way of the world, little one. Didn't they teach you that in school?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: The woman you shot. She was my friend.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Yeah. Do you know what the word "asshole" means.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Smart for your age, eh? Top of your class? Tell me, do you know what the word "propaganda" means?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Yeah, I study world events. Five thousand Turkienistan Muslims were slaughtered in Stravanvitch's cleansings... along with 15 American school kids. You know hQw I studied that. I went to their funerals with my dad. I met their parents.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: So, you study world events, little one. That's good for a girl your age.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: You're one of Stravanavitch's men.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: No, thank you. The gunfire did that.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: You must be tired. It'll wake you up.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: I don't drink coffee.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Okay, I'm slowing us down.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: There they are!

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: It's okay, honey. I got you. I got you. You're okay.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Oh NY god... oh my god... oh my god...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Been better, Dad... You?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: How you doing, sweetie?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Alice... I...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Daddy...

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: Daddy...

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Alice!

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: How `bout a hug for the old man.

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE
text: It was the experience of a lifetime.

text: How was...  ...the ballet?

name: Movie
speaker: ALICE

speaker: CERALLOS
text: Warn then again. If they don't respond... shoot them down. We will not be intimidated.

text: The pilot says it is does not have the markings of a commercial jet.

name: Movie
speaker: CERALLOS
text: The world would not look on us kindly if we shot down a civilian airliner.

name: Movie
speaker: IRAQI SOLDIER
text: They are in our airspace. We would be within our rights.

name: Movie
speaker: CERALLOS
text: It's some kind of trick... a preliminary airstrike in response to our troop movement.

name: Movie
speaker: IRAQI SOLDIER
text: Yes. They refused to alter course and the 747 would not answer our hails.

name: Movie
speaker: CERALLOS
text: Did we warn them off?

name: Movie

text: The Americans say they are escorting a damaged plane. Our pilots confirm they are surrounding a 747.

speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
text: cross it...  The static overwhelms the voice, then cuts out.

speaker: MARSHALL
text: It's cut.

name: Movie
speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
text: Okay, you're aerated. To dump the fuel you have to close the circuit for the pump. There's no switch in Avionics so you'll have to cross the wires. There should be five wires, just to your left. Do you see them?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Okay, it's on. We've got some indicator lights here.

name: Movie
speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
text: Pop it open. There should be a red switch, toggle it up.

name: Movie

text: Uh, Tower, we got a problem up here.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Sluggish... I think it's jammed too.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Aw, man. You're torn up pretty bad out here, sir. Do you have any elevater control.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Lemme take a look.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: No. We're losing fuel and my rudder's not responding.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Just stay on my wing, sir. I'll take you all the way in.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Uh, we got a problem here.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: We still got three MiGs running around and six more on the way.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: How we doing, Colonel?

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Stay cool.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Got it.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Okay. We're gonna arc a fat one to the right. Got it?

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Two and three are heading toward the Boeing.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I'm doing what I can.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Who's flying the fucking plane?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: He's busy being dead.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Put your pilot on.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: You read my mind.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Mr. President, it's an honor. Now with your permission can we lead you the fuck out of here.

name: Movie
speaker: COL. CARLTON
text: Copy Air Force One. Welcome to the party.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: U.S. Pilots, this is Air Force One.

speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: That's game, set, and match. There's nothing to do, except call the Chief Justice.

speaker: DEAN
text: I prefered the terrorists.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: They've got no chutes. They can't control the plane, their engines are failing and they're losing fuel.

name: Movie
speaker: DEAN
text: This doesn't make sense.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: They aren't answering their hails.

name: Movie
speaker: DEAN
text: That kid's name was Jim Marshall.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: Walter, if you have a point, make it.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: Holding the president hostage is not something that slips your mind when you're making demands.

name: Movie
speaker: DEAN
text: We don't know that.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: He's dead then. They must have killed him.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: An exercise in futility. Send the Nimitz back in.

name: Movie
speaker: DOHERTY
text: The Iraqi ambassador is claiming it's just an exercise.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Put together a score sheet.  I'll make some calls.

name: Movie
speaker: DOHERTY
text: Apparently taking uzis away from sixth graders isn't as popular as we thought it'd be.  Representative Taylor is working on a compromise.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Thanks.  Wrote it last night.

name: Movie
speaker: DOHERTY
text: It was a good ad-lib, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Goddamn right I did.  I asked for a tough-as-nails speech and you gave me diplomatic bullshit.  What's the point in having a speech if I have to ad-lib?

name: Movie
speaker: DOHERTY
text: Sir, you threw out page two.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: To swear you in as President.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: The Chief Justice? What on earth for?

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: If fired upon, tell our fighters that they are ordered to engage.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: Iraqi's won't buy it. Either they're already in on this or they'll think we're spying.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: If challenged, our fighters are to state that they are on a rescue mission.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: Like any good poker player, they're checking over their hand seeing which cards to play and which to discard.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: They still have the President, it's past their deadline and they haven't called. What do you think it means?

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: Okay. Also, I want you to put our bases in Turkey on alert, and have the Kitty Hawk prepare a retaliatory air strike.

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: I hate to be pragmatic, but they'll sacrifice pawns before kings. It may take them some time to kill their way up to senior staff.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: But they start executing hostages in

name: Movie
speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
text: We've got four hours before they make it into Turkienistan airspace.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: Can we do that?

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: Does your office have anything to add, Mr. Dean?

text: General Greely says it looks like the Middle East.

speaker: GIBBS
text: My loyalty was never to my country.

speaker: MARSHALL
text: You're duty to what? The country you served doesn't exist anymore.

speaker: GIBBS

speaker: MARSHALL
text: Why?

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Yes, Mr. President.

text: Special Agent Gibbs. You helped do this?

text: Ga get it.

text: Air Force One, acknowledged.  tNT. EMERGENCY PARACHUTE LAUNCH RAMP.

text: Please change course to Zero Seven Four and drop to eighteen thousand feet. Over.

text: Air Force One, this is AF-135-RA. We have been instructed to refuel your plane.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: No! If we land this plane anywhere else, we will end up another Entebe.  The Americans built a super plane that flies through mushroom cloud, evades missiles and...  refuels in mid-air. Call the White House.

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Over the Black Sea. I can probably get us to Turkey or Georgia.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Where are we now?

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Not even close. Hell, we can't even make Syria or Iraq.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: We're not going to make it.

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: We've stopped dumping... but we've only got about twenty minutes of fuel left.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Go! Take Serge.. and watch your backs.

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Avionics compartment! It's the only place. You better get Zedeck down there fast Unless, of course, you'd rather be a martyr than a savior.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: How?

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Well it worked.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Psychology. They're trying to unnerve us.

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: why did they do that?

speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Remarkable aircraft. Remarkable.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: A secret service agent. It must be.

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: We checked the manifest. Everyone was accounted for.

speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Who did this?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Any of us?

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Nine.

speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: How many others killed?

name: Movie
speaker: GIBBS
text: Dead.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV

text: This is Romeo Tango Zulu changing call signs.  Tower, alert air traffic, Romeo Tango Zulu is now Air Force One.  This is Air Force One... The President is safe onboard.

text: Tower, Air Force One has been boarded.

text: Very good. Thank you, Ms. Mitchell.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: You're pointing a gun at me.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: Scared. We're scared.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: How are your fellow hostages feeling, Ms. Mitchell?

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: I'm responsible for Press Relations for the Flight Office.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: And what is it you do, Ms. Mitchell.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: Maria... Maria Mitchell.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: *                     Please tell me your name.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: Here's a press kit.  I'll let you guys get comfortable and once we're airborne I'll be able to schedule the interviews.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: Conference rooms, though some have other functions.  The one up front doubles as an emergency medical center.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: And all these rooms here?

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: I guess it depends on your perspective.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: A dubious distinction, no?

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: You don't know the half of it.  Did you know this entire plane is shielded from radiation?  We could fly through a mushroom cloud completely unharmed if necessary.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: This is a remarkable aircraft.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: Up on the upper deck is the cockpit and the Mission Communication Center. The MCC, as we call it, can place clear and secure phone calls to anywhere on earth.  We're linked to a network of military and civilian satellites and ground stations.  We could run the country or run a war from there if we had to.

name: Movie
speaker: MITCHELL
text: The President and I were delighted that we could accommodate you.  Now if you're all cleared?  You can follow me then.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Ms.  Mitchell.  So nice to finally meet you in person.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: You're very valuable. And our nation needs so many things.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: You got what you wanted. You going to release us now?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Three...

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Jim...

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Four...

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Please. You can kill me but leave my daughter alone.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: The world is such a dangerous place and we can't always protect our children.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: You will be the first to pay for that mistake.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Nor will there be. My husband does not negotiate with terrorists.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Say something dear.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Shall I begin by executing the President's daughter? She's right here.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: So is this.  Come now, you're upsetting the little one.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: That was war.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: But they are not ny people. You look at me as if I am a monster, but answer me this -- when your planes bombed the oil fields of Iraq, did You cry for those dark skinned men whose names you do not know and who's faces You will never see? Did You cry for their wives and children. They were people too, yes... but they were not your people.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: How can you? I mean they're people.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: I neither enjoy nor dislike. I do what is necessary.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Why? Do you enjoy it?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Yes

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Do you have to be so brutal?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Your husband is a coward. He sends soldiers half-way around the world to steal a man from his home in the middle of the night.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: My husband is a very courageous man.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: I know he left you behind.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: What do you know of my husband?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Or you will do what, Mrs. Marshall?  But I admire your courage. Your husband, on the other hand...

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Leave my daughter alone.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Come on, Alice.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Now, or he dies, please.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Cooperation. If you try to escape, you will be met with automatic gunfire and a barricade of your comrade's bodies will prevent you from exiting. Good day.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: What do you want with us?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Fear will keep you alive. Any one who is not afraid is bound to do something foolish, and bound to die.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Hold on, Alice.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: No you won't. You'll compromise... like always.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: If you put down the gun, I promise not to drop her on the way down.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Let my daughter go or I'll take you out!

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: There goes your ride.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: One thing I've learned as

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: The taste of defeat is bitter, no?

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: You don't like seeing people get hurt. Now in morality, that is a virtue. In politics, however, that is weakness.  You were a hostage to everyone else *                    long before you were a hostage to

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Someday, you'll regret my nature.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Good. Good.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Yes, I'll do it.  Just leave my family alone.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: You'll do it?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Stop.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Pity. Mr. Gibbs.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: This administration does not negotiate with terrorists.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Call up Petrov and order Stravanavitch' S release.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: She isn't a part of this. This is between you and me.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: No. But since I only have a few of your staff left to kill, perhaps I will start with your family instead... Gibbs.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Over my dead body.

name: Movie
speaker: KORSHUNOV
text: Now since we've had very little luck getting Washington or Moscow to cooperate, I wondered if you would be so kind.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: I'm sure we can strike some sort of arrangement. Land the plane and we'll trade you hostages for fuel.

name: Movie
speaker: LEE
text: Finally, we can bargain.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: Yes. You've made yourself quite clear.

name: Movie
speaker: LEE
text: Madame Vice president. We have an options paper.  chandler takes the options paper, waves off Lee, and reads it as she talks.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: You heard me.  You. Congress and cabinet heads.

name: Movie
speaker: LEE
text: Twenty minutes?

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: Okay, Gentlemen, we'll take no action until we confirm that the president is off the plane... Lee, go huddle with the D.O.D. I want an options paper on this in 20 minutes.

name: Movie
speaker: LEE
text: Our only policy assumes the plane is on the ground. Our hands are completely tied while they're in the air.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: That isn't necessary.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: Sir, we stay with the President.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I'll not going without my family.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Got it.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: Eighteen thousand feet, sir. And two hundred knots... otherwise it's suicide.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Get `em ready.  You... come with me.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: They've cut communication, and I spent a good bit of time looking for alternatives. My only solution ran out of batteries.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: We can't jump from here or at this speed. But if we could get a message out - tell the refueling plane...

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: We've already played our cards, Major. There's no turning back.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: Gravity.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Mr. Caidwell, the ground's a few miles away. How do you propose getting us from here to there?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Tell our boys to cool their jets. I don't need `em creating policy for me.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: The northern border's gotten a bit hairy. Their MiGs are playing tag with our Tomcats and our boys are just itching to engage.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: They've gotta be joking.

name: Movie
speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
text: Our KH-ll's took this one at 0100 hours. What you see here is the mobilization of two mechanized brigades.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: You haven't even driven a car since you took office.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Flying the plane.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: What are you doing?

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Both of you.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Call Petrov...  I'll be back.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Please... don't start with me.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: I don't know why you stayed.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Shall I ask the Chief of Staff to schedule your daughter in?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Look on the bright side, hon. Shep here thinks I'll be a one termer.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Well, they aren't burning me in effigy. That's always a good sign.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: How did your speech go?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: This promise isn't subject to Congressional approval.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: I should trust that promise? Because you know the voters are still waiting for that middle class tax cut.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I'll make it up to you, I promise.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I wish it were that easy...

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: But that's the point, Jim. We're right here.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I miss you. And I miss her.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: You know what?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: And when have I had five minutes? When I wake up in the morning and I'm already three hours behind Schedule.  What do you want me to do, Rose, tell the G7 to fuck off because I'm a family man?

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: How do you know she understands? You haven't spent more than five minutes with her, or me, in weeks.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: She's a big girl.  She understands.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: For godsakes, Jim, slow down and stop acting like the little dutch boy.  Not even you can plug all the world's leaks.  Don't you think it's a sign you're pushing too hard when your daughter sees more of you on MTV news than in person.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Rose, I don't have time for this.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: Don't.  I know spin control when I feel it.

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: No, Mr. President.  It can't.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Can't it wait?

name: Movie
speaker: ROSE
text: May I speak to you for a moment?

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: Actually, sir, you could be that someone.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Someone should give you a raise.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: White House Situation room.

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: Where are we sending it?

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: No. I thought about this, Mr.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: No good. I said they disabled the communications system.

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: The fax machines.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Excuse me?

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: The fax machines.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Freeing Stravanavitch is gonna get tens of thousands killed. I can't live with that.  I'm not royalty. I'm an elected official and the integrity of the office of the President is infinitely more important than the man who holds that office.  We don't negotitate. Not as long as I'm President. Is that understood?

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: Please, Mr. President. You're going to get yourself killed. Is that your solution?

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: But this is different, sir. You're the President.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: You know my policy. We don't negotiate with terrorists. If we start now, all of America becomes a target.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: and if that means negotiating...

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Then tell me there's a rescue operation underway.

name: Movie
speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
text: They're still alive, but the loyalists plan to start killing hostages in forty minutes.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Did they say anything about my family?

name: Movie
speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
text: Two... THREE. GO!

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: But...

name: Movie
speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
text: One.

name: Movie
speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
text: We're handling it, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Where's my family?

name: Movie
speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
text: We're under attack.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: What's going on?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: No. no. no. Wait. Wait.

name: Movie
speaker: SWITCHBOARD
text: Thank you for calling the white House...

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Look lady, I don't have time for games. Just put the....

name: Movie
speaker: SWITCHBOARD
text: Okay... if you're the President, when's your wife's birthday?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: You don't understand. This is an emergency. Let me talk to anyone.

name: Movie
speaker: SWITCHBOARD
text: Sir, the President does not call this particular number. So whoever you are get a life, before I have this call traced.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Don't cut me off. This is an emergency.

name: Movie
speaker: SWITCHBOARD
text: Yeah, right.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: This is the President.

name: Movie
speaker: SWITCHBOARD
text: who can I say is calling?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Okay listen, listen carefully. This is an emergency call from Air Force One. Who's there? Is the Vice- President there?

name: Movie
speaker: SWITCHBOARD
text: White House switchboard. How may I direct your call.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: We're hooked. Hove into position.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: WE'RE HOOKED!

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: DO YOU SEE TEEM?

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: IT'S OPEN!

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: They better. Fuel's almost gone.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Twenty five minutes. They should be here any moment.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Twenty-five years.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: How long's it been since you flew, sir?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Shit.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Iraq? Shep, you're fired.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Iraq, sir. We're over Iraq.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: A MiG? Where the hell are we?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: My god. I think that was a MiG.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Sir...

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Shepherd.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I never left. Where's my wife and daughter?

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Mr. President, how the hell did you get on board?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Okay.  Hey, pumpkin, you'll tell me all about it later, right?

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Mr. President... they're ready for you in the conference room.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Defense and State Department in the conference room in one hour.  I want to review the Iraq situation.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: That's my job.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: You give me ulcers.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: We'll just say it was in bad taste.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I said it's not worth the fight.  Steward, please.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Did we tape the Duke game?

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Sir, the Speaker of the House attacked this administration on national television.  You can't afford to leave that hanging.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: It's bait.  Don't take it.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: Right... Christ I'm tired.  Do me a favor and keep me away from the press.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Other way around, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: This is a crime bill, Shep.  Killing a couple ducks won't get it through committee.  Besides, Shep, I told you...  I don't shoot babies and I don't kiss guns.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: *                     We could always put you in a duck blind with a twelve gauge.  The second amendment types'll love that.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I might still have a few chips left.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: With all due respect, sir, maybe you should give them this one.  Your numbers are still pretty low and you called in a lot of chips to nail Stravanavitch.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: He and the NRA don't like the wording.

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: No, no.  I'm fine.  What did the Speaker say?

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: You wanna knock of f?

name: Movie
speaker: MARSHALL
text: I always wondered if my freshman Russian class would come in handy.

name: Movie
speaker: SHEPHERD
text: *                     CBS said they'll give us four minutes.  They thought the Russian was a nice touch.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: Commissioner, Aquarius.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: Kruger, Sagittarius.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: I was asking McCrosky, Commissioner.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: Some southern plantation owner falls in love with this poor...

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: What's the story?

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: I was reading too.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: Forget it.  I was reading.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: You've made your point, Commissioner. There's only one other pilot who can handle that shuttle and that's Clarence Oveur.  He's got a lunar flight today.  I want him pulled.  Jacobs, pull Oveur!

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: I told you, leave the boys in Washington to the boys downtown and the boys down...

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: I wonder how your boys in Washington are going to take this one.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: That just doesn't make any sense.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: That's right, Commissioner.  Senselessly murdered just minutes ago.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: I just wish it was that simple.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: Commissioner.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: You handle your front office people, I'll handle the press and leave the boys in Washington to the boys downtown and the boys downtown to the boys on the board.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: Bud, get wise to the political realities. The boys on the board are under a lot of pressure from the boys downtown.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: And what do the boys on the board know about safety, Commissioner?  Let <u>me</u> talk to them.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMISSIONER
text: Forget it.  The boys on the board want that shuttle to go on schedule.

name: Movie
speaker: KRUGER
text: Commissioner, we both know the Mercury shuttle needs another month of pre-launch testing.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: Um...  Do you people scream right when you... you know.

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: What is it, Mary?

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: Yes it did.  Mr. Dunn, can I ask you a personal question?

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: Felt like a large asteroid.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: Yes I did...

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: Did you feel that?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: You better take this.

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: Sir?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Dunn.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: You better check on it, Mr. Dunn.  I'll stay here and fly the ship.

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: Sir, I've got an overload in disposal unit four.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: You better check it, Unger.

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: We seem to have a malfunction in disposal unit four, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: Accelerators down.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Shut down accelerators.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Dunn.

name: Movie
speaker: DUNN
text: Oveur.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Kramer, the WORP control handle just came off in my hand.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, the lever!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Compute!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Now!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Set!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: We've blown the computer!  Elaine!  Set course change!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I guess you'd have to be a fool not to be afraid at a time like this.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Not when I'm with you, Ted.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Are you afraid?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: The sun will heat that thing to over 450 degrees within seconds.  He'll roast like a pig on a spit.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: What will happen to him, Ted?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: That's right -- premature ejection.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: You mean...

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Sit down, Elaine.  If this bomb trick works we just might make it.  Simon was a fool to eject now.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon just ejected!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: That might be the news we've been waiting for.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I just want you to know, I love you Ted and always will.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Well, Elaine, this might be it if those guys on the ground don't think of something.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: That was very well put, Ted.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Kurtz was the one who got us into this mess in the first place.  You people knew this ship wasn't ready to fly.  You played God with over a hundred lives, Kruger, and for what -- the prestige of your precious space program.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I mean until we start to burn up.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Not now, Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, we've only got ten minutes.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, please be careful.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine, I'm going back there.  Just hold onto that stick and try to control this hunk of tin as best you can.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, there's no time to explain.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine, what's going on?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, a toilet's not going to kill anyone.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: There's something dangerously wrong with this ship, Elaine.  I know its the wiring. That toilet's just the tip of the iceberg.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I'd use the word insane.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: What would you say if I told you the toilet just blew up in my face.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: The word is sick.  Ted -- very, very, very sick.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: What word would you use, Elaine?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I've never used the word insane, Ted.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Then you <u>do</u> think I'm insane.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, get a grip on yourself.  You should never have left the hospital.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine, I mean the mission has to be aborted.  This ship should never have passed FSA inspection.  This thing is held together by string and chewing gum.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: We can't go back.  We had something very special, but it's all over.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine, we have to go back.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted.  I don't know why you got on this flight.  I don't know what you're trying to prove.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Not now, Elaine!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I've got it, Elaine!  I've figured out what's wrong with the shuttle!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: What are you doing, Ted?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Let me by, Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, we're taking off!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I have to get in there.  I have to stop this flight.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted!  What are you...?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Goodbye, Ted.  I don't want to hurt you.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: That's the way I want it.  Just turn the radio on and go.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: If that's the way you want it.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: No goodbyes, Elaine.  Just go.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, you must remember what the doctor said, the first step on the road to sanity is admitting that you're sick.  Now take your electro-shock and you'll be back at the space center in no time.  And by the way, Ted, I'm leaving you for Simon.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: His name's David Stockman.  He's been here twenty years, that's all he says.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: And when are you going to realize, Ted, that your mental hygiene is the most important thing right now.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine, when are you going to realize Simon Kurtz put me in here to get me out of the way.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Sammy Davis Junior.  Terrible car accident.  He hasn't been the same since.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Who's that, Ted?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Eat this spaghetti, Ted.  It'll make you feel a lot better.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, I loved you and I'll always love you. But I need Simon.  He's stable.  He's a good provider.  I want that at this stage of the game, Ted.  He might have his faults, but Simon doesn't know the meaning of the word fear and I need that in a man.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine, what happened to us?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, please.  You're just making things difficult for yourself.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: You're as bad as the rest of them, Elaine!  It's all here in the design specifications!  Look!  It's all here!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Let's relax tonight, just the two of us. I'll make a quiet Italian dinner just the way you like it, with spaghetti.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: There's nothing wrong with me!

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, you're overworked.  You've been flying yourself into the ground.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Ask Simon.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, what's wrong?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I mean the Mercury flight.  It's not safe and, Kurtz, you know why.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: But, Ted, the invitations have already gone out.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: It's got to be stopped!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: That's not important now, Elaine.  We have to talk.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: RUMACK
text: Yes -- last week that pile of mud was only this high.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Is he making any progress, Doctor?

name: Movie
speaker: RUMACK
text: The brain is an amazingly complex organ, Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Is that a good sign, Doctor?

name: Movie
speaker: RUMACK
text: You can be gentle with him, Elaine.  He's been working out a lot of his aggressions here in the garden.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I mean for Ted.

name: Movie
speaker: RUMACK
text: You can eat balanced meals, exercise, and take Geritol.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: What can <u>I</u> do, Doctor Rumack?

name: Movie
speaker: RUMACK
text: So you see, our task isn't made any easier by Ted's refusal to admit that he's sick.

name: Movie
speaker: RUMACK
text: The human brain is a highly complex organ, Elaine, perhaps the most complex next to the bladder.  Let me show you.  Ted's problem is in this area.  This area, this area, here, here, here, under here, here...

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted seemed to get worse after I told him about Simon, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon, what are you saying?!

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Maybe.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon, I didn't want it to end like this. We can be friends!  You'll die out there.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Your career!  What about the lives of those people out there.  Simon, what happened to the man I thought I loved?

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: My career is shot.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: We're computer locked and the manual navigation unit is down.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Can't we change course?

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: He tried to disconnect ROK.  It gassed him.  That computer is running this ship and we're heading right for the sun.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon, what's happening?!

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Roger.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon, I'm going to check ROK's secondary readout unit.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: That's my girl.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I think so.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Have you got it straightened out now?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Don't be too long.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Meet me onboard, sweetheart.  I have to pick up a few things at the drugstore.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: So mentally ill?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon, why has he become so... so...

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Elaine!  Ted's a danger to himself, he's a threat to this mission and his behavior does absolutely nothing to promote peace in the Middle East.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: No, I've been excited before.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: I guess this is a first for you.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I'm so excited, Simon.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Frank's the best pilot in the program.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: You're heading up the division in charge of babies for Mr. and Mrs. Simon Kurtz.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: But, darling, they've offered me a chance to head up the computer analysis division for the Jupiter probe.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Women <u>and</u> the space program have come a long way, sweetheart.  But after the wedding, no more complicated computers for my little girl.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: And I can hardly believe that I'm engaged to someone like you, Simon.  I'm a very lucky woman.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Who would believe that Elaine Thompson was once a stewardess on the Denver-Chicago run.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Simon.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: For the best little computer officer on the Mercury mission.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Roger.  You better get back there and monitor the regulatory unit.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: No, I mean you can do it from the cockpit.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: I'd rather sit down for this one, Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: You can do it from up here, Captain.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Roger.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: We have to disconnect ROK's higher brain functions without disturbing his regulatory system.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: I see.  What do you think our alternatives are?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I don't think we have any alternative, Captain.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Elaine, ask ROK for a field interference scan.  Those sun spots might give us a problem with our communications.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: There's nothing wrong with me, Elaine. What about tonight -- just you and me.  We can be alone.  I can get rid of everyone else on the ship -- I've already proven <u>that</u>.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Request; self-analysis of ROK hardware and software systems regarding behavioral changes.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Life support check.  Elaine, it's obvious you've been ignoring me.  You're a woman. I can relate to that.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Request; life support systems check.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Systems check positive.  Look, Elaine, I...

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Request; comprehensive electrical systems check.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: You have great tits.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Go ahead.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Can I say something of a personal nature to you?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: That's okay, ROK.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Elaine, I'm sorry about that little outburst a moment ago.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Cut the Doubting Thomas shit, Elaine.  I know where I'm coming from on this.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: That's not possible.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Negative.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: That doesn't make sense.  Repeat analysis.

name: Movie
speaker: ROK
text: Negative.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Intermitant failure in scan mode "R". Analyze.

name: Movie
speaker: JOHN
text: Look, a man can make an honest mistake!! Anyway, she was asking for it!  They're all asking for it all the time!!

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: No more kids yelling, 'Your old man's a thieving rapist'?

name: Movie
speaker: JOHN
text: How many kids get a chance to live on another planet.

name: Movie
speaker: JOHN
text: It's going to be terrific.  A whole new world, new kids to play with.

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: Do you think things will be a lot different on Mercury, Dad?

name: Movie
speaker: JOHN
text: I bet Scraps is going to love Mercury.

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: I sure an glad they let Scraps ride up here with us.

name: Movie
speaker: JOHN
text: We'll have to check, Jimmy.  It's a pretty long trip to Mercury.

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: Will Scraps be able to sit with us, Dad?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Do you like it when Scraps sleeps on his back, Jimmy?

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: He's a boy dog.

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: Sure.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Can I hold him?

name: Movie
speaker: JIMMY
text: Scraps.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Come on up, Jimmy.  Say, that's some puppy.  What's his name?

name: Movie
speaker: WIFE
text: What...?

name: Movie
speaker: JOE
text: All right.  Here.

name: Movie
speaker: WIFE
text: Okay, Joey.  The Doc says you gotta relax. This hospital in Des Moines is the best sex clinic in the country.

name: Movie
speaker: JOE
text: I don't want to hear that word!

name: Movie
speaker: WIFE
text: Joey, what's more important, the kids' clothes or your sexual potency.

name: Movie
speaker: JOE
text: We've spent everything on these operations.  Is it really worth it?  We've pawned your mother's wedding ring.  The kids have no winter clothes...

name: Movie
speaker: WIFE
text: Take this, Joey.  It's my last few bucks. You'll need a hot meal when you get there.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I'm sure.

name: Movie
speaker: JOE
text: You're sure?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: That's right, Joe.  Now, no one's going to hurt you and no one has to know what's wrong with you.

name: Movie
speaker: JOE
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Joe, the insurance policy won't help your wife and kids.  You bought auto insurance, not life insurance.

name: Movie
speaker: JOE
text: I don't want to live anymore.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Joe, you don't want to blow that thing and kill all these innocent people.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Have you tried it with a little cinnamon?

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: Captain, the coffee machine is jammed and I don't like it.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Poached!  Not over!  Over!

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: All right, Captain Oveur.  Over.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: That's how I want them.  Poached.  Over.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Just poached on toast.  Over.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: Poached <u>and</u> over, Captain Oveur?  Over.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: No.  Poached.  Over.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: How would you like your eggs, Captain? Over.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: A couple eggs and juice would be nice, Mary.  Over.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Anything.  Just don't let Salucci think we're onto him.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: What should I say?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: No, a bomb.  Now, as discreetly as possible, I want you to move the passengers into the lounge.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: A b...

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: He's carrying a bomb.

name: Movie
speaker: MARY
text: Sixteen 'C', why?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Which passenger is Joe Salucci?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Yes, sir, commander.  This is Mercury One.  Everything seems A- okay up here and ready for count-down.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Whenever your're ready, Captain.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Captain Oveur, your navigator, Mr. Unger, and your first officer, Mr. Dunn.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Good to be aboard, gentlemen.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Do you think it's necessary to explain <u>everything</u>?

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: That's how dry cleaning works.  Now I'd like to quickly go over the digestive system of amphibians.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: We don't have much time.  Let's move. I'll explain everything.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Mr. Kurtz, I presume.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Captain Oveur?

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Now he's D-Y-I-N-Ging and wants to be buried on Mercury.

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: Ah, yes, the Institute, I'm familiar with it.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Let's go, Daddy.  We have to check in.  He was never appreciated at the Institute.

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: It's a privilege to meet you, sir, I'm familiar with all your work.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: Say, isn't that Dr. Barrington, the world- renowned agronomist?

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Thanks, but we have a terrific woman in on Thursdays.

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: You folks need any help?

name: Movie
speaker: RECEPTIONIST
text: But that's not a door.  The door's over there.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Don't try to stop me!

name: Movie
speaker: RECEPTIONIST
text: You can't go in there!

name: Movie
speaker: RECEPTIONIST
text: Death, death.  How about the first Thursday in March, ten o'clock.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: All right, it's a matter of death.

name: Movie
speaker: RECEPTIONIST
text: You'll have to be more specific than that, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: No, dammit.  It's a matter of life or death.

name: Movie
speaker: RECEPTIONIST
text: Do you have an appointment, sir?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I have to see Bud Kruger.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Pull yourself together!  We've got to...

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Don't talk to me about Elaine.  Outta my way!

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Then Elaine was right.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: That damn computer has taken over.  I'm getting out.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Kurtz, you're drunk.  Who's in command of this ship?

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: Striker.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I know you've been subtly spreading the word that I'm having a breakdown.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: You're tired, Striker, overworked.  That wiring meets all the safety specifications.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Look at this wiring.  It's shorting out under high temperatures.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: You're seeing bugs where they don't exist, Striker.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMON
text: That's right, Striker.  And we're getting married when we return.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Are you on the Mercury mission?

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Well, we laughed.  We laughed all the time.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: No.  It's hard to L-A-U-G-H when your father's dying.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I just wish it was that simple.  We really were in love.  You know how it is when you laugh all the time.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Then the relationship remains the same and the love changes only when there's change in the two people who share that love.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Sure.  But that's only when the love itself goes unchanged.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Not if the people change together in relation to that love.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: People change in relation to each other. Love changes on its own.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Love's the same as it always was.  It's people who change.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: We were in love but I'm not sure I know what love is anymore.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: No.  I mean your relationship.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I opened this panel and a vacuum cleaner hit me.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Do you want to talk about it.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: No, I mean your head.  Sit down.  I'll take a look at it.  I'm a nurse.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I'm getting over it.  If a relationship isn't working, you can't force it.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: You've been hurt.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: You don't have to excuse yourself.  I'm a nurse.  I understand.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: I'm familiar with your work, Doctor. You'll have to excuse me, I have to go.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Yes.  He's dying <u>a-n-d</u> wants to be buried on Mercury.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Not Dr. Barrington, the world renowned agronomist?

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: You don't have to thank me, I'm a nurse. This is my father, Dr. Barrington.

name: Movie
speaker: TED
text: Uh... oh, thank you.  It's nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: STELLA
text: Excuse me, are you alright?  I noticed you talking to yourself.  I'm a nurse.  Can I be of some help?

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: That's a very nice compliment, and I'd like to say that...you've done the same for me.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: Just in case I don't have a chance to say goodbye, I want you to know that I haven't spent so many pleasant hours for many years.

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: No. I'm all alone.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: I'm sure we'll both make it...but just in case one of us...well, is there a message you'd like me to give someone?

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: That's a lovely name. Mine's Milton...Milt Ettenhenim. But my friends call me 'Bubbles.'

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: Mine's Eleanor. Eleanor Schiff.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: You know, here we are having coffee together, and discussing education and business and economy...and we don't even know each other's names...full names I mean.

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: I wish I could fool myself into believing that that's the reason. The truth of the matter is, nobody ever asked me.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: I know the answer -- Career. A smart woman like you became so involved in your work, you didn't have time for marriage.

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: Well, I'm afraid that's a question that's all too easy to answer.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: But I think it's time we stopped talking about me. A woman like you -- why haven't you ever married?

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: Well, after a thing like that you wouldn't be expected to.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: After my wife died, I felt like a fifth wheel. You know, so many years being with one person -- a very wonderful person -- makes you always think of yourself as part of a pair...When Ethel passed away, I was lost. I couldn't function socially and I couldn't function in business.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: No. I'm from Washington, D.C. I'm a lobbyist for the Small Businessmen's Assocation.

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: Well, it really wasn't a vacation. You see, I'm a teacher in the New York City school system, and I was attending a seminar on visual aids to education. Are you from L.A.?

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: Were you vacationing in Los Angeles?

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: No, thank you. I take it black. Like my men.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: Thank you. Cream?

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: Ah, won't you sit down?

name: Movie
speaker: BERNICE
text: That's very nice of you. Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: MILTON
text: I happened to be passing, and I thought you might like some corfee.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. KRAMER
text: Shep, no! He gets so excited when new people are here.

name: Movie
speaker: CAREY
text: ...but after...awhile...you begin to...  ...get used to it.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. KRAMER
text: Shep, no! I'll bet you have exciting things happen all the time down there.

name: Movie
speaker: CAREY
text: Yeah, something like that, but as I say, they didn't have time to tell me very much.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. KRAMER
text: Something about a plane with no pilot?

name: Movie
speaker: CAREY
text: Well, to tell the truth, they really didn't fill me in on many of the details. Just told me to pick up Captain Kramer.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. KRAMER
text: Shep, sit...sit! So, I understand you've got a real emergency down there.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. KRAMER
text: Oh, yes. Come in, Paul. Rex will be right out.

name: Movie
speaker: CAREY
text: Hello, I'm Paul Carey from the airline. I'm here to pick up Captain Kramer.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Excuse me, Doc, I've got a plane to land.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: And the last thing he said to me, "Doc," he said, "Sometime when the crew is up against it and the breaks are beating the boys, tell them to go out there with all they've got and win just one for the Zipper. I don't know where I'll be then, Doc," he said, "but I won't smell too good. That's for sure."

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: George Zipp said that?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: I'm doing everything I can! -- And stop calling me Shirley!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Surely there must be something you can do.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: I won't deceive you, Mister Striker. We're running out of time.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Yes, everything they've got. How are the passengers doing?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Will the hospital equipment be at the airport?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Chicago, the passengers are beginning to panic. When do we start down?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: ...safe and sound and free to pursue a life of religious fulfillment.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Let's see. Those are the flaps, that's the thrust, this must turn on the landing lights.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Elaine, I haven't time to put this gently, so I'll be very direct. Everyone of us on this plane is in a desperate situation. Mister Striker is the only hope we've got.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Well, I flew single-engine fighters in the Air Force, but this plane has four engines. It's an entirely different kind of flying...<u>all</u> <u>together</u>!!!

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: I <u>am</u> serious, and don't call me Shirley! What flying experience have you had?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Surely you can't be serious.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Can you fly this airplane and land it?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Both pilots!

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: I'm not sure. I haven't seen anything like this since the Lina Wertmuller Film Festival.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: What is it, Doctor? What's happening?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: No, I mean we can't <u>land</u> for another two hours. Fog has closed down everything this side of the mountains. We've got to go through to Chicago!

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: You can't take a guess for another two hours?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Well...not for another two hours.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Can't you take a guess?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: I can't tell.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Captain, how soon can we land?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: I think you ought to know what our chances are. The life of everyone on board depends on just one thing: finding someone back there who not only can fly this plane, but who didn't have fish for dinner.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: No. No one that I know of.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Well...

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: All right. Unless I can get all these people to a hospital quickly, I can't even be sure of saving their lives. Now, is there anyone else on board who can land this plane?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Elaine, you're a member of this crew. Can you face some unpleasant facts?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Extremely serious. It starts with a slight fever.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Just how serious is it, doctor?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: He had fish, too.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Let's see now. The co-pilot had fish. What did the navigator eat?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Doctor Rumack, Mister Hammen ate fish. And Randy says there are five more cases, and they ate fish, too.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: He had fish.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: What did he have?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Yes, yes, I remember. I had lasagna.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Well, we had a choice. Steak or fish.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: What was it we had for dinner tonight?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Certainly.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: It's a big building with patients. But that's not important right now. Tell the Captain I must speak to him.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: A hospital? What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: You'd better tell the Captain. We've got to land as soon as we can. This woman has to be gotten to a hospital.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: Yes. Yes, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: We have some passengers who are very sick. Could you come and take a look at them?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. RUMACK
text: That's right.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Sir. Excuse me, sir. I'm sorry to have to wake you. Are you a doctor?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Uh-huh.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: See them, Elaine?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: The gear is down.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Tell them the gear is down and we're ready to land.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I wanted you to know -- now -- I'm very proud.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted...

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: I don't care. I just don't have what it takes. They'd be better off with someone who'd never flown before.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: But Ted, you're the only...

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Oil pressure. I forgot to check the oil pressure. When Kramer hears about this, the shit's gonna hit the fan.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: What happened, Ted? What went wrong?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Rats! I've lost number three.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: It's a damn good thing you don't know how much he hates your guts.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: It's a damn good thing he doesn't know how much I hate his guts.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Sluggish. Like a wet sponge.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Sluggish. Like a wet sponge.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: And a little ice!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: And a little ice.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Rain.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: That's what I've been trying to tell these people.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted! What are you doing? You can't fly this plane!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: A lot of people made plans before the war. Like George Zipp.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, I don't want to stay here. It's time for us to go back home -- to the plans we made before the war.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: I think they're getting the hang of it! When we re-enlist I'll teach them baseball!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: That's Lieutennt Hurwitz. Severe shell shock. He thinks he's Ethel Merman.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: What's his problem?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Be patient, Ted. No one expects you to get over this immediately.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: I wish I could say the same for George Zipp.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Seven. Lieutenant Zipp died this morning. Ted, Doctor Sandler says you'll be out in a week. Isn't that wonderful?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Is it? Because of my mistake six men didn't return from that raid.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: It's a big building where the generals meet. But that's not important right now. They've cleared you of any blame for what happened on that raid. Isn't that good news?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Headquarters!? What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: You got a telegram from head?quarters today.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: But it won't be. Not as long as you insist on living in the past!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: That's the way I've always wanted it to be, Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Mostly I remember...the nights when we were together. I remember how you used to hold me...and how I used to sit on your face and wriggle...and then afterwards how we'd watch until the sun came up. When it did, it was almost like...like each new day was created...only for us.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I remember everything. All I have are memories.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Elaine, just hear me out. I know things haven't been right for a long time. But it will be different...like it was in the beginning. Remember?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I love you.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: I love you, Elaine.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Oh, Ted, please be careful. I worry about you so much.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: My orders came through. My squadron ships out tomorrow. I'll be leading a very important mission.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: What's the matter?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: You...you shouldn't have come. I don't have time now.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Elaine, I've got to talk to you.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted, what are you doing here?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: It's too late, Ted. When I get back to Chicago, I'm going to start my life all over again. I'm sorry.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: But if you'll just give me...

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: It's the truth. What's hurt you the most is your record since the war. Different cities, different jobs, and not one of them shows you can accept any real responsibility.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: You expect me to believe that?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Your <u>war</u> <u>record</u>? You're the only one keeping that alive. For everyone else it's ancient history.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: You know I haven't been able to get near an airplane since the war. And even if I could, they wouldn't hire me because of my war record.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Then why don't you take the job that Louie Netz offered you at Boeing?

name: Movie
