speaker: STRIKER
text: Elaine, not yet. I promise you I really can change.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I won't be back. I've requested the Atlanta run.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Look, you'll be back in town tomorrow night. We'll have dinner -- talk it over.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: It takes so many things to make love last. Most of all it takes respect. And I can't live with a man I don't respect!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Don't you feel anything for me at all any more?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I have been patient and I've tried to help, but you wouldn't even let me do that.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: I know things haven't been right for a long time, but it'll be different. If you'll just be patient, I can work things out.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I just don't want to go over it any more.

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: I came home early and found your note. I guess you meant for me to read it later. Elaine, I've got to talk to you.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Ted!

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Elaine!

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Find out if there's a doctor on board, as quietly as you can.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: I think so, but I've never seen it so acute.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Airsick?

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: Who wants to be first?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Hey, we've been waiting for you. A little bit late tonight.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Joey can stay up here for a while if he'd like to.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: We'd better get back now.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Hello.

name: Movie
speaker: ELAINE
text: We have a visitor.

name: Movie
speaker: SOLDIER
text: Good-bye, darling.

name: Movie
speaker: GIRL
text: Good-bye, darling. I love you. I love you, darling.

name: Movie
speaker: SOLDIER
text: Good-bye, darling.

name: Movie
speaker: GIRL
text: Bill! Bill! Good-bye, Bill.

name: Movie
speaker: SOLDIER
text: So long, darling. Good-bye. Take care of yourself.

name: Movie
speaker: GIRL
text: Oh, Bill, I'll keep it. I'll keep it with me all the time.

name: Movie
speaker: SOLDIER
text: Good-bye, darling.

name: Movie
speaker: GIRL
text: Every day.

name: Movie
speaker: SOLDIER
text: You promise you'll write.

name: Movie
speaker: GIRL
text: Oh, Bill, I'm going to miss you so much.

name: Movie
speaker: KRAMER
text: All right, he's on final now! Put out all runway lights except niner.

name: Movie
speaker: GUNDERSON
text: He's right on the heading.

name: Movie
speaker: KRAMER
text: Watch your altitude, Striker. It's too erratic. You can't come straight in. You've got enough fuel left for two hours flying. You've got to stay up there 'til we get a break in the weather.

name: Movie
speaker: GUNDERSON
text: He's all over the place! Nine hundred feet up to thirteen hundred feet! What an asshole!

name: Movie
speaker: KRAMER
text: You are now eight miles from the airport. Turn right to a heading of zero eight niner, throttle back slightly and begin to lose altitude to fifteen hundred feet.

name: Movie
speaker: GUNDERSON
text: Eight miles. Turn right to heading zero eight niner.

name: Movie
speaker: GUNDERSON
text: Runway niner. It's the longest, and directly into the wind.

name: Movie
speaker: KRAMER
text: Did you decide on a runway yet?

name: Movie
speaker: GUNDERSON
text: Yes, Captain?

name: Movie
speaker: KRAMER
text: And get that finger out of your ear. You don't know where that finger's been! Gunderson?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Here.

name: Movie
speaker: SHIRLEY
text: Oh Jack, I'm so warm. I'm burning up.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: How ya doing, honey?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: SHIRLEY
text: Oh, I can't stand it.

name: Movie
speaker: SHIRLEY
text: Well, it wasn't all that I had hoped.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What did you think of 'Great Expectations?'

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah, I think he is.  Hey, Fred!

name: Movie
speaker: SHIRLEY
text: Jack, isn't that Fred Bliffert over there in the blue turtleneck? Maybe he's on our flight to Chicago.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: The hell I don't! I'm out there busting my buns every night.

name: Movie
speaker: JOEY
text: ...and that you don't really try, except during the playoffs.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: We are turning left to a heading of zero- niner-niner.

name: Movie
speaker: JOEY
text: ...and that lots of times you don't even run down court.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: Denver Control, this is Flight two-zero- niner intersecting Victor Airway seven- niner-niner.

name: Movie
speaker: JOEY
text: I think you're the greatest. But my Dad says you don't work hard enough on defense.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: I'm an airline pilot.  Ah, Clarence, according to my calculations, with this tailwind we ought to be able to make up an additional fifteen minutes over the Rockies.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: I think you should go back to your seat now, Joey. Right, Clarence?

name: Movie
speaker: JOEY
text: You <u>are</u> Kareem. I've seen you play. My Dad's got season tickets!

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: I'm sorry, son, but you must have me confused with someone else. My name is Roger Murdock. I'm the co-pilot.

name: Movie
speaker: JOEY
text: Wait a minute. I know you. You're Kareem Abdul Jabbar. You play basketball for the Los Angeles Lakers!

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Okay, this is one of my favorites.

name: Movie
speaker: LISA
text: Oh, I'd love to.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: I thought maybe you'd like to hear a song.

name: Movie
speaker: LISA
text: I'm Lisa. Oh, you have a guitar!

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: I'm Randy.

name: Movie
speaker: LISA
text: Hi!

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Oh, it's nothing to be alarmed about. We'll get back to you very quickly.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. HAMMEN
text: Yes, of course. We both had fish. Why?

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Well, the doctor will be with you in just a moment. One thing: do you know what he had for dinner?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. HAMMEN
text: Oh, Stewardess. My husband is very sick. Can you do something, please?

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. HAMMEN
text: I will, but Jim won't.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Would either of you like another cup of coffee?

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: All right. But just remember, my name is Roger Murdock.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: No, he's not bothering anyone. Let him stay up here.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: No, why don't you take care ot it?

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: Do you want me to check the weather, Clarence?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Roger, Roger. What's our vector, Victor?

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: We have clearance, Clarence.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Roger.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: Huh?

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Roger.

name: Movie
speaker: OVEUR
text: Hi, Roger. Good to have you aboard. Victor, this is Roger Murdock.

name: Movie
speaker: MURDOCK
text: Sorry, Clarence. Latest weather report shows everything socked in from Salt Lake to Lincoln.

name: Movie
speaker: SISTER ANGELINA
text: Of course.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Could I borrow your guitar? I thought I might be able to cheer her up.

name: Movie
speaker: SISTER ANGELINA
text: Oh yes, I saw. Poor child.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: There's a little girl on board who's ill and...

name: Movie
speaker: SISTER ANGELINA
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Excuse me, Sister?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Thank you, Randy. You better leave sweetheart. You might get hurt in here.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Mr. Striker, the passengers are ready.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Would you go up, please?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Well, I flew in the war, but that was a long time ago. I wouldn't know anything about it.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: It's the little room at the front of the plane where the pilots sit. But that's not important right now. The first officer is ill and the Captain would like someone with flying experience to help him with the radio. Do you know anything about planes?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: The cockpit? What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Excuse me, sir. There's been a little problem in the cockpit and I was wondering...

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: No. No thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Excuse me, sir. Would you like some coffee before we serve dinner?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Oh -- I haven't flown for a long time.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Do you feel all right, sir?

name: Movie
speaker: STRIKER
text: Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: RANDY
text: Fourteen-B. It's halfway down on your right.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: Yeah...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: You okay?

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: Your voice is saying no, but your body is saying yes.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I like my horizons narrow.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: I think you're just a little scared now, about what you might find once the lights go out.  A little scared... and a lot curious.  Maybe more than you want to admit.  But doesn't that turn you on, that curiosity and fear, swirling together?  Think of it as broadening your horizons.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: There's lots of things I haven't done, but his ain't high on the list.  Don't take it personally.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: A virgin.  I find that very arousing...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Not unless I got real drunk and nobody told me about it later.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: I know... Why don't you hang around for a while, let me entertain you? It's Matt, right?  Now tell me the truth, have you ever... made it... with one of us?

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: Todd?  Todd doesn't know either.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: The girl out front mentioned Strader's assistant, somebody named Watson.  Maybe he knows.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: Look, I don't know where Mr. Strader might be.  He comes and he goes.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: You've got me all wrong.  I don't charge money for something that I myself find pleasurable...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Does that cost extra or you throw them in?

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: Oooh.  Hardball.  That sounds interesting.  Are you going to strike me?  You could tie me up and then do whatever you want with me... I've got my own ropes.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Show me.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: In there.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: She did, did she?  Well, she was wrong.  Excuse me, I have to change.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: The young woman at the front said you might know where he is.

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: He's not here.  Why ask me?

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: Ss'ai k'ss?  Perfect.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: We are with the Police Department. This is Sergeant Sykes, and I am--

name: Movie
speaker: CASSANDRA
text: That's right.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: You are Cassandra?

name: Movie
speaker: FEDORCHUK
text: I may be an asshole, but at least I'm a real detective, not some outer shit space thing.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Lay off, asshole.

name: Movie
speaker: FEDORCHUK
text: Well, if it isn't Detective Jetson. Forget you hip waders, big guy?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I'd like to see you next to a sea of hydrochloric acid, Fedorchuk... see how much surfin' you'd do.

name: Movie
speaker: FEDORCHUK
text: Look at your dildo partner.  He's too scared to even come down to the sand.  You're not gonna get wet standing here, moron!

name: Movie
speaker: FEDORCHUK
text: You ever try to make a case in Slagtown?  The list of Newcomer informants is about as long as the list of Mexican war heroes...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: You don't have squat.

name: Movie
speaker: FEDORCHUK
text: Jesus, Sykes -- it's been less than ten hours.  Me and Alterez are on it, okay?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: So what've you got on Tuggle's killers?

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: No, Sergeant -- not history...  Eternity...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Move a finger, Harcourt, and you're history...

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: That's right.  He and I, along with seven or eight others.  Listen, gentlemen, I will be happy to assist you in any way I can -- unfortunately, at the moment, I'm overdue at another function.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: You were partners with him on some Slag -- uh, Newcomer real estate thing.

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: Yes, I heard about poor Warren. Tragic.

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: Sergeant... Detective.  I wasn't aware there were any Newcomers at the rank of Detective yet.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I'm Sergeant Sykes, and this is Detective Jetson, Los Angeles Police Department.

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: Yes...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: William Harcourt?

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: Do it!

name: Movie
speaker: KIPLING
text: Here?

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: Kill them both.

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: This is getting out of hand.  I want you to deal with it.  Immediately.

name: Movie
speaker: KIPLING
text: When we picked him up, he was talking to those two cops -- the two who came to question you about Hubley.

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: It is his new partner that I'm worried about.

name: Movie
speaker: KIPLING
text: He didn't recognize me.

name: Movie
speaker: HARCOURT
text: This is becoming a serious breach of security.

name: Movie
speaker: KIPLING
text: That cop, the human, he was the one who killed Anderson and the driver.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: You look very good.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: How do I look?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: You understand that.  But how many others will?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: But there's no more drug.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Because... because of what will happen if humans see what we are capable of becoming.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Why the hell are you so dead set against back-up?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: We can't let him get away.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I never thought I'd say this, but -- for once in my life I think I'm willing to wait for back-up.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Tell me about it...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: No he's not.  Not if he overdosed on the drug.  Massive amounts trigger a... a change.  Your body functions seize up, you appear to be dead, but it's really a state of incubation.  When you emerge you're...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Harcourt is dead.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: ... It's Harcourt.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What is this?!

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Do what?!  George-- ?!

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: No!  We must do this alone.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: There!  Go back.  Down that side street.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What's this about, George?  I know that look.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: It'd be for your own good.  I think you'd be better off with a partner who's a little more... by the book.  ... Still, I gotta tell you, George, for a quiet guy, you're sure hell on wheels once you get going.  I'd kinda hate to miss your next two days as a detective.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: With Harcourt and Kipling dead, I assume you will be requesting reassignment now.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Ss-ai!

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Shit!

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Fuck procedure.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Why?  What's the big goddamn deal?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: The fifty kilos, Matthew.  I have to find it.  I can't let it get out on the street.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: George, c'mon -- lighten up.  It's a beauty of a case.  Don't sweat it -- we got him by the short hairs. He ain't gonna make any more of the shit.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Stay out of this, Matthew.  Tell me where the drug has been taken or I will crush your lungs against this wall.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: George, uh... you're gonna break his little chest bones...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Where is the drug?  Where have they taken it?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Uh, George...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: No, George -- you're missing the point.  The drug is evidence.  We need to have the evidence, ya know?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: If the drug is here, we must destroy it.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Okay, George -- we gotta play this real smart.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Harcourt was the brain who brought it all together.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: They had months in quarantine to develop the plan.  Porter, with his chemistry background, must have somehow come up with the formula for the drug.  Hubley manufactured it -- at the refinery.  Strader, through the nightclub, established a distribution network.  And Harcourt--

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: I must trust you, Matthew.  I cannot stop this without you.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: George... look me in the eye... George, you don't ever lie to me again.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Your people don't know about this part of out past.  And they can't know -- It would threaten our entire existence here.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Jesus, this is major.  Why didn't you tell me sooner? Why'd you hold out on me?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: No... I am sure not.  That is why I am so concerned... someone must now be producing it here.  But none of my people know how to make it.  The process was carefully guarded.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Where did he get it?  Was there any of it on the ship?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: We all did.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: We?  You've taken it?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Like your cocaine, I suppose.  The "high" lasts several hours.  We would receive small amounts of it... as a reward for our labor.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: How potent?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: ... It is called ss'jabroka'.  To us it is a potent narcotic.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: The hell it isn't, when somebody wires up enough C-4 explosive to my car to turn me into pink mist!  That Slag was on something, and not sour milk, either?  Am I right?  TELL ME!  What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: No.  I cannot involve you.  This is not your concern.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: No secrets, goddammit!  You don't hold back from me.  Whatever is going on, you're gonna tell me now!

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: You must leave me alone on this.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What's this nothing shit?  It wasn't nothing yesterday when you asked Bentner to run that test and he looked like he was about to shit peach pits, and it's not nothing now.  Don't lie to me, George, you're bad at it.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: ... and Porter ran a piece of shit mom-and-pop mini-mart.  So what the hell's the connection?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Warren Hubley was in middle management at a refinery... Joshua Strader operated a successful bar and nightclub...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: ... So we've got three guys dead. All Newcomers, all killed the same way -- execution style.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: What was that about?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: It's all right, George.  It's cool. Just wait here, all right?  I'll be back in a coupla minutes.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Stop the car!

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Come on, you won't have to get near the water.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Please, I must get out here.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Why?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Stop the car.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Come on, let's go, dude.  Surf's up!

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: To the... to the beach?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Well, let's roll, George.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: She's very progressive.  I'm certain she's considering it.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: George, she's not gonna divorce you. You mate for life, remember?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: She's going to divorce me.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: A man, a human, was wiring it to your car.  I didn't get a good look at him.  I must call my wife...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Where'd you get this?!!

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah, go home.  Get some sleep.  You do sleep, don't you?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: I'm going home.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Don't count on me, George.  I never had any ideals.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: I hope you can understand how special your world is... how unique a people you humans are.  So it us all the more painful and confusing to us that so few of you seem capable of living up the the ideals you set for yourselves.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: You humans are very curious to us. You invite us to live among you, in an atmosphere of equality we've never known before.  You lay before us a beautiful green world, full of freedoms and opportunities... You give us ownership of our lives for the first time... and you ask no more of us than you do of yourselves: to live by the rules... rules that aren't made to keep one people subordinate to another, but rules that exist to preserve equality.  You aspire to very high ideals here.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: No shit, Holmes.  You're only from another goddamn planet, for chrissakes.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: There is so much our two peoples don't understand about each other.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Ta ss'trakyona'...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Your health...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Sticking out of his ass... yeah! See, that's what makes it a joke. There's like a surprise, and your mind fills in the funny picture. Here's this guy with a pen stuck in his ass and he thinks it's a thermometer.  Nada, huh?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: In the other man's rectum.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: ... and so, and so the doctor says, "If this is the thermometer, then where'd I leave the pen?"  You're not... you don't think that's funny?  George, work with me, I always get a laugh with that one. Look, if the doctor's got the thermometer in his hand, then where's his pen gotta be?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Maybe not... I don't know.  I'm not sure I'm gonna go.  She doesn't need her burn-out of a father there...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Human children can be very beautiful.  Getting married?  Congratulations. You will be taking Sunday off, then...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I appreciate your honesty, George.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Your home is quite disordered.  I thought perhaps you had been burglarized when I walked in.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: It's like having an eleventh finger removed.  It hurts like hell, but you never really needed the damn thing in the first place.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: We mate for life.  Divorce... is a strange concept to us.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Was.  Divorced.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: You are married?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah... I know the routine.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: My wife?  She worries about me.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: So, she keeps you on a pretty short leash, does she?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Through his ass.  Next time you see him, tell him to call me... unless you want us to keep coming back on you like a bad case of herpes.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: I believe he is probably lying.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: When will Strader return?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: We were chasing you because you ran, you dumb son-of-a-bitch.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Todd Watson.  The assistant manager.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Who is he?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah, that's it.  Say it slow.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Ss'trokya ss'lato 'na'.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: And what was that one about my mother?  That was a good one.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Ss'loka'.  It means literally "small but intelligent creature".  It loses much in the translation.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: So what was that other word for Human... Slow ka?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Our bodies do not assimilate the nutrients if the food has been cooked.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I'll bet.  Would it really put you out if they tossed that on the grill for a minute or two?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: This is mole.  It's good.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Which one is that?  Raw what?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Three months.  We learn quickly.  We adapt.  It is our strength... what we were bred for, to adapt to hostile environments.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I don't think I could ever learn to read that shit.  How long did it take you to learn English?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah, sure.  I knew that...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: If I may make a suggestion... We have different weak spots than you do.  Next time, a blow to the nerve plexus under the arm, here, will produce the effect I think you were looking for.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: In the camps, we were lodged four to a room.  The selection process was entirely random.  We did not get to stay with our friends... or families...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: How could a straight-arrow like you ever pick a roommate like him?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: From quarantine, when my people first arrived here.  He and I were housed together.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: You know that guy?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Stay back!  I'm okay.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Matthew, you don't have to-- .

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: That's very colorful.  But see -- now I've got a problem.  I don't seem to be getting much cooperation from you, Porter.  So I guess we're gonna have to take this little session down to my office, ya know?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Your mother mates out of season.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Tell me.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Screw me?  That can't be right.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Screw you.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I'll handle it.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: But I-- .

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Back off, George.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Uh, Matthew...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Your name wouldn't happen to be Porter, would it?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: At the end of the bar.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Who said that?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: My partner is dead!  Because one of you bastards killed him -- then disappeared into a rathole down in Slagtown, where he's home and dry, 'cause nobody sees nothing, nobody says nothing...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Agree to work with me?  You don't like me... you don't like any of us. You have nothing but contempt for us.  And yet you become an outcast from your club of detectives by making me your partner...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Why'd I do what?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Why did you do it?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: We'd like to ask you about a business associate of your, Warren Hubley.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Rudyard Kipling?  No shit?  Listen, we just need a minute of your time...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: He has not been home since that day. But she told me where to find him.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Did you talk to him?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: She didn't know him.  But she said her son might.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Aw-right.  What about the other guy?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: A week ago two men came to see her husband.  After they left, he was very frightened.  She identified one of the men from a photo I showed her.  It was Hubley.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Did you learn anything?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Mrs. Porter is not taking her husband's death well.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Why the hell--?!  Great, fine.  You talk to the wife.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: I believe I should interview the widow alone.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: So the Slag they're cutting into upstairs worked at a refinery just like Hubley worked at a refinery.  I'd say that "possible" connection between the two cases just got a hell of a lot more possible.  Okay, next step -- I gotta go talk to the wife of the Slag store owner blown away last night.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: A large number of my people were hired by refineries because the methane fumes are not harmful to us. My spouse's brother is one.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: How the hell do you know that?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Newcomers working near methane gasses at oil refineries must paint it on their boots to protect against sparks.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: And still it fits?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Well... Yeah, it's rubber.  It stretches.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: And that fits?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Get the picture?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: A rubber.  A condom.  You know... Coney Island whitefish?  Men, human men, put them on their, uh -- penises -- to protect against having babies.  You need this for anything?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: What is this?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Shouldn't we examine their personal effects?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Nothing?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What's this?  What's going on?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Great.  Well, I'm sure glad that's settled, aren't you?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Yes... no, it is not unreasonable. Although I--

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Possibly.  Good.  Well, would you be willing to accept the theory, George, that... possibly... by examining the evidence from one case we might shed some small ray of light on the other?  Does that sound unreasonable to you?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Well... yes, quite possibly.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Nothing's wrong.  I just want to get something straight.  You agree that there's a good chance these two shootings are somehow related, right?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: What is wrong?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Well, there's a thing about partners, about being somebody's partner.  You do for each other. And other people's rules don't mean shit.  It's the rules set up between the two of you, that's all that counts.  Understand?  Okay.  Well, my friend and partner was shot last night and I'm after the shitbag that did it.  As my partner, I'm asking you to respect me and help me find him.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Look, you want to fit in here, right?  You want to learn how to get along?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: The murder at the mini-mart is not our case.  The Captain said--

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: The guys at the mini-mart last night made a half-assed stab at the money in the till -- but I don't think that's what they were there for.  I think we got us a couple'a executions on our hands, George...

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: There was no wallet... but he was still wearing a watch and two rings.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Terrific.  A real pillar of the community.  Was Hubley missing anything when they found him?  Was he ripped off?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Nice signal, dickwad!

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Through the chest.  Rupturing both the primary and secondary hearts.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: With two BRI Sabot slugs in the chest.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: His body was discovered three days ago, in an alley off of Central Avenue, near downtown.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Let's talk Hubley.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: That is exactly so.  It is like your name... Sykes.  I'm sure it doesn't bother you at all that it sounds like "ss'ai k'ss", two words in my language which mean "excrement" and "cranium".

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Anyway, what's it matter to you if we think it's funny, right?  Whatta you care?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Gesundheit.  You don't mind if I stick to George, do you?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: My true name is Ss'tangya T'ssorentsa'.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Man, somebody really hung one on you!  I've heard some good ones for you guys... Humphrey Bogart, Harley Davidson.  I guess the people at immigration got a little punchy after a while, coming up with names for a quarter of a million of you. You weren't at the back of the line, were you, George?

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: I am George.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What's that?  Look, Jetson.  Get this straight in your head.  We're not pals, we're not married, and we ain't gonna take long moonlight walks together... We're just partners.  And don't call me Sergeant.  Call me Sykes... or Matt if you have to.

name: Movie
speaker: JETSON
text: Sergeant... I'd like to thank you for what you're doing.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: ... and we work my hours.  I'll do the driving, you do the paperwork. You gotta learn it so you might as well do it all.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: No... two.

name: Movie
speaker: MAFFET
text: Yeah, the shells are too big for six in an cylinder.  Hell, Matt, you don't need but one.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Only holds five.

name: Movie
speaker: MAFFET
text: Casull .454 Magnum.  You're talking twice the impact energy of .44 Magnum hot loads.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: MAFFET
text: You said you wanted the biggest thing I could find... Well, this is it.

name: Movie
speaker: O'NEAL
text: ... They took the stuff out, all of it -- this afternoon.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Don't piss him off, O'Neal.  When he gets like this, I can't control him. I've seen this before.  He got like this once -- I saw him jerk a guy's spine out and show it to him. Nothing I could do.  I hadda go throw up.

name: Movie
speaker: O'NEAL
text: Yes it is.  Thirty-five percent pure Methane gas in there.  I don't know how these fellas do it.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: That where Anderson worked?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I think you're gonna find he's taken the rest of his life off.

name: Movie
speaker: O'NEAL
text: Wait.  You know who it looks like? Yeah.  Anderson.  Uh... James Anderson.  He isn't in today.  He took the afternoon off.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Who else can I ask around here?

name: Movie
speaker: O'NEAL
text: To be honest, it's hard to say.  I hate to admit it but -- they all still kinda look alike to me.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: We think he could'a been involved, yeah.  You know him?

name: Movie
speaker: O'NEAL
text: You think this is the guy who did it?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Well, one of the men didn't like him so much...

name: Movie
speaker: O'NEAL
text: Mr. Hubley was an all right guy -- and a damn good manager.  The men liked him.  I'm really gonna have to scramble to fill his shoes.

name: Movie
speaker: OPERATOR
text: Sure.  Just a minute.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Can you dig up their Quarantine records in this thing?

name: Movie
speaker: OPERATOR
text: I'm sorry, Matt.  Nothing here seems to be matching up...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah -- we met him.  Wonderful boy... close personal friend of George's here.

name: Movie
speaker: OPERATOR
text: Released December one.  He and his wife moved first to Modesto, then Coalinga, California -- wherever that is -- settled in L.A. in April.  Field of expertise: organic chemical engineering.  He and his wife have one child, a son.

name: Movie
speaker: OPERATOR
text: For you, anything.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Try Joshua Strader, will ya, darlin'?

name: Movie
speaker: OPERATOR
text: Here's Hubley.  Left Quarantine on November thirtieth, relocated first to Riverside, then moved to Los Angeles early in February the following year.  Field of expertise: chemical manufacturing.  Looks like he passed up several other better paying jobs waiting for that one at the refinery.

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: That's all I know.  You want anything more, you ask somebody else.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah, I heard of it.

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: Yeah... I seen him around.  High- roller dude named Strader.  Joshua Strader.  Runs a club on the west side.  Encounters.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: One of the two men was Hubley, right?  What about the other one? Did you know him?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What's that?

name: Movie
speaker: PORTER
text: Ss'kya'ta'.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Jesus, are the questions too tough for you already?  Let's try again--  Is your name Porter?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Did he find anything?

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: Looking for some foreign compound in the blood of that alien you dropped the other day.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What kind of test?

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: You mean the Blob?  They're finishing up now.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: You guys finished the postmortem on Strader yet?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah, I'll bet.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: Oh, here's an extra headshot if you need one.  We're just about to start cutting in.  You're welcome to stick around if you want.  It's really fascinating stuff.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: That's the way these people are. You don't hit both pumps you just piss them off.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Lucky nothing.  I had to empty my damn gun into him.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: Lucky for you, you got him in both of his... well, what we loosely refer to as... hearts.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: You took this gut out, too, didn't you?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Fedorchuk couldn't find his ass with his hands in his back pockets.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: No I.D. on him and -- well, you know, no fingerprints -- so it could be tough.  Your buddies this morning went through the mug book but couldn't make a facial match.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: Yeah... he was one Martin Helder. White male, twenty-seven.  Let's see... wrap sheet shows one armed robbery conviction, a couple for sale of a controlled substance. Oh yeah, and he was wired on coke when you stopped his clock.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: The human?

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: Yeah, right.  Don't push your luck. Anyway, according to the sheet, the guy you nailed outside by the car--

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Come on.  You got nothin' better to do, cushy county job like yours.

name: Movie
speaker: WINTER
text: You know I've been over all this with Fedorchuk and Alterez this morning...

name: Movie
speaker: WARNER
text: Don't tell me what to think.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Granger and Pitts have one hell of a caseload... and I would have thought with Jetson here being the first Newcomer plainclothes, and Hubley's body being found over in the Newcomer community...

name: Movie
speaker: WARNER
text: Granger and Pitts are already on it.

name: Movie
speaker: WARNER
text: You?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Departmental policy.

name: Movie
speaker: WARNER
text: You are to have nothing to do with the investigation into Bill Tuggle's death.  You know that.  Leave that for Fedorchuk.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Captain.  I'd like to volunteer for duty with the new detective.

name: Movie
speaker: WARNER
text: Yeah, Sykes?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I'll cover you!  Get outta there!!

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: I can't!  Do you mind!

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Get outta there!

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: I got him.  Don't get pinned.

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: Watch the driver.  I'm going for a better angle on the door.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Yeah, that's comforting.  Mine, too.

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: Of course.  Right in the trunk of the car.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: You got your vest?

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: Whatever gave you that idea?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Does that look at all suspicious to you?

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Shit, if Kristin had to get married where I could afford it, we'd be holding the reception at Buddy's Burgers.

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: But you're bummed because your ex and her new husband are paying for the whole thing.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Goddammit, Tug -- I want to see Kristin get married, okay?  But--

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: Hey, look -- we've known Kristin since... since she was conceived in that cabin up in Big Bear. Remember?  You and Edie banged the wall so hard, me and Carol were picking plaster out of our hair for a week...

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: Put on your wash-and-wear suit and your clip-on tie, have your landlady tie your shoes for you, and show up at the church.  Simple.  Me and Carol are going.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: How can I go?

name: Movie
speaker: TUGGLE
text: It is.

name: Movie
speaker: SYKES
text: Hope their plumbing's the same.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Uh, seems to be in front and behind.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Talk to me, Hudson.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Can't lock up...

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Position?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Movement!

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Rescue mission.  There's some juicy colonists' daughters we gotta rescue from virginity.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Hey, 'Top.'  What's the op?

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Let's go...let's go.  Cycle through!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Whoooah!  No shit?  I'm impressed.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Would you, Sir?

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Christ.  I never saw such a buncha old women.  You want me to fetch your slippers, Hudson?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: This floor's freezing.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Say again?  All after incinerators?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Uh,...Apone, I want you to lay down a suppressing fire with the incinerators and fall back by squads to the APC, over.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Let's go.  Pull 'em out.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Flame-units only.  I want rifles slung.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Vasquez, take point.  Let's move.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: First squad up, on line.  Hicks, get yours in a cordon.  Watch the rear.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Ten seconds, people.  Look sharp!

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Set down sixty meters this side of the telemetry mast.  Immediate dust off on my 'clear,' then stay on station.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Awright!  I want a nice clean dispersal this time.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Okay, let's do it.

name: Movie
speaker: APONE
text: Awright.  Fire-team A.  Gear up. Let's move.  Two minutes. Somebody wake up Hicks.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: ...that's better.  Pan it around a bit.

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: Well, thanks, I --

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You did okay, Bishop.

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: In seventeen minutes this place will be a cloud of vapor the size of Nebraska.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: She's alive.  They brought her here and you know it.

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: Ripley...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: WE'RE NOT LEAVING!

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: PLENTY!  TWENTY-SIX MINUTES!

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: HOW MUCH TIME?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: See you soon.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: It's going to be closer.  You better get going.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: All right.  Let's get on it.  What'll you need?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: I'm really the only one qualified to remote-pilot the ship anyway. Believe me, I'd prefer not to.  I may be synthetic but I'm not stupid.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: I'll go.

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: I'm afraid so.  The crash did too much damage.  The overload is inevitable, at this point.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: And it's too late to shut it down?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: I'm projecting total systems failure in a little under four hours.  The blast radius will be about thirty kilometers.  About equal to ten megatons.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: How long until it blows?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: That's it.  See it?  Emergency venting.

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: Hard to say.  It may have been blind instinct...attraction to the heat of whatever...but she did choose to incubate her eggs in the one spot where we couldn't destroy her without destroying ourselves.  That's if she exists, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Could it be intelligent?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: Well, the queen is always physically larger then the others.  A termite queen's abdomen is so bloated with eggs that it can't move at all.  It is fed and tended by drone workers, defended by the warriors.  She is the center of their lives, quite literally the  mother of their society.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You're saying one of those things lays all the eggs?

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: That is the question of the hour.  We could assume a parallel to certain insect forms who have hivelike organization. An ant of termite colony, for example, is ruled by a single female, a queen, which is the source of new eggs.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: But these things come from eggs...so where are all the eggs coming from.

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: Yes.  That follows.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Which would mean lots of those parasites, right?  One for each person...over a hundred at least.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Now let me get this straight. The aliens paralyzed the colonists, carried them over there, cocooned them to be hosts for more of those...

name: Movie
speaker: BISHOP
text: I've isolated a neuro-muscular toxin responsible for the paralysis.  It seems to be metabolizing.  He should wake up soon.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Sorry to disappoint you.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: I expected more of you, Ripley. I thought you would be smarter than this.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Look, maybe the thing didn't even exist, right?  And if I'd made it a major security situation, the Administration would've stepped in.  Then no exclusive rights, nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You sent them out there and you didn't even warn them, Burke. Why didn't you warn them?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You sent them to that ship.  I just checked the colony log... directive dates six-twelve-seventy-nine. Signed Burke, Carter J.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Now, wait a second --

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: But they will know about it, Burke. From me.  Just like they'll know how you were responsible for the deaths of one hundred and fifty-seven colonists here --

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: You've been doing your homework. Look, they can't impound it if they don't know about it.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You just try getting a dangerous organism past ICC quarantine. Section 22350 of the Commerce Code.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Those specimens are worth millions to the bio-weapons division.  Now, if you're smart we can both come out of this heroes.  Set up for life.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: This operation is under military jurisdiction and Hicks is next in chain of command.  Right?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Corporal Hicks!?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What rank?  I believe Corporal Hicks has authority here.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Don't make me pull rank, Ripley.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You son of a bitch.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Bullshit!

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: This is clearly an important species we're dealing with here. We can't just arbitrarily exterminate them --

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They can bill me.  I got a tab running.  What's second?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Well, I mean...I know this is an emotional moment, but let's not make snap judgments.  Let's move cautiously.  First, this physical installation had a substantial dollar value attached to it --

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Now hold on a second.  I'm not authorizing that action.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: No good.  How do we know it'll effect their biochemistry?  I say we take off and nuke the entire site from orbit.  It's the only way to be sure.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: She's right.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: That's not what I mean.  Gorman, if your men have to use their weapons in there, they'll rupture the cooling system.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Yeah?  Maybe the organisms like the heat, that's why they built...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They're right under the primary heat exchangers.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Uh-hunh.  One of thirty or so, all over the planet.  They're completely automated.  We manufacture them, by the way.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: That the atmosphere processor?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: I suggest you study the disks Ripley has been kind enough to prepare for you.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I hope you're right.  I really do.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Well, it didn't occur to me.  It's been policy for years to have a synthetic on board.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You never said anything about an android being here!  Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: That's the plan.  My word on it.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Burke, just tell me one thing. That you're going out there to kill them.  Not study.  Not bring back.  Just burn them out...clean ...forever.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Yello?  Oh, Ripley.  Hi...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: No!  The answer is no.  Now please go.  I'm sorry.  Just go, would you.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Yes, and I've read it.  You wake up every night, sheets soaking, the same nightmare over and over...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Spare me, Burke.  I've had my psych evaluation this month.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: If you go.  It's a second chance, kiddo.  And it'll be the best thing in the world for you to face this fear and beat it.  You gotta get back on the horse...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: If I go.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: What if I said I could get you reinstated as a flight officer? And that the company has agreed to pick up your contract?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: It's all I could get.  Anyway, it keeps my mind off of... everything.  Days off are worse.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Running loaders, forklifts, that sort of thing?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: That's right.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: I heard you were working in the cargo docks.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Yeah, yeah.  I saw the commercial.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Well, the corporation co-financed that colony with the Colonial Administration, against mineral rights.  We're getting into a lot of terraforming...'Building Better Worlds.'

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What about you?  What's your interest in this?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I was reamed, steamed and dry-cleaned by you guys...and now you want me to go back out there?  Forget it.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Hear me out...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: No.  There's no way!

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: You are a head case.  Have a donut.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They had their minds made up before I even went in there. They think I'm a head case.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: You had them eating out of your hand, kiddo.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Just tell them what happened.  The important thing is to stay cool and unemotional.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I get the picture.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Look, I believe you, but there are going to be some heavyweights in there.  You got Feds, you got interstellar commerce commission, you got colonial administration, insurance company guys...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You read my deposition...it's complete and accurate.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Cancer.  Hmmmm.  They still haven't licked that one.  Cremated.  Interred Parkside Repository, Little Chute, Wisconsin.  No children.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Amy.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Amanda Ripley-McClaren.  Married name, I guess.  Age:  sixty-six ...at time of death.  Two years ago.  I'm sorry.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Is she...?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Well, I was going to wait until after the inquest...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Have they located my daughter yet?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: You'd drifted right through the core systems.  It's blind luck that deep-salvage team caught you when they...are you all right?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Fifty-seven...oh, Christ...

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Shit.  Apone, collect magazines from everybody.  We can't have any firing in there.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: We're talking thermonuclear explosion.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: PDT'S.  Personal-Data Transmitters. Every adult colonist had one surgically implanted.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: What's he scanning for?

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: It's insured.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Looks like you company can write off its share of this colony.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Dead on all channels.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Still nothing from the colony?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: We're trained to deal with these kinds of situations.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: These Colonial Marines are some tough hombres, and they're packing state-of-the-art firepower. Nothing they can't handle...right, Lieutenant?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: You wouldn't be going in with the troops.  I can guarantee your safety.

name: Movie
speaker: BURKE
text: Look, we don't know what's going on out there.  It may just be a down transmitter.  But if it's not, I want you there...as an advisor.  That's all.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Forget it.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: All right, I guess.  One hell of a hangover.  Look, Ripley... I...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: How do you feel?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They're but off!  Do something!

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: I told them to fall back...

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Shut up.  Just shut up!

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: GET THEM OUT OF THERE!  DO IT NOW!

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: So?  So?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: So...then the fusion containment shuts down.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: So.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Proceed inside.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I don't know.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Gorman!  Give it a rest would you.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Where are your parents?  You have to try...

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Apone...where are your people? Anybody in D-Block?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: One of us?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: The structure seems intact.  They have power.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Hold at forty.  Slow circle of the complex.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Thirty-eight...simulated.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: How may drops is this for you, Lieutenant?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: You tell me.  I only work here.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: We're not making that out too well.  What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Unknown.  But, it looks like all of them.  Over at the processing station...sublevel 'C' under the south tower.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Alive?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Hah!  Stop your grinnin' and drop your linen!  Found 'em.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Okay, stand by in operations.  Let's go.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Sir, the CPU is on-line.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: He's coming in.  I feel safer already.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: ...We're coming in.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: All right, the area's secured. Let's go in and see what their computer can tell us.  First team head for operations. Hudson, see if you can get their CPU on line.  Hicks, meet me at the south lock by the up-link tower...

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: How do I get out of this chicken-shit outfit?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Are there any questions?  Hudson?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: All we know is that there's still no contact with the colony and that a xenomorph may be involved.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Is this going to be a stand-up fight, Sir, on another bug-hunt?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: What's the question?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Hudson, Sir.  He's Hicks.

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: Yes, Hicks?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Sir?

name: Movie
speaker: GORMAN
text: At ease.  I'm sorry we didn't have time to brief before we left Gateway but...

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Fuckin' A!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Let's go!  Let's go!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Six meters.  Five.  What the fu --

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Well you're not reading it right!

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Let's get these things lit.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Seventeen meters.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Do it!

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: The corner!  Ready?

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: I want you two walking the perimeter. I know we're all in strung out shape but stay frosty and alert. We've got to stop any entries before they get out of hand.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Maybe we got 'em demoralized.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: I don't fucking believe this. Do you believe this?

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: We got problems.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Aye-firmative.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Outstanding.  Then all we need's a deck of cards.  All right, let's move like we got a purpose.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Are you finished?  You okay?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Well that's great!  That's just fucking great, man.  Now what the fuck are we supposed to do, man? We're in some real pretty shit now!

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Not that tunnel, the other one!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Let's get the fuck out of here!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Sure, Hicks.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Save it.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Don't be long, Ellen.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Ellen.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: We ain't going anywhere.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Hicks, don't let him leave.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: All right!  She's alive.  I believe it.  But we gotta get moving!  Now!

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: No!  No!  She's alive!  We have to --

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Stand back.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Locked.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: We didn't miss anything.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They learned.  They cut the power and avoided the guns.  They must have found another way in, something we missed.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Get back here, both of you.  Fall back to Operations.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: It's game time.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Let's waste him.  No offense.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You know, Burke, I don't know which species is worse.  You don't see them screwing each other over for a fucking percentage.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: The only way it would work is if he sabotaged certain freezers on the trip back.  Then he could jettison the bodies and make up any story he liked.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Wait a minute.  We'd know about it.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Yeah.  I've noticed.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Look, you started this.  Now show me everything.  I can handle myself.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Well, that's the grenade launcher ...you probably don't want to mess with that.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What's this?

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: If it comes to that, I'll do us both.  Let's see that it doesn't Here, I'd like to introduce you to a close personal friend of mine.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Hicks, I'm not going to wind up like those others.  You'll take care of it won't you, it if comes to that?

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Maybe.  Maybe not.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They'll get us.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: But they don't know that.  They're probably looking for other ways to get in.  That'll take them awhile.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Newt time then can walk right up and knock.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Can't tell.  Lots.  D gun's down to twenty.  Ten.  It's out.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Now many?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: On my way.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: They're in the approach corridor.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: That's right.  So we put up welded barricades at these intersections...  ...and seal these ducts here and here.  Then they can only come at us from these two corridors and we create a free field of fire for the other two sentry units, here.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: We gotta figure on them getting into the complex.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: All right.  There's a fire door at this end.  The first thing we do is put a remote sentry in the tunnel and seal that door.

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: About seventeen days.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: How long after we're declared overdue can we expect a rescue?

name: Movie
speaker: HICKS
text: Poor bastard.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Removed surgically before embryo implantation.  Subject:  Marachuk, John L.   Died during procedure.  They killed him getting it off.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: No.  No!  It ain't you.  They're inside.  Inside the perimeter. They're in here.

name: Movie
speaker: VASQUEZ
text: You're just reading me.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: It's inside the complex.

name: Movie
speaker: VASQUEZ
text: Hudson, give us a break.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Oh, man.  And I was gettin' short, too!  Four more weeks and out. Now I'm gonna buy it on this fuckin' rock.  It ain't half fair, man!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Maybe you haven't been keeping up on current events, but we just got out asses kicked, pal!

name: Movie
speaker: VASQUEZ
text: Yeah, bullshit.  Watch us.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Look, man, let's just bug out and call it even, okay?

name: Movie
speaker: VASQUEZ
text: All right, we can't blow the fuck out of them...why not roll some canisters of CN-20 down there. Nerve gas the whole nest?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Anytime.  Anywhere.

name: Movie
speaker: VASQUEZ
text: Fuck you.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Somebody said alien...she thought they said illegal alien and signed up.

name: Movie
speaker: VASQUEZ
text: No.  Have you?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Hey, Vasquez...you ever been mistaken for a man?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: It's readin' right.  Look!

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Can't be.  That's inside the room!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Nine meters.  Eight.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They're right on us.  Vasquez, how you doing?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Twelve meters.  Man, this is a big fucking signal.  Ten meters.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I don't know, an acid hole in a duct.  Something under the floors, not on the plans. I don't know!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Fifteen meters.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Seal the door.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Range twenty meters.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Just get back here!

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: This signal's weird...must be some interference or something. There's movement all over the place...

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: What do you mean, they cut the power?  How could they cut the power, man?  They're animals.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They cut the power.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Oh, right!  Right!  With those things running around.  No way.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Well then somebody's just going to have to go out there.  Take a portable terminal and go out there and plug in manually.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What about the colony transmitter? That up-link tower down at the other end.  Why can't we use that?

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Think of what?  We're fucked.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I don't care how!  Think of a way.  Think of something.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: How?  The transmitter was on the APC.  It's wasted.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: We need the other drop-ship.  The on one the Sulaco.  We have to bring it down on remote, somehow.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Uh, what's next?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Thanks.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Yeah, right, it runs from the processing station right into the sublevel here.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: This service tunnel is how they're moving back and forth.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: She survived longer than that with no weapons and no training.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Man, we're not going to make it seventeen hours!  Those things are going to come in here, just like they did before, man... they're going to come in here and get us, man, long before...

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Oh, God.  Jesus.  This ain't happening.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You can't help them.  Right now they're being cocooned just like the others.

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Hey...hey!  Look, Crowe and Dietrich aren't dead, man.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Looks like it stung him.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: The embryo, the second form, hosts in the victim's body for several hours.  Gestating.  Then it...  ...then it...emerges.  Moults. Grows rapidly --

name: Movie
speaker: HUDSON
text: Sounds like you, Hicks.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMPSON
text: Tell him, as far as I'm concerned, he finds something it's his.

name: Movie
speaker: LYDECKER
text: So what do I tell this guy?

name: Movie
speaker: SIMPSON
text: Christ.  Some honch in a cushy office on Earth says go look at a grid reference in the middle of nowhere, we look.  They don't say why, and I don't ask.  I don't ask because it takes two weeks to get an answer out here and the answer's always 'don't ask.'

name: Movie
speaker: LYDECKER
text: There's a guy on the horn, mom-and-pop survey team.  Says he's homing on something and wants to know if his claim will be honored.

name: Movie
speaker: SIMPSON
text: Yeah.  What?

name: Movie
speaker: LYDECKER
text: You remember you sent some wildcatters out to that plateau, out past the Ilium range, a couple days ago?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: No.. I've slept enough.

name: Movie
speaker: MED-TECH
text: Bad dreams again?  Do you want something to help you sleep?

name: Movie
speaker: MED-TECH
text: Just a couple of days.  Do you feel up to a visitor?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: How long have I been on Gateway station?

name: Movie
speaker: MED-TECH
text: Just terrible?  That's better than yesterday at least.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Terrible.

name: Movie
speaker: MED-TECH
text: And how are we today?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Yes, honey.  I think we both can.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Can we dream?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: That's right.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Are we going to sleep now?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Right here, baby.  Right here.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Mommy...Mommy?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Newt, I want you to hang on, now.  Hang on tight.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: I knew you'd come.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Newt, wait!

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: This way.  Come on, we're almost there!

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Sure.  Go left.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: DO you know how to get to the landing field from here?

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Come on.  Crawl faster.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Look!

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Burke!  Open the door!

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I know, honey.  Me too.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Mommy...I mean, Ripley...I'm scared.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Sssh.  Don't move.  We're in trouble.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Wah...?  Where are...?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Newt.  Newt, wake up.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I'll be right in the other room, Newt.  And look...I can see you on that camera right up there.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Don't go!  Please.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: You mean dead.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Gone.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Where is she?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Yes.  A little girl.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Did you ever have a baby?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: No, it's different, honey.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Isn't that how babies come? I mean people babies...they grow inside you?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I don't know, Newt.  That's the truth.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Did one of those things grow inside her?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Well, some kids can't handle it like you can.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Why do they tell little kids that?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Yes, there are, aren't there.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: My mommy always said there were no monsters.  No real ones.  But there are.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Oh.  Sorry, Newt.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Ripley...she doesn't have bad dreams because she's just a piece of plastic.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: I don't want to...I have scary dreams.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Now you just lie here and have a nap.  You're exhausted.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: You don't have to be sorry.  It wasn't your fault.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: I'm sorry, Newt.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: I guess we're not leaving, right?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: You're really something, ace.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Yeah, you know.  In the walls, under the floor.  I was the ace.  I could hide better than anybody.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: The 'maze'?  You mean the air ducts?

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: I was the best at the game. I knew the whole maze.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: And hope to die?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Cross my heart.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: You promise?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Newt.  Look at me...Newt.  I won't leave you.  I promise.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: They're dead.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: They'd be here if they could, honey.  I know they would.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Because you'll be gone soon, like the others.  Like everybody.  You'll be dead and you'll leave me alone.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: I don't want you for a friend.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What about me?

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Casey.  She's my only friend.

name: Movie
speaker: NEWT
text: Newt.  My n-name's Newt. Nobody calls me Rebecca except my dork brother.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What did you say?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Sweet Jesus.

name: Movie
speaker: VAN LEUWEN
text: Sixty, maybe seventy families.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: How many colonists?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: What are you talking about. What people?

name: Movie
speaker: VAN LEUWEN
text: Because I don't have to.  The people who live there checked it out years ago and they never reported and 'hostile organism' or alien ship.  And by the way, they call it Acheron now.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Why won't you check out LV-426?

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: ...because just one of those things managed to kill my entire crew, within twelve hours of hatching...

name: Movie
speaker: VAN LEUWEN
text: Thank you, Officer Ripley.  That will be...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Look, I can see where this is going.  But I'm telling you those things exist.  Back on that planetoid is an alien ship and on that ship are thousands of eggs.  Thousands. Do you understand?  I suggest you find it, using the flight recorder's data.  Find it and deal with it -- before one of your survey teams comes back with a little surprise...

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: That's because I blew it out the Goddamn airlock!  Like I said.

name: Movie
speaker: VAN LEUWEN
text: The analysis team which went over your shuttle centimeter by centimeter found no physical evidence of the creature you describe...

name: Movie
speaker: VAN LEUWEN
text: It did not, however, contain any entries concerning the hostile life form you allegedly picked up.

name: Movie
speaker: RIPLEY
text: Look, I told you...

name: Movie
speaker: ALLEGRO
text: At present the girls only peck me. Their cruelty surely will wreck me. But one little beak in my own, And I'll up to heaven be flown! At present the girls only peck me. But one little beak in my own, And I'll up to heaven be flown. Up to heaven be flown! Up to heaven be flown!

name: Movie
speaker: ANDANTE
text: A sweetheart or a pretty little wife is Papageno's wish. A willing, billing, lovey dovey Would be My most tasty little dish.

name: Movie
speaker: ALLEGRO
text: I need to net one birdie only And I will stop feeling so lonely. But if she won't fly to my aid, Then into a ghost I must fade. I need to net one birdie only But if she won't fly to my aid, Then into a ghost I must fade.  To a ghost I must fade! To a ghost I must fade!

name: Movie
speaker: ANDANTE
text: A sweetheart or a pretty little wife is Papageno's wish. A willing, billing, lovey dovey Would be My most tasty little dish.

name: Movie
speaker: ALLEGRO
text: Then that would be eating and drinking I'd live like a Prince without thinking. The wisdom of old would be mine - A woman's much better than wine! Then that would be eating and drinking! The wisdom of old would be mine - A woman's much better than wine. She's much better than wine! She's much better than wine!

name: Movie
speaker: ANDANTE
text: A sweetheart or a pretty little wife is Papageno's wish. A willing, billing, lovey dovey Would be My most tasty little dish. Be my most tasty little dish! Be my most tasty little dish!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What do you mean?

name: Movie
speaker: ARCO
text: His Grace is very angry with you.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: These Viennese certainly know good music when they hear it.

name: Movie
speaker: ARCO
text: Indeed.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, I think that went off remarkably well, don't you?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Certainly!

name: Movie
speaker: ARCO
text: Follow me, please. The Archbishop would like a word.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Meaning you didn't like it.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Extremely clever.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: What did you think of the music?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You were sublime.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: How was I? Tell me honestly.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Nothing! He can marry who he pleases. I don't give a damn.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Well, what does it matter to you?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: The marriage!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Did you know? Had you heard?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Looks don't concern me, Maestro. Only talent interests a woman of taste.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Looks and talent don't always go together, Katherina.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Why?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You might be disappointed.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: What does he look like?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Perhaps.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Oh. Well perhaps you could introduce us anyway.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: My dear, it will hardly enhance your reputation to be celebrated throughout Vienna as a singing prostitute for a Turk.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Turkish? Oh, if it's Turkish, that's different. I want to be in it.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: A Turkish brothel.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Oh!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: A brothel.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: What's that?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: In a harem.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Where?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Well, do you know where it's set, my dear?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Well even if there is, I don't think you want to get involved with this one.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: How do you know?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Is there a part for me?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: And he's been commissioned to write an opera. Is it true?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Oh? News travels fast in Vienna.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Well, I heard you met Herr Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Really? What else did he tell you today? Give me some gossip.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Well? How do you like it? It's Turkish. My hairdresser tells me everything's going to be Turkish this year!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Good morning.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Maestro.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Excuse us, Fraulein. Good night, Signore.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: No, no, no, no. You can't take him away now. This is his night. Won't you introduce us, Wolfgang?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: I assume she's the virtuoso in that department. There can't be any other reason you'd marry someone like that.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What??

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Is she a good fuck?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: I'm so relieved.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, she's fine.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Is her mother still lying on the floor?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh - excuse me!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
