text: I'll be right back.

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Don't bother.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: CAVALIERI
text: Don't bother!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Katherina! I'll tell you what I'm going to do. I'm going to write another aria for you. Something even more amazing for the second act. I have to get some water. Her mother is lying on the stage.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Oh, Your Grace - I thank Your Grace! I thank you!

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: You have leave to try.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Oh, sir, he's never disobeyed me in anything. Please, Your Grace, give him one more chance.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: And how will you make him keep it?

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Yes, sir, that's the truth. But don't blame him. The fault is mine. I was too indulgent with him. But not again. Never again, I promise! I implore you - let me bring him back here. I'll make him give his word to serve you faithfully.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: Your son is an unprincipled, spoiled, conceited brat.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Sir -

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: I'm not surprised. Money seems to be more important to him than loyalty or friendship. He has sold himself to Vienna. Let Vienna look out for him.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Oh sir, yes! He's about to make the worst mistake of his life. Some little Viennese slut is trying to trick him into marriage. I know my son. He is too simple to see the trap - and there is no one there who really cares for him.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: Hardly.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: But he needs to be here in Salzburg, Your Grace. He needs me and he needs you. Your protection, your understanding.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: No! I won't have him back.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: Then try harder, Mozart. I have no intention of dismissing you. You will remain in my service and learn your place. Go now.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, Your Grace! I mean with all humility, no. I would rather you dismissed me. It's obvious I don't satisfy.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: I wish you to return immediately to Salzburg. Your father is waiting for you there patiently. I will speak to you further when I come.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: If His Grace is not satisfied with me, he can dismiss me.

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: How much provocation am I to endure from you? The more license I allow you, the more you take.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Humiliated?

name: Movie
speaker: COLLOREDO
text: Why do I have to be humiliated in front of my guests by one of my own servants?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why what, sir?

name: Movie
speaker: COMMENDATORE
text: Oh shut up. I'm sick to death of that tune.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: In the pot, I have got a good dinner. Not a sausage or stew, but a singer. Not a sausage or stew but a singer. Is the treat that I'll eat for my meat!

name: Movie
speaker: COMMENDATORE
text: Are you drunk? You invited me. And my horse. Here he is. Ottavio!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Dinner? How dare you? I am a nobleman. I only dine with people of my own height.

name: Movie
speaker: COMMENDATORE
text: I've come to dinnnnnner!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Who the devil are you? What do you want?

name: Movie
speaker: COMMENDATORE
text: Don Giovannnnnnnni!

name: Movie
speaker: OFFICER
text: What are you talking about?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I feel wrong. I feel wrong being here.

name: Movie
speaker: OFFICER
text: Why?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Yes!

name: Movie
speaker: OFFICER
text: Now?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I want to go back to Vienna.

name: Movie
speaker: OFFICER
text: Where?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I want to go!

name: Movie
speaker: OFFICER
text: What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Please! Let me sit here. Let me stay here with you. I promise I won't say all word. I'll just be here, so you know no one's going to hurt you. Please, please!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Go back to bed.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's killing me.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I can't write it!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Give me one reason I can understand.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Give me two more weeks. Please.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh yes, sir. He's all right. And he's working on it very hard.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: This is my wife, Stanzi. I've been sick, but I'm all right now. Aren't I?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Why?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No. Don't answer it!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: You'd think I was mad.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I'm not telling you.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: What's that? Oh!  Who gave you this? How much is it? Wolfi, who gave you this?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I heard voices.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No one.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Who was that?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Shut up! I'll not let you put anything in my hand until I see some money.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Stanzi-manzi, I'll put it in your hand!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Half the house! You'll never see a penny. I want it here, in my hand.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, you liked it, didn't you? Monkey-flunki-punki.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I don't trust this man. And I didn't like what he did with your opera. It was common.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, Stanzi.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: When? We need money now. Either he pays now, or you don't do it.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why not? Half the house!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: You're not going to do this?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I'm talking about now. How much will you give him now? Down payment?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Half the receipts! Stanzi!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Your father is dead.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Wolfi! Your father is dead.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Salzburg.  We were just talking about Salzburg.  If you've come from my friend the Fartsbishop, you've arrived at just the right moment. Because I've got good news for him. I'm done with Vienna. It's over, finished, done with! Done with! Done with!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: These gentlemen are from Salzburg.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, my love?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Wolfi.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: We'll have a little party. Come in. Come in. You know Herr Schikaneder?  This is! a very nice girl.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No, it's right he should hear. I'm sick to death of it. We can't do anything right for you, can we?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Stanzi!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Look, old man, you stay out of this. We spend a fortune on you, more than we can possibly afford, and all you do is criticize, morning to night. And then you think you can -

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, damn!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: She won't talk to me. She says she has to speak to you.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, ask her!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I don't know.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What does she want?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: There's a young girl to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Wolfi, I think your father's tired. I'll cook us something here.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What? How can you be so boring? Tea!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Wolfi!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Tea? Who wants tea? Let's go out! This calls for a feast. You don't want tea, Papa. Let's go dancing. Papa loves parties, don't you?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: May I offer you some tea, Herr Mozart?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: He's not Herr Mozart. Call him Papa.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Stop it, Wolfi. I look dreadful. Welcome to our house, Herr Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: My Stanzi - look at her! Isn't she beautiful? Come on now, confess, Papa. Could you want a prettier girl for a daughter?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I love you! I love you!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sssh. What is it? Tell me.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Tell them to go!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What's the matter with you?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Tell them to go away. I don't want to see anybody.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Stop it now. Stop it. I've brought some friends to meet you. They're next door waiting. Do we have anything to eat? They're all starving.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: This isn't pride. It's sheer stupidity!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Shut up! Just shut up! I don't need them.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: All they want to see is your work. What's wrong with that?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Don't be stupid.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: How are we going to live, Wolfi? Do you want me to go into the streets and beg?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, don't do that again!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Yes!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: You borrowed money from your mother?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Well, I'm not borrowing any more money from my mother, and that's that!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh yes? You always know everything.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No, they will not. I know how things work in this city.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: They'll come anyway. They love me here.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: One royal pupil and the whole of Vienna will come flocking. We'd be set up for life!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, leave me alone.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I think you're mad! You're really mad!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Of course.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Excuse me, Wolfi. Mama is not feeling very well. Can we leave now?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Eat my - ah!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Eat

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Tish-I'm-tee.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Tish-I'm tee. What's that?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Tub - but i-tub - but I vol - love but I love ui - You. I love you!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Ui-vol-i-tub!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Iram - marry Em - marry me! No, no! You're a fiend. I'm not going to marry a fiend. A dirty fiend at that.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Just say it - you'll see. It's very serious. Em iram!  Em iram!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, this is serious. Say it backwards.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No, I'm not playing this game.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Em iram! Em iram!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Sra-I'm-sick. Sick - kiss I'm - my Kiss my! Sra-I'm-sick - Kiss my arse!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, no. Say it backwards, shit-wit. Sra-I'm-sick Say it backwards!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Yes, you are. You're very sick.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sra-I'm-sick! Sra-I'm sick!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh, ha, ha, ha.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, I think it's brilliant. You've been doing it for years.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Do you think that's funny?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why? People fart backwards.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: That's stupid.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Because here everything goes backwards. People walk backwards, dance backwards, sing backwards, and talk backwards.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Go ahead, tell him. Tell them all. They won't understand you anyway.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Your Grace, I've got something to tell you. I want to complain about this man.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Fartsbishop!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: We are in the Residence of the Fartsbishop of Salzburg.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Where?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes! Back! Back! Listen - don't you know where you are?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No! No! No!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I am! I am! I'm stopping it - slowly. You see! Look, I've stopped. Now we are going back.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Stop it!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Madame, I will respect his. He asked me to stay here.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I regret we have no servants to show you out, Herr Salieri. Respect my wish and go.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: He's not going to work on this anymore. It is making him ill. Please.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: No. I was assisting him. He asked me.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: This is not his handwriting.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: And I'm asking you -

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: He asked me to stay.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No, he doesn't. And I don't want you here. Just go, please.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: He needs me, ma'am.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Well, thank you very much. You can go now.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I was at hand.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Why you?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Your husband is ill, ma'am. He took sick. I brought him home.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: What are you doing here?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Should we stay here? It's a charming room. I love these candlesticks. Were they here earlier? I didn't notice them I suppose I was too nervous.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I do apologize for this afternoon. I behaved like a silly girl. Where shall we go?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Then don't. It's up to you. Not to be vague, that is the price.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: But! I'm a married woman!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: It's a post all Vienna seeks. If you want it for your husband, come tonight.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Isn't it obvious?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: What do you mean?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Some service deserves service in return. No?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: What for?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Alone.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Tonight?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Come back tonight.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh, thank you, sir!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Tomorrow night I dine with the Emperor. One word from me and the post is his.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh yes. He's really proud of his work.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: It is miraculous.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Yes, sir. He doesn't make copies.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: These are originals?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Originals?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: That's very tempting, but it's impossible, I'm afraid. Wolfi would be frantic if he found those were missing. You see, they're all originals.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Are you sure you can't leave that music, and come back again? I have other things you might like.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Don't keep calling me that. It puts me at such a distance. I was not born a Court Composer, you know. I'm from a small town, just like your husband.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Thank you very much, Your Excellency.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Sir, we really need this job. We're desperate. My husband spends far more than he can ever earn. I don't mean he's lazy - he's not at all - he works all day long. It's just! he's not practical. Money simply slips through his fingers, it's really ridiculous, Your Excellency. I know you help musicians. You're famous for it. Give him just this one post. We'd be forever indebted!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I see.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: No, sir. This is my own idea.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Then he didn't send you?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: My husband is a proud man, sir. He would be furious if he knew I'd come.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Really?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: I - I really cannot do that, Your Excellency. You see, he doesn't know I'm here.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I'm afraid I'm not at leisure this very moment. Just leave them with me. I assure you they will be quite safe.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Would it be too much trouble, sir, to ask you to look at them now? While I wait.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I will look at them, of course, the moment I can. It will be an honour. Please give him my warmest.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I understand.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: He's terribly busy, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: How charming.  But why did he not come himself?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: That's right, Your Excellency. I've come on behalf of my hus band. I'm - I'm bringing some samples of his work so he can be considered for the royal appointment.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Frau Mozart?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Madame. How can I help you?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Excellency!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh yes, and who are you? He's worked for Kings. For the Emperor.  Who are you?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: You're mad! She's mad, Wolfi.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Money! Money!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Oh yes? And what's so intelligent about writing a Requiem?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: You know what's ridiculous? Your libretto, that's what's ridiculous. Only an idiot would ask Wolfi to work on that stuff!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: I'm paying people just to wait for you. It's ridiculous!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: He's doing his best.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: I'm paying these people. Do you realize that?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Leave him alone!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Look, you little clown, do you know how many people I've hired for you? Do you know how many people are waiting?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: I hope so. I need it immediately.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: He's not in. But he's working on it. He said to tell you.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Where's our friend?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Not at all.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Am I interrupting something?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Ah. Well. Ah,  I see you've got your manager with you. Well, Madame, how about half the receipts?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: How much will you pay him?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Do you hear him? Do you?

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: So you are! The place is a pigsty all the time.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh, now I'm a bad housekeeper!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: And what do you expect? Who wants to walk out into a mess like this every day?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: And so you do! The only time you come out is to eat.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Well, this is none of your business.  Whoever sent you is going to pay, no?

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: But you can't take her without reference. It's unheard of!

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: What is ridiculous? Wolfi has many admirers in Vienna. They love him here. People send us gifts all the time.

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: In three months! Papa.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: When, may I ask?

name: Movie
speaker: CONSTANZE
text: Oh, yes.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: I see that you're expecting.

name: Movie
speaker: SECOND LADY
text: Behold!

name: Movie
speaker: FIRST LADY
text: Behold!

name: Movie
speaker: SECOND LADY
text: Hey!

name: Movie
speaker: FIRST LADY
text: Hey!

name: Movie
speaker: SECOND LADY
text: Behold!

name: Movie
speaker: FIRST LADY
text: Behold!

name: Movie
speaker: SECOND LADY
text: Adorable!

name: Movie
speaker: FIRST LADY
text: He's adorable!

name: Movie
speaker: SECOND LADY
text: Be careful!

name: Movie
speaker: FIRST LADY
text: Be careful!

name: Movie
speaker: MADAME WEBER
text: Young man, I am no stranger to theatres. I'm no stranger to insolence!

name: Movie
speaker: FLUNKY
text: I am sorry, Madame, but no! I cannot let anyone pass.

name: Movie
speaker: MADAME WEBER
text: Call Herr Mozart! You call Herr Mozart immediately! This is insupportable!

name: Movie
speaker: FLUNKY
text: I am sorry, Madame, but I have my orders.

name: Movie
speaker: MADAME WEBER
text: Do you know who I am?  This is my daughter. I am Frau Weber. We are favoured guests!

name: Movie
speaker: FLUNKY
text: I am sorry, Madame. It is not permitted.

name: Movie
speaker: MADAME WEBER
text: Let us pass, please! Let us pass at once! We're with the Emperor.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Yes. He is a little strange.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: What a strange young man.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Michael!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: I said play!

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Michael, please! I'm sure you will find her most willing, Herr Mozart. She's really very excited. She's been preparing all morning.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: People who know say the girl's got talent. You must judge for yourself. If you think she stinks, say so.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: It's such an honour for us to have you here, Herr Mozart. And for Gertrude.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Gertrude!

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: I've heard about you for ages! I thought you must be an old man.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: You can't be Herr Mozart!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Gertrude!

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Upstairs.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Thank you, Madame.  Come on now - courage. Play me something you know.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: I was. But she quite outgrew the little I could show her.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Who was your teacher?

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Just one year.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Wine?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I'd like a little wine, if you have it.

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Perhaps a little refreshment first? A little coffee, or a little chocolate?

name: Movie
speaker: FRAU SCHLUMBERG
text: Ah, now! Here she comes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Really?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, look at them.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: It is not a question of liking, Your Majesty. Your own law decrees it, I'm afraid.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Do you like this, Salieri?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Molested, Majesty. Twice, in the course of the same lesson.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: As a matter of fact, one of my own pupils - a very young singer - told me she was - er - well!

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Really?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I have to tell you, Mozart is not entirely to be trusted alone with young ladies.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Of course not.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Majesty, I don't like to talk against a fellow musician.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Oh?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Well, Sire, I made some inquiries in a routine way. I was curious to know why he had so few pupils. It is rather alarming.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Majesty, I did. Believe me, it was a most agonizing. decision. But finally, I simply could not recommend Herr Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: I don't think you understand me, Court Composer.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well. There it is.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Sire.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: You please me, Court Composer. A very clever idea.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I'm sure there is a way, Majesty. Some kind of a little contest. I could perhaps put together a small Committee, and I could see to it naturally that it will select according to Your Majesty's wishes.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah-ha. Favouritism. But I so want Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes, of course. My concern is to protect you from any suspicion of favouritism.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: And the result satisfies.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You already commissioned an opera from Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: An interesting idea, Majesty. But -

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: I'm thinking about Herr Mozart. What is your view?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Oh, Your Majesty, it would be such a tremendous honour!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Your Highness.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Good morning, Court Composer. This is my niece, the Princess Elizabeth.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Cattivo again, Court Composer. Well, tell him, Mozart. Name us a German virtue.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Excuse me, Sire, but what do you think these could be? Being a foreigner, I would love to learn.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, I'm glad to hear that.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, there it is. Now to business. Young man, we are going to commission an opera from you. What do you say?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: My pleasure.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Finally! Such an immense joy. Diletto straordinario!

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: And here is our illustrious Court Composer, Herr Salieri.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah-ha!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: A-flat, Majesty.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Let's have some fun.  Bring in Herr Mozart, please. But slowly, slowly. I need a minute to practice.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You do me too much honour, Sire.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Delightful, Court Composer. Would you permit me to play it as he comes in?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Majesty.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: May I try it?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: It's just a trifle, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: What a charming idea. May I see?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: You are cattivo, Court Composer.  I want to meet this young man. Chamberlain, arrange a pleasant welcome for him.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I think it is an interesting notion to keep Mozart in Vienna, Majesty. It should really infuriate the Archbishop beyond measure - if that is your Majesty's intention.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sire, the whole opera is finished. Do you know how much work went into it?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: You are passionate, Mozart! But you do not persuade.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Forgive me, Majesty. I'm a vulgar man. But I assure you, my music is not.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Twenty, sire! How about twenty? Twenty minutes of continuous music. No recitatives.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, six or seven minutes! maybe eight!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Guess! Guess, Majesty. Imagine the longest time such a thing could last, then double it.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: I have no idea.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But it's new, it's entirely new. It's so new, people will go mad for it. For example, I have a scene in the second act - it starts as a duet, just a man and wife quarreling. Suddenly the wife's scheming little maid comes in unexpectedly - a very funny situation. Duet turns into trio. Then the husband's equally screaming valet comes in. Trio turns into quartet. Then a stupid old gardener - quartet becomes quintet, and so on.  On and on, sextet, septet, octet! How long do you think I can sustain that?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah, love again.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But, Majesty, this is just a frolic. It's a piece about love.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: I think you are rather innocent, my friend. In these dangerous times I cannot afford to provoke our nobles or our people simply over a theatre piece.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sire, I swear to Your Majesty, there's nothing like that in the story. I have taken out everything that could give offense. I hate politics.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Mozart, I am a tolerant man. I do not censor things lightly. When I do, I have good reason. Figaro is a bad play. It stirs up hatred between the classes. In France it has caused nothing but bitterness. My own dear sister Antoinette writes me that she is beginning to be frightened of her own people. I do not wish to see the same fears starting here.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, Majesty, it is only a comedy.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Would you tell me why?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, yes, I admit it is.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: It is not your place to ask questions. Is it true?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Who told you this, Majesty?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Yet we hear you are making an opera from it. Is this true?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, Sire.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Mozart, are you aware I have declared the French play of Figaro unsuitable for our theatre?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah! By all means.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: May I introduce my father? He is on a short visit here and returning very soon to Salzburg. He would so much like to kiss your hand. It would make his whole stay so memorable for him.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Majesty, may I ask you to do me the greatest favour?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Thank you, Sire!

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Bravo, Mozart. Most charming. Yes, indeed. Clever man.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, my advice is to marry this charming young lady and stay with us in Vienna.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Twenty-six.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Excuse me, but how old are you?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well - Well we haven't quite received my father's consent, Your Majesty. Not entirely. Not altogether.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Really? How delightful. May I ask when you marry?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Enchanted, Madame.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Majesty, this is Madame Weber. She is my landlady.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Which few did you have in mind, Majesty?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: My dear, young man, don't take it too hard. Your work is ingenious. It's quality work. And there are simply too many notes, that's all. Cut a few and it will be perfect.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: My dear fellow, there are in fact only so many notes the ear can hear in the course of an evening. I think I'm right in saying that, aren't I, Court Composer?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I don't understand. There are just as many notes, Majesty, as are required. Neither more nor less.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, I mean occasionally it seems to have, how shall one say?  How shall one say, Director?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What do you mean, Sire?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Of course I do. It's very good. Of course now and then - just now and then - it gets a touch elaborate.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: So then you like it? You really like it, Your Majesty?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Oh, yes. Absolutely. German. Unquestionably!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: And German?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Yes, indeed.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It is new, it is, isn't it, Sire?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I think so, Sire, yes.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: What? On one hearing only?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Keep it, Sire, if you want to. It is already here in my head.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah-ha.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: In a Pasha's Harem, Majesty. A Seraglio.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Yes, where?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's actually quite amusing, Majesty. It's set - the  whole thing is set in a - in a -

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, what is it about? Tell us the story.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Because I've already found the most wonderful libretto!

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Why so?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Did we vote in the end for German or Italian?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Majesty!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Really? Oh, grazie, Signore! Sono commosso! E un onore per mo eccezionale. Compositore brilliante e famossissimo!

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: And now he has returned the compliment. Herr Salieri composed that March of Welcome for you.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh sir, yes! The honour is mine. Absolutely.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: The Director of our Opera. Count Orsini-Rosenberg.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: No, no, please! It is not a holy relic.  You know we have met already? In this very room. Perhaps you won't remember it, you were only six years old.  He was giving the most brilliant little concert here. As he got off the stool, he slipped and fell. My sister Antoinette helped him up herself, and do you know what he did? Jumped straight into her arms and said, Will you marry me, yes or no?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Your Majesty!

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah-ha. Well. There it is. Good.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: He's here.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Yes, what about him?

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Your Majesty, Herr Mozart -

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well, what do you have for me today?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Well. There it is.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: In my opinion, it is time we had a piece in our own language, sir. Plain German. For plain people.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah-ha. What do you say, Chamberlain?

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Very small pay, I imagine. I'm sure he could be tempted with the right offer. Say, an opera in German for our National Theatre.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: I agree, Majesty, but I'm afraid it's not possible. The young man is still in the pay of the Archbishop.

name: Movie
speaker: JOSEPH
text: Ah-ha. Well then, we should make some effort to acquire him. We could use a good German composer in Vienna, surely?

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Hush! I'm talking to His Majesty. Your Majesty, I wish to express only one thing - that you who are the Father of us all, could teach our children the gratitude they owe to fathers. It is not for nothing that the Fifth Commandment tells us: 'Honour your Father and Mother, that your days may be long upon the earth.'

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Father -

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: She does. She says I sleep all day.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No one calls you that.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Don't worry, I'm not staying here to be a burden.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Papa!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Never mind. You won't have to do anything for me ever again. I'm leaving!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: I never saw this girl in my life.  Is this a kind of joke?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Are you playing a trick on me?

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Mine?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Papa, is this your idea?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But my penalty. I've got to have a penalty.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: I'm tired of this game. Please play without me.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: I want you to come back with me to Salzburg, my son.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, Papa, name it. Name it. I'll do anything you say!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: This is just a game, Papa.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: No, really!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why not? Oh, come, Papa! What better way could I spend it than on you? My kissable, missable, suddenly visible Papa!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Thank you. That'll be fine. Don't spend any money on me.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Didn't I? I thought I did. I'm sure I did.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Why didn't you mention it in your letters?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Isn't that marvelous? We're delighted.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's too dangerous, Papa. But they're going to love it. Ah, there she is!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: You don't have secrets from me.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's a secret.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, let's not talk about it.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: What's that?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: This one will.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Composition doesn't pay. You know that.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I don't know. It's not important. I mean, I don't want pupils. They get in the way. I've got to have time for composition.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: How many?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Pupils?

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: How many pupils do you have?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Who? Who says that? Now that's a malicious lie!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: They say you're in debt.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What do you mean? It's wonderful. Really, it's - it's marvelous! People love me here.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: That's not what I hear.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It couldn't be better.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: How is your financial situation?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh we could, if we wanted to, but Stanzi won't hear of it. She wants to do everything herself.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Don't you have a maid?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: She's very tired, poor creature. You know me: I'm a real pig. It's not so easy cleaning up after me.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, yes. Oh, I mean no - not exactly like this. I mean today - just today, Stanzi - I remember now. She had to go - yes! She had to help her mother. Yes, she's like that. Her mother's a very sweet woman, you'll see.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Do you always live like this?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I don't know. Stanzi? Stanzi!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Is she not here?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Feed? Well, of course she feeds me. She stuffs me like a goose all day long. She's the best cook in the world. I mean, since Mama. Just wait, you'll see.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Of course, welcome! Welcome ten thousand times. Papa! my Papa!

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: Am I not welcome?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why are you here?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I will.

name: Movie
speaker: LEOPOLD
text: I write to you with urgent news. I am coming to Vienna. Take no further steps toward marriage until we meet. You are too gullible to see your own danger. As you honour the father who has devoted his entire life to yours, do as I bid, and await my coming.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Are you sure it's an opera?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Please don't ask me to go back again. I'm frightened! I'm very, very frightened.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Opera? Opera!

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: I suppose so. He sits there all he time, doing some silly opera.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Is he working?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: I'm frightened, sir. Really! When he speaks, he doesn't make any sense. You know he said he saw - he said he saw his father. And his father's dead.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Is he working?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Here, in his stomach. They bend him right over.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Where?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: I don't know. He has pains.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What medicine?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: You don't know what it's like. Herr Mozart frightens me. He drinks all day, then takes all that medicine and it makes him worse.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Why? What has happened?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: I'm leaving. I'm not working there anymore. I'm scared!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Now calm yourself. Calm. What's the matter with you?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: In there, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Where does he work?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes what?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: I think I've found out about the money, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Of course not. You're a good girl. You're very kind to do this. Next time you're sure they'll be out of the house, let me know, will you?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Oh, I wouldn't know that, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Really? What is it he's writing?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Oh, yes, sir, all day long. He never leaves the house until evening. He just sits there, writing and writing. He doesn't even eat.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Then how does he pay for all this? Does he work at all?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Not that I've seen.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Do any pupils come to the house?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Oh, thank you, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Bene.

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Madame Cavalieri is here for her lesson, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Bene! Bene!

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Yes, thank you, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Thank you. Are you well today, Fraulein Lorl?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: I will, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Ah-ha! Siena macaroons - my favourites. Give my best thanks to the baker.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What have you got for me today? Let me see.

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Good morning, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Ah! Here she comes. Fraulein Lorl, good morning.

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Yes. I can live in or out just as you wish.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Are you saying that someone is paying you to be our maid and doesn't want us to know who he is?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: They'll be paid for by a great admirer or yours who wishes to remain anon - anonymous.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: My name is Lorl, sir. I'm a maidservant. I was asked to come here and offer my services to you.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: That's right.

name: Movie
speaker: LORL
text: Are you Herr Mozart?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: So let me see it. Where is it?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, we can.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Look, I asked you if we could start rehearsal next week and you said yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Because there's nothing to see.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Can I see it?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: What? The vaudeville, what'd you think?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Oh! I'm sorry! I'm sorry! What have you got for me? Is it finished?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Put it down, I said! It's nothing for you.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: What is this?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Put it down!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Wolfi!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Leave that alone!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: So there you are. What do you say?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, no, I love that. I'd want it to be in German. I haven't done anything in German since Seraglio.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Of course! What else do you think they speak here?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: German!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: I'm serious. You write a proper part for me with a couple of catchy songs, I'll guarantee you'll have a triumph- de-luxe. Mind you, it'll have to be in German.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: I tell you I picked up a snake in Dresden last week - twelve foot long  - folds up to six inches, just like a paper fan. It's a miracle.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Animals?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: 'Course you would. You belong here, my boy, not the snobby Court. You could do anything you felt like here - the more fantastic the better! That's what people want, you know: fantasy. You do a big production, fill it with beautiful magic tricks and you'll be absolutely free to do anything you want. Of course, you'd have to put a fire in it, because I've got the best fire machine in the city and a big flood - I can do you the finest water effects you ever saw in your life. Oh, and a few trick animals. You'd have to use those.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I'd like to try them someday. I'm not sure I'd be much good at it.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Isn't he marvelous? He cost me a bundle, that horse, but he's worth it. I tell you, if you'd played Don Giovanni here it would have been a great success. I'm not joking. These people aren't fools. You could do something marvelous for them.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I liked the horse.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Yes, well, it's all good fun.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Wonderful!  He liked the monkey, didn't you?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: That kind of music should be punishable by death.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Sublime! Utterly sublime!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Papa, the rule is you can only give penalties that can be performed in the room.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: What did he say? What did he say?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sssh! Stay here.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Stanzi-Manzi-Banzi-Wanzi!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sssh!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: My answer is no, Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Please. I'll give it back, I promise. Please, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: I'm sorry. No.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No doubt, sir. But I am endowed with talent, and you with money. If I offer mine, you should offer yours.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Well, this is hardly the way to go about it.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: If a man cannot earn, he must borrow.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: What for?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well. Since it appears nobody is eager to hire my services, could you favour me with a little money instead?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: What is this, Mozart? What's the matter with you?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Really? Perhaps your dear wife might care to profit from my instruction?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Well, your pupil is married and living in Mannheim, young man.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Is my pupil still anxious to learn the art of music?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Herr Mozart. What a surprise. What can I do for you?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, I'm a good teacher. The next time you wish me to instruct another of your dogs, please let me know. Goodbye, Fraulein, goodbye, Madame! goodbye, Sir!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: It's a miracle, Herr Mozart!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, yes! on the whole. I suppose.  How long have you been playing, Fraulein?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Never mind, Strudel. It's part of music, getting used to an audience. Aren't I right, Herr Mozart?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Strudel, this is Herr Mozart. Say good morning.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Good morning, Fraulein Schlumberg.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Of course, it's him. Who do you think it is?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I'm afraid I am.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: This is Herr Mozart, my dear. The young man Herr Salieri recommended to teach our Gertrude. Where is she?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Madame.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: You won't be teaching this one either. She's my wife.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: What? Ha-ha! That's funny - I like it. Which one, eh? You're a funny fellow.  Hannah! Come this way.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: And which one of them do you want me to teach?

name: Movie
speaker: SCHLUMBERG
text: Quiet! Quiet! Quiet! Down there, damn you.  Welcome to you. Pay no attention, they're impossible. Stop it, you willful things! Come this way. Just ignore them. They're perfectly harmless, just willful. I treat them just like my own children.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I was foolish. I thought you did not care for my work - or me. Forgive me. Forgive me!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What for?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I am so ashamed.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I'm not leaving you.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Would you stay with me while I sleep a little?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I can keep going, I assure you. Shall we try?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: We'll stop for just a moment. Then we'll do the Lacrimosa.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Oh no. I'm not tired at all.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Do you want to rest a bit?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Then let me hear it. All of it. The whole thing from the beginning - now!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Do you have it?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You go fast!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: And that's it. Do you have it?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, and on 'dictis'.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Sopranos up to F on the second 'Voca'?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: C Major. Sopranos and altos in thirds. Altos on C. Sopranos above.  Vo-ca, vo-ca me, vo-ca me cum be-ne- dic-tis.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, yes - go on. The Voca Me. Suddenly sotto voce. Write that down: sotto voce, pianissimo. Voca me cum benedictis. Call me among the blessed.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: That's wonderful!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Show me.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I think so.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Do you have me?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh no. Now for the Fire.  Strings in unison - ostinato on all - like this.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: And that's all?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Exactly. The instruments to go with the voices. Trumpets and timpani, tonic and dominant.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Also identical?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: With the tenors.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: First bassoon and tenor trombone - what?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It couldn't be simpler.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Please! Just one moment.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Now the orchestra. Second bassoon and bass trombone with the basses. Identical notes and rhythm.  The first bassoon and tenor trombone -

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Fourth measure, second beat - F.  Flam-mis a-cri-bus ad-dic-tis, flam- mis a-cri-bus ad-dic-tis.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Good. Now the tenors. Fourth beat of the first measure - C.  Con-fu-ta-tis.  Second measure, fourth beat on D.  Ma-le-dic-tis.  All right?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sing it back.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I think so.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Third measure, second beat starting on E.  Flam-mis a-cri-bus ad-dic-tis.  And fourth measure, fourth beat - D.  Ma-le-dic-tis, flam-mis a-cri-bus ad- dic-tis.  Do you have that?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Start with the voices. Basses first. Second beat of the first measure - A.  Con-fu-ta-tis.  Second measure, second beat.  Ma-le-dic-tis.  G-sharp, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Common time.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What time?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: The Fire.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: So now - A minor. Suddenly.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: We ended in F Major?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Confutatis Maledictis.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Come. Let's begin.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Strange!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Oh, yes.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: A fire which never dies. Burning one forever?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Do you believe in it?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Consigned to flames of woe.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: So now the Confutatis. Confutatis Maledictis. When the wicked are confounded. Flammis acribus addictis. How would you translate that?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: The end of the Recordare - Statuens in parte dextra.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Where did I stop?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: A Mass. A Mass for the Dead.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Then, let us try together. I'd regard it as such an honour. Tell me, what is this work?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: You know, it's all here in my head. It's just ready to be set down. But when I'm dizzy like this my eyes won't focus. I can't write.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Of course.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But you'd have to swear not to tell a soul. I'm not allowed.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: My dear friend, it would be my greatest pleasure.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Would you? Actually, you could.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes. Can I - could I help you, in any way?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Another? But that's too soon! Tomorrow night? It's impossible! Did he say a hundred?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: He knows. He knows!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Finish what?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Wait! Ask him if he'd give me some money now. Tell him if he would, that would help me finish it.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What man?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: The man. He's here.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Who?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No! No, it's him!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Shall I answer it?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I'm too young to be so sick.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: The doctor thinks I am. But -

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Are you ill?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I have bad fancies. I don't sleep well anymore. Then I drink too much, and think stupid things.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I do.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Do you mean that?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Oh no. It is a sublime piece. The grandest operone. I tell you, you are the greatest composer known to me.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: This is only a vaudeville.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I would never miss anything that you had written. You must know that.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I mean to come to my opera. You are the only colleague who did.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: No, please.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: You're so good to me. Truly. Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You mean she's not coming back?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Not here! She's not well, either. She went to the Spa.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Where is your wife?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, no. I have to get back. I have -

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I'm taking you home. You're not well.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What happened? Is it over?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, no! I promise you, I'll give you a wonderful piece - the best I ever can!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Are you neglecting my request?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I don't have it yet. It's not finished. I'm sorry, but I need more time.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Work fast. And be sure to tell no one what you do. You will see me again soon.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: How long will you give me?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: How much?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I am only a messenger. Do you accept? You will be paid well.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Who are you?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: A man who deserved a Requiem Mass and never got one.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What dead? Who is dead?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: A Mass for the dead.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What work?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I have come to commission work from you.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh no! One hears such sounds and what can one say, but - Salieri!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You flatter me.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I never knew that music like that was possible.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: How could it not, Excellency?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Did my work please you?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: How could I not?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Mozart. It was good of you to come.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Grazie, a lei, Signor Antonio!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Grazie, mio caro, Wolfgang!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh no, the honour would be all mine.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I wouldn't presume. All the same, if it wouldn't be imposing, I would like you to see my new piece. It would be a tremendous honour for me.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I know, I know. Perhaps you should give me some lessons in that.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I think you overestimate our dear Viennese, my friend. Do you know you didn't even give them a good bang at the end of songs so they knew when to clap?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's the best opera yet written. I know it! Why didn't they come?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I think it's marvelous. Truly.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What did you think of it yourself? Did you like it at all?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Well, I can speak for the Emperor. You made too many demands on the royal ear. The poor man can't concentrate for more than an hour and you gave him four.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But what is it they don't like?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I know; it's outrageous. Still, if the public doesn't like one's work one has to accept the fact gracefully.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Nine performances! Nine! That's all it's had - and withdrawn.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Thank you! Oh, thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: With all my heart, Mozart.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, Excellency, would you?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: But there are those who have power over him. I think I'll take this up with the Emperor.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's not fair that a man like that has power over our work.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: How fortunate.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh no! My wife took it out in time.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You burned the score?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, I could kill him! I mean really kill him. I actually threw the entire opera on the fire, he made me so angry!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Why bother with Orsini-Rosenberg? He's obviously no friend of yours.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I don't know. They say I've got to re-write the opera, but it's perfect as it is. I can't rewrite what's perfect. Can't you talk to him?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Really? Why?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It's unbelievable! The Director has actually ripped out a huge section of my music. Pages of it.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Wolfgang, what is it? Sta calmo, per favore. What's the matter?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I don't think you should become known in Vienna as a debtor, Mozart. However, I know a very distinguished gentleman I could recommend to you. And he has a daughter. Will that do?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I can't say. Really

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What exactly are you working on?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Two thousand, two hundred florins is all I need A hundred? Fifty?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Forgive me. We all have patriotic feelings of some kind.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Ah. Italian?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Cream cheese mixed with granulated sugar and suffused with rum. Crema al Mascarpone.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Actually, it's a big secret. Oh, this is delicious! What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Come, come, Mozart; I'm interested. Truly.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I'd better not. It's a bit of a secret.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Ah, how exciting! Tell me more.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well, could you lend me some money till you have one? Then I'll teach her for free. That's a promise. Oh, I'm sorry. I'm being silly. Papa's right - I should put a padlock on my mouth. Seriously, is there any chance you could manage a loan? Only for six months, eight at most. After that I'll be the richest man in Vienna. I'll pay you back double. Anything. Name your terms. I'm not joking. I'm working on something that's going to explode like a bomb all over Europe!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I'm afraid not.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Do you have a daughter?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Of course not.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: They're stupendously successful. You can't get a seat. The only problem is none will hire me. They all want to hear me play, but they won't let me teach their daughters. As if I was some kind of fiend. I'm not a fiend!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: How is that possible? You give concerts, don't you? I hear they are quite successful.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: How can anyone say that? We have no cook, no maid. We have no footman. Nothing at all!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: It has been said, my friend, that you are inclined to live somewhat above your means.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, but I'm broke. I'm always broke. I don't know why.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: You don't mean to tell me you are living in poverty?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Look, I must have pupils. Without pupils I can't manage.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: An implausible idea. Between you and me, no one in the world could do musical harm to the Princess Elizabeth.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But I can't lose this post, I simply can't! Excellency, please. Let's go to the palace, and you can explain to the Emperor that Herr Sommer is an awful choice. He could actually do musical harm to the Princess!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: No, no, no: he has yet to achieve mediocrity.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sommer? Herr Sommer? But the man's a fool! He's a total mediocrity.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Herr Sommer.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Whom did they choose?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: My dear Mozart, there is no one in the world I would rather help, but now it is too late.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Filled? That's impossible! They haven't even seen my work. I need this post. Please, can't you help me? Please!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I have just come from the palace. The post has been filled.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why? Here is the music. It's here. I am submitting it humbly. Isn't that what you wanted?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Why didn't you come to me yesterday, Mozart? This is a most painful situation. Yesterday I could have helped you. Today, I can't.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: So you see, this post is very important to me right now.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I'm flattered. And congratulations to you, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: She is well. She is - well, actually, I'm about to become a father! She only told me last night. You are the first to know.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: So you are. How is your pretty wife?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Your Excellency, you requested some specimens of my work. Here they are. I don't have to tell you how much I need your help. I truly appreciate your looking at these. I have pressures on me - financial pressures. As you know, I'm a married man now.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Herr Mozart, what brings you here?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: It really is the best music one can hear in Vienna today. Don't you agree?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: How could I not?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Did you like it, then?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Dear Mozart, my sincere congratulations.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But this is absurd!

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes! yes! er, on  the whole, yes, Majesty.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Ah, love! Well of course in Italy we know nothing about that.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Love, Sire!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: A funny little tune, but it yielded some good things.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Ah!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Mio caro Adone.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Really?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I know your work well, Signore. Do you know I actually composed some variations on a melody of yours?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh yes, certainly. Certainly, Herr Director!

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Can we see the scene with the music back, please?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Taking out what you should never have put in.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What are you doing, Herr Director?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: It is dangerous for you to interpret His Majesty's edicts. Give me your score, please.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But surely the Emperor didn't mean to prohibit dancing when it's part of the story.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Exactly. A dance.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Yes, but this is not a ballet. This is a dance at Figaro's wedding.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Did you not know that His Majesty has expressly forbidden ballet in his operas?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Certainly, Herr Director.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Mozart! Herr Mozart, may I have a word with you please. Right away.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Just let me tell you how it begins.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: That will do, Herr Mozart!

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: But, Your Majesty -

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: What you think, Mozart, is scarcely the point. It is what His Majesty thinks that counts.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Well not especially. It can be in Turkish, if you really want. I don't care.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Then why especially does it have to be in German?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Exactly.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: You mean in Turkey?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: I think you'd better.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: I - I don't think you have, Herr Director. Not yet. I mean, it's quite n - Of course, I'll show it to you immediately.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Oh? Have I seen it?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: May I just do that, Majesty? Show you how it begins? Just that?

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Herr Mozart -

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Must I? Well, I won't! I tell you straight: I will not!

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Look, young man, the issue is simple. If you want this post, you must submit your stuff in the same way as all your colleagues.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Show them one interesting modulation and they faint. Ohime! Morbidezza! Morbidezza! Italians are musical idiots and you want them to judge my music!

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Mozart -

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: They hate my music. It terrifies them. The only sound Italians understand is banality. Tonic and dominant, tonic and dominant, from here to Resurrection!  Ba-ba! Ba-ba! Ba-ba! Ba-ba! Anything else is morbid.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Mozart -

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Naturally, the Italians! Of course! Always the Italians!

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Kapellmeister Bonno, Count Orsini- Rosenberg and Court Composer Salieri.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Who is on this committee?

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: A little modesty would suit you better.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: No, but I'm the best.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Mozart, you are not the only composer in Vienna.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Then why doesn't he simply appoint me to the post?

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: On the contrary.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Is the Emperor angry with me?

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Because His Majesty wishes it.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why do I have to submit samples of my work to some stupid committee? Just to teach a sixteen-year-old girl.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: What is what?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: What is this, Herr Chamberlain?

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: Because they do. They go on forever - at least what they represent. The eternal in us, not the ephemeral. Opera is here to ennoble us. You and me, just as much as His Majesty.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Elevated? What does that mean? Elevated! The only thing a man should elevate is - oh, excuse me. I'm sorry. I'm stupid. But I am fed up to the teeth with elevated things! Old dead legends! How can we go on forever writing about gods and legends?

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: Mozart, music is not the issue here. No one doubts your talent. It is your judgment of literature that's in question. Even with the politics taken out, this thing would still remain a vulgar farce. Why waste your spirit on such rubbish?  Surely you can choose more elevated themes?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Sire, only opera can do this. In a play, if more than one person speaks at the same time, it's just noise. No one can understand a word. But with music, with music you can have twenty individuals all talking at once, and it's not noise - it's a perfect harmony. Isn't that marvelous?

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: Mozart -

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Baron!

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: Well done, Mozart. Really quite fine.

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Why not? It's charming. I mean, I don't actually show concubines exposing their! their! It's not indecent!  It's highly moral, Majesty. It's full of proper German virtues. I swear it. Absolutely!

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: My dear fellow, the language is not finally the point. Do you really think that subject is quite appropriate for a national theatre?

name: Movie
speaker: MOZART
text: Oh, German! German! Please let it be German.

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: I don't think it was really decided, Director.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Don't pity me. Pity yourself. You serve a wicked God. He killed Mozart, not I. Took him, snatched him away, without pity. He destroyed His beloved rather than let a mediocrity like me get the smallest share in his glory. He doesn't care. Understand that. God cares nothing for the man He denies and nothing either for the man He uses. He broke Mozart in half when He'd finished with him, and threw him away. Like an old, worn out flute.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Oh my son, my poor son!

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: No, Father. From now on no one will be able to speak of Mozart without thinking of me. Whenever they say Mozart with love, they'll have to say Salieri with loathing. And that's my immortality - at last! Our names will  be tied together for eternity - his in fame and mine in infamy. At least it's better than the total oblivion he'd planned for me, your merciful God!

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: My son, why should you want all Vienna to believe you a murderer? Is that your penance? Is it?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: What difference does that make?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: But not his body.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: I poisoned his life.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: No, you didn't!

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: I did.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Why? Why? Why? Why add to your misery by confessing to murder? You didn't kill him.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: The only thing that worried me was the actual killing. How does one do that? How does one kill a man? It's one thing to dream about it. It's very different when you have to do it, with your own hands.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: His funeral - imagine it! The Cathedral, all Vienna sitting there. His coffin, Mozart's little coffin in the middle. And suddenly in that silence, music. A divine music bursts out over them all, a great Mass of Death: Requiem Mass for Wolfgang Mozart, composed by his devoted friend Antonio Salieri. What sublimity! What depth! What passion in the music! Salieri has been touched by God at last. And God, forced to listen. Powerless - powerless to stop it. I at the end, for once, laughing at Him. Do you understand? Do you?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Oh yes, yes, yes, yes, yes! Always the same stale answers!  There is no God of Mercy, Father. Just a God of torture.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: I do not claim to unravel the mysteries. I treasure them. As you should.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Oh? I thought you did so every day. So speak now. Answer me!

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: My son, no one can speak for God.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: All I ever wanted was to sing to Him. That's His doing, isn't it? He gave me that longing - then made me mute. Why? Tell me that. If He didn't want me to serve Him with music, why implant the desire, like a lust in my body, then deny me the talent? Go on, tell me! Speak for Him!

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: God's ways are not yours. And you are not here to question Him. Offer him the salt of penitence. He will give you back the bread of eternal life. He is all merciful. That is all you need to know.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: No? Was Mozart a good man?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: You cannot say that!

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Yes, Father. Yes! So much for my vow of chastity. What did it matter? Good, patient, hard-working, chaste - what did it matter? Had goodness made me a good composer? I realized it absolutely then - that moment: goodness is nothing in the furnace of art. And I was nothing to God.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Every day. Sometimes for hours I would pray!

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Did you try?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: It was incomprehensible. What was God up to? Here I was denying all my natural lust in order to deserve God's gift and there was Mozart indulging his in all directions - even though engaged to be married! - and no rebuke at all! Was it possible I was being tested? Was God expecting me to offer forgiveness in the face of every offense, no matter how painful? That was very possible. All the same, why him? Why use Mozart to teach me lessons in humility? My heart was filling up with such hatred for that little man. For the first time in my life I began to know really violent thoughts. I couldn't stop them.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: He was murdered, Father! Mozart! Cruelly murdered.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Do you hear me?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Should I?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Do you believe it?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Is it true?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: And do they believe it?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: All Vienna has heard that.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Ah - you've heard that?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Of course. The man you accuse yourself of killing.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: I didn't. That was Mozart. Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. You know who that is?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Oh, I know that! That's charming!  I didn't know you wrote that.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Can you recall no melody of mine? I was the most famous composer in Europe when you were still a boy. I wrote forty operas alone. What about this little thing?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: I regret it is not too familiar.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Well?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: I'm surprised you don't know. It was a very popular tune in its day. I wrote it. How about this?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: I can't say I do. What is it?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Then you must know this.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Here in Vienna.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Where?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: I know a little. I studied it in my youth.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: How well are you trained in music?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: My son, there is something dreadful on your soul. Unburden it to me. I'm here only for you. Please talk to me.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: I do not seek forgiveness.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Offer me your confession. I can offer you God's forgiveness.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Are they?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: That makes no difference. All men are equal in God's eyes.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Do you know who I am? You never heard of me, did you?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: I cannot leave alone a soul in pain.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: Leave me alone.

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: Do you understand that you have sinned? Gravely.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: What do you want?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: In the sight of God that is a sin.
