name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: So?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: You tried to take your life. You do remember that, don't you?

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: About what?

name: Movie
speaker: VOGLER
text: I am Father Vogler. I am a Chaplain here. I thought you might like to talk to someone.

name: Movie
speaker: OLD SALIERI
text: What do you want?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes, in the third act.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Yes, absolutely. Is there a ballet in Figaro?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Excuse me - didn't His Majesty specifically forbid ballet in his opera?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Ballet? What ballet?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: About the ballet.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: What anger?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: The Emperor has given him permission.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Incredible.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Well, Mozart is already rehearsing.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Never mind.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Where?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I've seen the manuscript.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Are you absolutely sure?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: You must be mad.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: He's setting that play to music?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Exactly.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: You mean that play?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Italian?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Mozart is writing a new opera. An Italian opera.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I've just learned something that might be of interest to you, Herr Director.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Ah.

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Well, the play makes a hero out of a valet. He outwits his noble master and exposes him as a lecher. Do you see the implications? This would be, in a grander situation, as if a Chamberlain were to expose an Emperor.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Oh yes, yes. And that was?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: For the same reason, Herr Chamberlain, that it was banned in France.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: I know we banned this play, but frankly I can't remember why. Can you refresh my memory, Herr Director?

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Did we?

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Well, actually, Sire, if you remember, we did finally incline to Italian.

name: Movie
speaker: VON STRACK
text: Well done, Sire!

name: Movie
speaker: ORSINI-ROSENBERG
text: Bravo, Your Majesty!

name: Movie
speaker: UGLY OLD WOMAN
text: Oh, I'm tender enough for you, my boy. I'm tender enough for you.

name: Movie
speaker: PAPAGENO
text: Well, I don't know! I mean you're a delicious, delightful, delectable little bird, but don't you think you might be just a little tough?

name: Movie
speaker: UGLY OLD WOMAN
text: Of course now. Right away, before I get any older.

name: Movie
speaker: PAPAGENO
text: What do you mean - now?

name: Movie
speaker: UGLY OLD WOMAN
text: Well, promise then.

name: Movie
speaker: PAPAGENO
text: I can't wait.

name: Movie
speaker: UGLY OLD WOMAN
text: Now you've got to promise me faithfully you'll remain true to me forever. Then you'll see how tenderly your little birdie will love you.

name: Movie
speaker: PAPAGENO
text: Oh. Well, thank you! How wonderful. Some people get all the luck.

name: Movie
speaker: UGLY OLD WOMAN
text: I've taken pity on you, my angel. I heard your wish.

name: Movie
speaker: PAPAGENO
text: What? Who the devil are you?

name: Movie
speaker: UGLY OLD WOMAN
text: Here I am, my angel.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Indeed. Just a moment - as a matter of fact I think I do know someone who could commission a work from him. A very appropriate person to do so. Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: How sad. It's tragic, isn't it? Such a talent.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: No, Baron, no. I'm afraid Mozart is a lost cause. He has managed to alienate practically the whole of Vienna. He is constantly drunk. He never pays his debts. I can't think of one person to whom I dare recommend him.

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: Can't you think of anyone who might commission some work from him? I've done my best. I got him to arrange some Bach for my Sunday concerts. He got a fee - what I could afford. Can't you think of anyone who might do something for him?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: I agree, Baron.

name: Movie
speaker: VON SWIETEN
text: This is embarrassing, you know. You introduced Mozart to some of my friends and he's begging from practically all of them. It has to stop.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Come with me. And stay in the room.

name: Movie
speaker: SERVANT
text: He didn't say, sir. I told him I didn't know when you would be back, but he insisted on waiting.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: What does he want?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Show her in. Then go to bed.

name: Movie
speaker: SERVANT
text: That lady is back, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Excuse me, my dear.

name: Movie
speaker: SERVANT
text: She didn't say. But she says it's urgent.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Who is she?

name: Movie
speaker: SERVANT
text: Excuse me, sir, there is a lady who insists on talking to you.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes, indeed. Goodnight to you all now. It was perfection - truly!

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Oh, by the way, give him this. This is his share. That should cheer him up, eh?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes.  And congratulations to all of you. It was superb.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: I'll call tomorrow.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Bene.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: And say everything went wonderfully. A triumph-de-luxe - say that! Tell him the audience shouted his name a hundred times.

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Of course.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Well, tell him we were here, won't you?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Oh, yes. He's just exhausted. He became dizzy, that's all. We should let him rest.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: But he's all right?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Well, he's sleeping now. Better not.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Can we come in?

name: Movie
speaker: SALIERI
text: Yes, I am looking after him.

name: Movie
speaker: SCHIKANEDER
text: Herr Salieri.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: ORDERLY
text: I'm an orderly, not a bleeding psychiatrist! I push things about, but I've little say what happens to them.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: You know, did he seem depressed? Do you think he'll eat the food?

name: Movie
speaker: ORDERLY
text: What do you mean, 'how did he look'?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: How did he look?

name: Movie
speaker: ORDERLY
text: The American? Yes, duck.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Has the patient in twenty-one gotten his tray yet?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I doubt it. But it's something to do.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Nurse Hobbs said there's a disturbance in Leicester Square involving some sort of mad dog.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Tea would be nice.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What shall we do?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I expect you shortly.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No, a cab will be faster.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Shall I send a car?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: He's fine. We'll come right over.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You're certain he's lucid? You won't need any help?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Right. Now listen carefully. I want you to bring David here. I want him in my care. I'll notify the police that we've found him. It is imperative that you bring him straight to the hospital. Do you understand?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, I should think so.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Could you get here without any trouble?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No, not really.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Is David acting strangely?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No, why?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Have you read the papers today? Have you listened to the radio or television?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, he is. He's very excited and confused, but he's not crazy, if that's what you mean.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: The zoo? Is he rational?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: He doesn't remember. He woke up at the zoo.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Is he all right? Why didn't you call me? Where was he?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: He's here.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Let's call the police and see if they can help us find our wandering boy.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What shall we do?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Oh, I don't mean running about on all fours and howling at the moon. But in such a deranged state he could harm himself, or perhaps others.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Dr. Hirsch?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: David has suffered a severe trauma. I myself witnessed some form of mass neurosis in East Proctor. If all the villagers believe that Jack Goodman was killed by a werewolf, why shouldn't David? And then it follows that if he survived an attack by a werewolf, wouldn't he himself become a werewolf the next full moon?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Surely you're not suggesting...

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No. He knows no one in London, besides me. I shouldn't have left him alone.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You've absolutely no idea where David might be?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I think the village of East Proctor is hiding some dark and terrible secret. I'm convinced that, like David, they believe in this werewolf.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: And what else?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: They were lying. There were no witnesses, no escaped lunatic. The whole community is hiding the truth of what actually happened up there.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I tried to investigate the attack. There are no records. The case was closed and now they've 'misplaced' the file. David's lacerations were cleaned and dressed when he arrived here and yet supposedly no doctor examined him before I did. The Goodman boy is already in the ground so he's no good to us. So I went to the pub in East Proctor where I was convinced of two things.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Dr. Hirsch, what's wrong? Is this more serious than I know?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Warn him?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David says Jack comes to warn him.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: What did he say?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Has his friend appeared to him again?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Well, yes, but he seems to be more upset by the death of his friend.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Alex, has David persisted in his werewolf fantasies?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: He's not?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: At my flat. I'm off at midnight and...

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: It's a full moon. Where is he?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Oh dear girl, your extracurricular activities are of no consequence to me. I don't give a damn who you sleep with. I'm concerned about David.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Come to my office, Miss Price.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: It's all right, Susan. Yes, Doctor, I have.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, I believe he did.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Did he say a wolf?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No, sir. Of course, sir. Good day, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: The police report said an escaped lunatic attacked them. He must have been a very powerful man. Although I really don't see that it is any of your concern, Miss Price.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What happened to them?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: That would be Jack Goodman, the boy who was killed.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: He said 'Jack'.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: What exactly did he call out?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, Doctor?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Oh, Miss Price?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Go about your duties.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Dr. Hirsch?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Can I be of service, Miss Price?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Miss Gallagher, surely you must perform some function here at the hospital.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Dr. Hirsch, Mr. Kessler cried out a minute ago.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Control!?! What control!?! Get away from me!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, don't lose control.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Leave me alone, dammit! You people are crazy! I've got to get away from here! I've got to do something!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, let's go now.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Hopeless. It's hopeless.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Will you shut up!?!!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Sir, he's very upset. His friend was killed and...

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I swear, I don't know this girl.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: We had an argument. He's being silly.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: He's playing a stupid joke, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Rational!?! I'm a fucking werewolf, for Christ's sake!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, please be rational. Let's go to Dr. Hirsch.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Jack is dead. Look, six people have been killed. I'm going to the police.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Jack is dead!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I am going to the cops. There's a full moon tonight. Jack was right. I...

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, stop!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Six people mutilated? It had to be me, Alex.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, what are you doing?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Pull over.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: But...

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I don't know why I feel so good. I haven't felt this good in a long time.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Dr. Hirsch will know what to do.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I should be committed.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: The next corner we can get a cab.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I said goodbye to you. I was locked out of the flat. I climbed the wall and came in through the bathroom window. I started to read and then I was naked at the zoo!  I guess I am out of my fucking mind.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Don't you remember?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Waking up at the zoo, that's not so insane. Having no clothes on? That's insane. What did I do last night, Alex?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: The zoo?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Alex, I've lost my mind. I woke up at the zoo! But you know what? I feel terrific!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm freezing.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David! Where on earth have you been!?!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: See you later.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I'm off. There's food in the fridge.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: A doper werewolf.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I've left those pills for you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Okay.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Listen, if you get too anxious, call me at the hospital, okay?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yeah, I do, but go to work.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, do you want me to stay here tonight?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Werewolves simply do not exist.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: It's silly of you to be apprehensive.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Tell me that it's silly of me to be apprehensive.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Anything.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Do me an enormous favor?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Let me go now, you'll make me late.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: That's good, Alex.  Reassure me.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Tomorrow is the full moon.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I wasn't hallucinating.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: But, David.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I was awake and he was in my room.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, you don't honestly believe that in reality your friend Jack rose from the grave to breakfast with you? Do you really?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Good.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Of course.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Will you be here in about fifteen minutes?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Alex?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: It's nice to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It's nice to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, perhaps you'd like to watch the telly while I take a shower.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: There is only one bed.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: The bedroom.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Lovely.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Bathroom.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Charming.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Closet.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Very nice.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: The kitchen.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yeah, I would think so, too.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I would think so.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I was dreaming again?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What do I think? You mean about the possibility of your becoming a monster in two days or about visits from dead friends?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yeah. He says that I will become a monster in two days. What do you think?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Your dead friend Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: My friend Jack was just here.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: You're to be discharged tomorrow. Will you be all right?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'll let you know the next full moon.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Are you better now?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: A werewolf?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm a werewolf.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Good. I thought for a moment I was the only embarrassed one in the room.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Now I'm embarrassed.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: All I am to you is a sex fantasy then?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Forgive me, I'm trying to cheer myself up and an affair with a beautiful nurse seemed like just the thing to do it.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: You're being awfully forward, aren't you?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Not just a patient -- me.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: How did we get from your bad dreams to my taking a holiday with a patient?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Will you think about it?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Now, David, I said I would keep you company, but I meant right here and now.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm serious. You don't know me and I know nothing about you. We have a perfect relationship.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Will you come with me?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: David, your dreams will stop. You'll leave England and your bad memories; and then this will all fade away.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I keep having these really terrible dreams. They are getting worse and I can't seem to stop them.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: That's easy enough.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: No, thank you. Just keep me company for a while.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Don't be silly. Can I get you something?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm sorry I woke you up.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Hello. You all right?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Ahem, A Word of Explanation. It was in Warwick Castle that I came across the curious stranger whom I am going to talk about. He attracted me by three things: his candid simplicity, his marvelous familiarity with ancient armor, and the restfulness of his company - for he did all the talking. We fell together as modest people will in the tail of the herd...

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yes, go on.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court by Samuel L. Clemens. This is after the preface but before chapter one: A Word of Explanation. You all right?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What? Oh, yes, please.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Shall I read to you?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: My best friend. My very best friend.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Was Jack Goodman your good friend?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Now what do you want to talk about?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I know.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm twenty-seven.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Twenty-eight.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: How old are you?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: That's not really a very proper question.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: How old are you?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It's okay. I want to talk to you.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have asked you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I dream of death mostly.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What do you dream about?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I've just started it. My friend gave it to me.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Do you like it?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: 'A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court' by Mark Twain.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I was. What are you reading?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I thought you were asleep.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You're a very beautiful girl.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Will you give me a break?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Let's try a little harder, shall we?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Right.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: This is absurd. I'm not hungry. I don't want any food.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Shall I be forced to feed you, David?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Call me David.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Shall I be forced to feed you, Mr. Kessler?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Aw come on, Alex!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Call me Alex.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Aw come on, Miss Price!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Sorry.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Leave the pills. I'll take them later.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Well, you're to take these after you've eaten. Now what kind of nurse would I be if I failed in so simple a task as giving out some pills?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: How is that?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: You put me in an awkward position, Mr. Kessler.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Please, really. I'm not hungry.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I'm afraid you have to eat something.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm not very hungry, thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: You haven't eaten your lunch.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Mr. Kessler?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: A wolf.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It was a wolf.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I beg your pardon?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It wasn't a lunatic.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: I thought not.

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Benjamin, have you ever been severely beaten about the face and neck?

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No!

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No what?

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: How are we feeling tonight?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Right.

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: The doctor will be round later. Would you like a picture book to look at? We have some lovely funny Beanos.

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Feeling better?

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Well, all right then, be that way. Here, swallow this.

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: No what?

name: Movie
speaker: BENJAMIN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Hello, Benjamin.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Really, Susan, I don't think that was very proper, and besides, it's common practice now.

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: I looked.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Why on earth do you say that?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: I think he's a Jew.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Chart says he's from New York.

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: He's an American, you know. Dr. Hirsch is going to fetch round one of those Embassy fellows to see him.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, I should think. He called out just now.

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: He all right?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, Mrs. Hobbs.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. HOBBS
text: Nothing quite as dramatic as that, Miss Price. He just doesn't eat enough of what is put before him. He suffers from nightmares. I'd think he just needs a hand to hold.

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Has he been refusing food?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. HOBBS
text: Take these round now, will you please? The American boy in twenty-one is only to have these after he's eaten. Will you be sure of that?

name: Movie
speaker: ALEX
text: Yes, Mrs. Hobbs.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. HOBBS
text: Miss Price.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: That's what I want you to do, you moron!

name: Movie
speaker: BOBBIE
text: You're going to have to stop this disturbance or I shall arrest you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Who is this girl?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Shakespeare was French! The Queen Mother sucks cocks in hell! Shit! Fuck! Piss!

name: Movie
speaker: BOBBIE
text: Now see here young man.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Queen Elizabeth is a man! Prince Charles is a faggot! Winston Churchill was full of shit!

name: Movie
speaker: BOBBIE
text: There's no call for that kind of language.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Hey, you asshole! I want you to arrest me!

name: Movie
speaker: BOBBIE
text: All right, you two, move along.

name: Movie
speaker: BOBBIE
text: You did, did you?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Officer, I killed those people last night.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Why are you doing this to me?

name: Movie
speaker: BRINGSLY
text: No, David. Harry and I and everyone you murder are not dead. The undead.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: That's easy for you to say - you're already dead.

name: Movie
speaker: BRINGSLY
text: You've left my wife a widow and my children fatherless. And I understand that I am to walk the earth one of the living dead until the wolf's bloodline is severed and the curse lifted.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Mr. Bringsly, I'm sorry. I have absolutely no idea what to say to you.

name: Movie
speaker: BRINGSLY
text: This isn't Mr. Goodman's idea. He is your good friend, whereas I am a victim of your carnivorous lunar activities.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Why are you doing this to me, Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: You could have told them!

name: Movie
speaker: CHESS PLAYER
text: No one brought them here! No one wanted them here!

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: That's very funny, that is.

name: Movie
speaker: CHESS PLAYER
text: Oh, all right. There was this airplane over the Atlantic on its way to New York. It was full of men from the United Nations.

name: Movie
speaker: CHESS PLAYER
text: No. You've had your chance.

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: Oh, come on, tell us.

name: Movie
speaker: CHESS PLAYER
text: All right, laugh then. I shan't tell it.

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: Quiet, everyone! Hush! Shhh!

name: Movie
speaker: CHESS PLAYER
text: You be quiet, woman, and let me speak.

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: No, but we're about to.

name: Movie
speaker: CHESS PLAYER
text: Here, Gladys, Tom. Did you hear the one about the crashing plane?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: Bambi?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yes, but does everyone kill Bambi?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: Some, everyone does.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Do you have bad dreams, too?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: An American film about the Mafia called 'See You Next Wednesday', and I want to see it badly, so you give me no problems and go to sleep.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What are you going to see?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: Miss Price, the other nurse that attended you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Alex?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: It's nearly eight. I'm off duty shortly, then I'm off to the films with Alex.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What time is it?

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: Now go back to sleep so you'll be fresh for Dr. Hirsch in the morning.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I was having a nightmare.

name: Movie
speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
text: Mr. Kessler? Wake up, please.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Of course not, David. I'll fetch in young Miss Price.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Dr. Hirsch?  I'd rather not be by myself.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Believe me. The Hound of the Baskervilles was an invention of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's. And if you'd read the bloody book, you'd find that Holmes discovered your house of hell a fraud, a fake.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You really think I'm crazy, don't you?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: David, please. The police are satisfied. I'm certain that if a monster were out roaming northern England we'd have seen it on the telly.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Then why the hell are you so quick to disbelieve me? You yourself said it must have taken incredible strength to tear apart a person like that.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I really don't know.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Did you talk to the police in East Proctor? Did the cops go to The Slaughtered Lamb?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: No. In fact, your wounds were cleaned and dressed before you arrived here.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Did you see Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You'd be surprised what horrors a man is capable of.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Look, Dr. Hirsch, I know I've been traumatized, but Jack was torn apart. I saw him. A man can't do that to someone with his bare hands.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I've told you, it wasn't a man. It was an animal. A big wolf or something. A rabid dog.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Did you get a good look at the man who attacked you?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Sure, as a kid. But never so real. Never so bizarre.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You've never had bad dreams before?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Doctor, my memory is fine. It's my sanity I'm beginning to worry about.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: In time I'm sure it will all come back to you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: How could there have been witnesses? It was so dark. We were running and I fell and Jack went to help me up and this thing came from nowhere... I don't understand what they're talking about.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: So they said.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: There were witnesses?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Now we've just given you a pretty strong sedative, so try to get some rest now. Miss Price will see to your needs. Rest now.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Lunatic?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You've suffered some rather severe cuts and bruises, lost a bit of blood, but nothing too serious; black and blue for a while. You'll have some dueling scars to boast of. That lunatic must have been a very fierce fellow. They say a mad man has the strength of ten.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Two weeks?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You've been unconscious since you were brought in two weeks ago.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: How long have I been here?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Get your fucking hands off me! What the hell is going on here?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Miss Price! Miss Price, please!

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Now, David, I want you to prepare yourself; your friend is dead.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: The guy I was with. Is he all right? How did I get to London?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I should think so after your recent traumatic experiences.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: London? Where's Jack? I had a strange dream.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You're in a hospital in London.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Where am I?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Hello, David. I am Dr. Hirsch and this is a countryman of yours, Mr. Collins.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: If you did it wrong, it would be painful. You'd choke to death.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I could hang myself.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: How shall I do it?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Because this must be stopped.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Gerald is the man you murdered in the subway. We thought it best you didn't see him as he's a fresh kill and still pretty messy.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Hello.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David Kessler, this is Gerald Bringsly.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I want you to meet some people.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Well, even if I'm not the wolfman, I am crazy enough to do something like that. I mean, here I sit in Leicester Square talking to a corpse. I'm glad to see you, Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What about the zoo?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I didn't mean it. I don't know what I'm saying. I'm not even sure it was me who killed those people. I don't remember doing it.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You look awful.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: If I was still alive, I probably would.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Aren't you going to say, 'I told you so'?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You don't have to say anything.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What can I say, Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Hi, David.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Hi, Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I will not accept this! Now go away!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: The canines will be real. You'll taste real blood! God damit, David, please believe me! You'll kill and make others like me! I'm not having a nice time, David! Don't allow this to happen again! You must take your own life!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What, Jack? That tomorrow night beneath the full moon I'll sprout hair and fangs and eat people? Bullshit!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You must believe me.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I think I've lost my mind. I think you're not real. I think I'm asleep and you're a part of another bad dream.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What do you think?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Jack, are you really dead?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You must take your own life now, David, before it's too late.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: A monster. I know, I know.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David, tomorrow night is the full moon. You'll change, you'll become...

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Get out of here, Jack!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I understand all right. You're one of the undead and I'm a werewolf.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David, I'm sorry I upset you yesterday, but you must understand what is going on.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Okay, you've seen me. Now go away.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I wanted to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What are you doing here?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Don't be an asshole, David. Come here.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You're not real.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: It's cold, David, and I'm so alone. The undead surround me. Have you ever talked to a corpse? It's boring! I'm lonely! Kill yourself, David, before you kill others.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Nurse! Oh God! Alex!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: The supernatural! The powers of darkness! It's all true. Take your own life! Suicide, David. Join me.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Nurse!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Listen to me! Take your own life, David. It's our only chance.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Nurse!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David, please believe me. You will kill people, David. You've got to stop the bloodshed before it begins.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You're talking like Boris Karloff! It's movie dialogue!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You'll stalk the streets of London a creature of the night.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Jack, please go away. Please go away.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Beware the moon. The full moon, David. You've got two days.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Stop it, Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Remember what that guy at The Slaughtered Lamb said? 'Beware the moon.'

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What are you talking about? I won't accept this! Get out! God damit!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You survived and now you shall continue the curse.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What?!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: It's you, David.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Will you be quiet?!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: The wolf's bloodline must be severed. The last remaining werewolf must be destroyed.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What's wrong with you? Shut up!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I was murdered, an unnatural death, and now I walk the earth in limbo until the werewolf's curse is lifted.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Shut up, you zombie!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: On the moors, we were attacked by a lycanthrope, a werewolf.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm not listening!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: We were attacked by a werewolf.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: If you love me so much, Jack, you'll realize how disconcerting it is to share one's breakfast with the living dead!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I'm a grisly sight, it's true; but I love you and that's why I'm here. You've got to know.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Warn me? Will you get out of here, you meat loaf?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David, now I know this may be hard for you, but I have to warn you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What?!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David!

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm going completely crazy.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Life mocks me even in death.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Rudy Levine the shmuck?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: So you know what she does? She's so grief stricken she runs to find solace in Rudy Levine's bed.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I can't stand it.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Debbie Klein cried a lot.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Why should you be surprised? You were a very well-liked person.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah. Your parents came to my funeral. I was surprised at how many people came.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Aren't you supposed to be buried in New York someplace?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I'm sorry to be upsetting you, David, but I had to come.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Hurting your feelings? Has it occurred to you that it may be unsettling to have you rise from your grave to visit me? Listen to me, I'm talking to a hamburger!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David! You're hurting my feelings.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I'm aware that I don't look so great, but I thought you'd be glad to see me.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: This is too much. I can't handle this.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Thanks a lot.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Get the fuck out of here, Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Nice to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Are you going to help me up?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You really scared me, you shithead.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Well. I'm glad we... WHOAA!!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I'll tell you when we get there.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Where are we going?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Jack?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Not far enough. Come on.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It sounds far away.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: See anything?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Walking away, yes, sir. Here we are walking away.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Walk away, Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Nice doggie. Good boy.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: A sheep dog or something. Turn slowly and let's walk away.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Oh shit. What is that?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Do you think it's a dog?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It's in front of us.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Let's just keep walking.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Plan?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What's the plan?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: It's circling us.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It's moving.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Anywhere! I think we should just keep moving.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Come on, where?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I don't know. Come on.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Shit! David, what is that?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I vote we go back to The Slaughtered Lamb.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: It's a full moon, 'beware the moon'.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: No, but he was on the moors.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Heathcliffe didn't howl.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Heathcliffe.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Pecos Bill.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: The Hound of the Baskervilles.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: There aren't any coyotes in England.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: A coyote.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Yeah?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Could be a lot of things.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What was it?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I heard that.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Did you hear that?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm well aware of how pleasant the weather is in Rome at the present time thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Say, David...

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I see and they were too embarrassed to talk about it, because they felt so silly.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Maybe that pentangle was for something supernatural.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I have no idea.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What do you think was wrong?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Well, not quite a blood-thirsty mob.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I don't know. Now that we're out here and it's three degrees, I'm not so sure I wouldn't rather face a blood-thirsty mob.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: That was weird. I guess leaving was the best idea.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Come on, I'm freezing.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Beware the moon?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I don't know. Let's see if there's an inn or something up the road.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What the hell was that all about?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Apparently so.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Come on, Jack, shall we go?!!

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: What do you mean? I'm starving.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Jack, we'd better go.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You ask them.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Go on, ask them.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Wrong.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Right.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I see. You want me to ask these people if they're burning candles to ward off monsters.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Listen, that's a pentangle, a five- pointed star. It's used in witchcraft. Lon Chaney, Jr. and Universal Studios maintain it's the mark of the wolf man.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You ask them.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Ask them what the candles are for.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Maybe the owners are from Texas.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: It's a five-pointed star.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: What about it?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Look at that.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Listen, at least it's warm in here.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Nice looking group.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Nice to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Hello.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Shall we?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Okay.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I assume full responsibility.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David, before we go in there I want you to know that - no matter what happens to us - it's your fault.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: A severed wolf's head on a pike as their symbol.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: That's not a spear. It's a pike.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Of course, The Slaughtered Lamb. Why else would they have a severed wolf's head on a spear as their symbol?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: That's a wolf's head.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Of course, The Slaughtered Lamb. Why else would they have a severed fox head on a spear as their symbol?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: The Slaughtered Lamb?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: She says she 'likes me too much'.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: We've known Debbie what, since the eighth grade? How many years of foreplay is that?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: It is impossible for a body like that to be dull.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: It just fascinates me that you can spend so much energy on someone so dull.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I have to make love to her. It's very simple. She has no choice really.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: If you don't stop, I'm going to kill you.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Rendezvous in Rome starring Jack Goodman and Debbie Klein. The love affair that shocked Europe! See torrid lovemaking at its most explicit! See Jack and Debbie expose their lust in the sacred halls of the Vatican! Never has the screen dared...

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I don't know.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Well, anyway, do you think she'll be there?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I'm talking about a girl you want to fuck, so give me a break.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: You're talking about the woman I love.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: She's a jerk.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Debbie is not mediocre and she has one of the great bodies of all time.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: I think Debbie Klein is a mediocre person with a good body.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Do you think she'll meet me in Rome?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Right.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: I'm sorry. Northern England first, Italy later.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Well, I like it here.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Oh, I don't know. I mean look around. Isn't this a fun place?

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: You're not having a good time are you?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: David.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Jack.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Good.

name: Movie
speaker: DAVID
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Are you cold?

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: Stay here. If we need you, we'll know where to reach you.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: What can we do to assist you?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Regardless of what you think, Lieutenant, the fact remains that David is missing and that we must find him.

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: The forensic lads seem to feel that some sort of animal was involved, that's true, but I hardly think...

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Why don't we ask him?

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: Has David Kessler anything to say concerning the attack on the moors?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: You were saying?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Well, then, what can I do for Scotland Yard?

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: No, thank you, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Come in, come in. Please sit. Some tea?

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: Dr. Hirsch?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Tell him I'm out. No, tell him I've passed away. An old war wound or something. Tell him I'm dead. And no more calls!

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: He's on the telephone.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: What here?

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: Roger Mathison, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Excuse me.  Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Send them in.

name: Movie
speaker: SECRETARY
text: Lt. Villiers and Sgt. McManus are here to see you, Doctor.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Yes?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I see. You've heard nothing about the incident?

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: Oh, that's been there for two hundred years. We were going to paint it out, but it's traditional, so we left it.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: What's that?

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: I suppose Guinness will suffice.

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: Sorry, love.

name: Movie
speaker: DR. HIRSCH
text: Campari and soda would do nicely.

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: Hello, there. What can I get you?

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: I beg your pardon?

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Remember the Alamo?

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: But I can heat some up for you if you'd like.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Oh.

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Then you have some hot tea?

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: We've got spirits and beer. If it's something hot you want, you can have tea.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Hot chocolate?

name: Movie
speaker: WOMAN
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: JACK
text: Do you have any hot soup?

name: Movie
speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
text: We'll find him, not to worry.

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: I cannot accept a connection between David Kessler and last night's murders. We will find him, however. I can assure you of that.

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: That is precisely my point. David, as far as we are concerned, the matter is closed. We won't trouble you any further. Good day.

name: Movie
speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
text: I don't rightly know, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: And what, Sergeant?

name: Movie
speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
text: Lieutenant, the boy seems pretty lucid to me and...

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: Sgt. McManus, are you suggesting that David and Jack were, in fact, attacked by some animal and that the officialdom of East Proctor has conspired to keep it a secret? We have an autopsy report on the murderer who was shot in the act by the local police. We have two witnesses to the crime. You'll forgive me, Mr. Kessler, if I consider your testimony as coming from someone who has gone through a terrible shock.

name: Movie
speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
text: He may have a point, Lieutenant. Two strong boys would be able to defend themselves against one man.

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: Has Mr. Kessler said anything regarding the attack on the moors?

name: Movie
speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
text: Sorry.

name: Movie
speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
text: I'd like some tea, please.

name: Movie
speaker: LT. VILLIERS
text: No, thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Yeah - sure!

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: Yes - sure?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: If she can't pay, I'll have to foreclose, won't I?

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: She's a widow. I don't like taking mortgages from widows.

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: What's the idea of turning her down? It sounds like a perfectly safe investment.

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: But listen, Tom, I?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: I'll tell you why. I don't like the crowd you're mixed up with.  Personally, you can have all the credit you want. But for that deal - not a cent.

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: Tom, I never had trouble getting credit from you before. When I was flat broke you gave me all the money I wanted. Now I come to you with a swell deal, and the greatest?

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: I want to know why .

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Listen, I told you I wasn't interested in that deal, didn't I?

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: What do you suppose anybody wants? Money, money, money!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: You here again? What do you want?

name: Movie
speaker: BILL
text: Hello, Tom.

name: Movie
speaker: OSCAR
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: He has?

name: Movie
speaker: OSCAR
text: The detectives got Matt up there in Sampson's office.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Yeah. He'll have a tough time thinking up a wise-crack for this one . . .

name: Movie
speaker: OSCAR
text: Matt?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Where's Matt?

name: Movie
speaker: OSCAR
text: No kidding. When I saw it, you could'a knocked me over with a pin.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: No kidding?

name: Movie
speaker: OSCAR
text: I was the first one to see it. I was coming down the stairs, and there was the watchman lying dead at my feet.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Oscar, what's the matter?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Say, don't annoy me. I got troubles of my own.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: And listen, wise guy - I'm setting friend time clock for exactly nine o'clock, so no squawks out of you guys in the morning.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: I remember once when your account checked.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: I'm fourteen cents out, and it took me half an hour to find the mistake. And me with a date, too.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: What's the matter, Charlie?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Where do you think I've been?  I took the baby for a stroll in the park.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Where you been?

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Aw, nerts!

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Say pal, did you ever hear of a Depression?

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: It'll be yours if you don't kick in with that ten bucks.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Whose death?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Baby, I can't give you anything but love...

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: I'll pay it back to you Saturday - on the level I will. Give a guy a break, will you? I've got to get it back in my account. If Helen ever finds out that I?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Yeah?

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Charlie!

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Ten bucks? Say, if I had ten bucks, I'd quit.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Let me have ten bucks?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Say, do me a favor, will you Charlie?

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Here's twenty-five thousand.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Yeah.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: It was more than that last week.

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: About twenty-four thousand.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: How much?

name: Movie
speaker: CHARLIE
text: Say Matt, I'll have to have some money for those Manville payrolls.

name: Movie
speaker: HELEN
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: And tell him not to delay.

name: Movie
speaker: HELEN
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: When he comes in, tell him we're waiting for him in the board room.

name: Movie
speaker: HELEN
text: Not yet, Mr. Clark.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Mr. Dickson in yet?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: All right, let him! I'm sick and tired of hearing about him. If he wants to run the bank, let him do it. I don't want any part of it.

name: Movie
speaker: O'BRIEN
text: You know Dickson as well as we do. He'll shut the doors before he gives up control.

name: Movie
speaker: O'BRIEN
text: Take it easy, Clark.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: How are you protecting your depositors? By making a lot of idiotic loans!

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: What good will that do?  Why, it will take control away from him. We'll put somebody else in charge, call in all doubtful loans, and be on safe ground again. That's what good it will do!

name: Movie
speaker: O'BRIEN
text: What good will that do?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Dickson doesn't have to go. But he must agree to this merger with New York Trust?

name: Movie
speaker: O'BRIEN
text: Don't make me laugh, Schultz!

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Oh, is he? We carry more unsecured paper than any other institution in the city. We're fools to tolerate it.

name: Movie
speaker: O'BRIEN
text: Personally, I think you're getting panic-stricken about nothing. Dickson's all right.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: You know what you can do with that! Come on, take a look at this! You'll see a demonstration of faith that's worth more than all the collateral in the world.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: We've been waiting fifteen minutes?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Come out here you pawnbrokers - take a look at this!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: The bank. All right. Do anything you want with it.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Dickson, I'd like to talk to you about the bank.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: I can't? You just wait and see. If that run doesn't stop within the next hour, I'll shut the doors. You know what that means? The bank examiner will step in tomorrow. You'll be forced to liquidate. I'll insist upon it. The depositors will be paid one hundred cents on the dollar. What's left you gentlemen can have. But I'll guarantee there won't be enough to pay your next month's garage bill.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Say, you can't do that?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: So, that's it, eh? You've waited a long time for this chance, haven't you?  Well, I'm not going to resign now - or ever.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: No. You can't reason with anyone else when you're in a jam. We pleaded with you to keep liquid, but you wouldn't listen to us. You preached to us about faith and a lot of other rubbish. Now you want our help. You want us to throw a lot of cash into a bank that you've wrecked. All right. There's one way you can get it. Give us an option on your stock and resign as president.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Aw, they've gone crazy. You can't reason with a mob.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: The depositors you were protecting were the first ones to pounce on you. You thought they were your friends. Why don't you go out there now and try and get some help from them?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: I have everything I own in it. It's your bank as well as mine, isn't it?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: That sounds very simple, Dickson, but why should we jeopardize our personal fortunes?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: I know that among you, you have at least a million dollars in various banks throughout the city. Get that money over here and I'll stop this run within five minutes.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: What do you mean, help?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: We'll be forced to shut the doors. I've worked twenty-five years night and day to keep this bank alive. You've all made money out of it. Are you willing to help?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: We'll discuss that in the board room.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: What about?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: We want to talk to you.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Yes! You said it, Clark. That's the only thing that means anything to me.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Gentlemen, you notice Mr. Dickson refuses to consider our wishes. He refuses an offer to merge with the New York Trust - the only thing that will put this bank on safe ground. He insists upon running a bank on so flimsy a thing as . . . as faith!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: I'm running this bank my way. Get that clear!

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: I know, Dickson. That's all very well. But you're taking too many chances. In these times a bank should keep liquid in case of trouble. In case of emergency!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Most of the creditors I know personally. I've seen them grow up in the community. I knew their fathers and mothers before them.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Not at all. That's Alexander Hamilton's idea[5] - the finest banking mind this country has ever known. Those are his exact words, gentlemen. Character!  It's the only thing you can bank on, and it's the only thing that will pull this country out of the doldrums.

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Character, hmmpf! That's your idea?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: Just pure luck!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: What's the matter with my policy? How many losses has this bank taken in the last twenty-five years?  I'll tell you. Not a single one!  What's wrong with that kind of banking?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Oh, you would, eh?  All right. If it's more important than golf, go ahead. What's on your mind?

name: Movie
speaker: CLARK
text: I think, Mr. Dickson, we would like to have a little of your very valuable time here at the bank this morning, if you don't mind.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Say, you know, I found out something yesterday about hitting a golf ball. You've got to hit with the left hand, and from the inside out, it's the only way you can hit anything?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: He won't believe it, Mr. Dickson. But it's the truth - honest it is. I was in my apartment last night - ask your wife - she?

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Claims he was there with a married woman. Doesn't want to mention her name.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I didn't kill him! I had nothing to do with that, I tell you! I was home in my apartment last night - I can prove it!

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Don't forget there's a dead watchman downstairs.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I was crazy, I tell you, Mr. Dickson. I didn't know what I was doing. I wandered around in a daze. All I could think of was that they were going to kill me . . .  You'll stand by me, won't you, Mr. Dickson? You won't go back on me now, will you? I'll die if they send me to prison!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: They took my keys yesterday. I went there to get them back.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: What were you doing at Finlay's this morning?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Stand back, Inspector. Let me out of here, or I'll shoot you!

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Don't be a fool, Cluett. This is only going to make it worse for you.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: All right, Jack, all right.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Stand back Inspector, or I'll shoot. Drop that gun.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: It's one of the boys from headquarters. He always sings "Mother Machree" whenever he's got good news. Looks like this case'll be settled in no time.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Somebody must be in good humor. He was humming "Mother Machree."

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Thanks.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Why, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: You understand?

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Oh!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: If you don't mind, Inspector, I'd rather not say - that is, unless it becomes absolutely essential. You see, she's married.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Looks like you're going to have no trouble at all. What was the lady's name, Mr. Cluett?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Oh yes, of course. There was someone with me. A lady.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: That is simple, isn't it? I assume you can prove that if necessary.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: That's very simple. I was home.

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: Where were you at twelve o'clock last night?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Of course, yes. Just what would you like to know, Inspector?

name: Movie
speaker: INSPECTOR
text: I hope you don't mind me asking you a few questions, Mr. Cluett.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Get out, get out!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: She wasn't to blame, Mr. Dickson. It wasn't her fault. Honest, it wasn't. I begged her to come up. She didn't?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: She just came up for a drink. Just for a few minutes.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: You just mentioned her name. What was she doing there? What was she doing in your apartment?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Nothing, nothing, Mr. Dickson. Don't pay any attention to me. I don't know what I'm saying.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: What was my wife doing in your apartment last night?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: But I didn't kill that man last night. Honest I didn't, Mr. Dickson!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Fifty thousand dollars!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Gambling - I owed them a lot of money. Last week I lost over fifty thousand dollars!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: What happened?  You're not a thief. How'd you get mixed up with these kind of people?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I don't know. It's all been like a crazy nightmare, Mr. Dickson.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Confessed! Cluett, in heaven's name, what got into you?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: Listen, buddy, you're getting by pretty easy. Quit squawking!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: But Dude, listen - couldn't we make this some other time?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: Be sure you're with somebody responsible in case any questions are asked. Understand?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: know, but?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: You? No, you'll be all right, so long as you establish an alibi for tonight.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Dude - there's not any chance of my becoming involved in this, is there?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: All you gotta do is fix a few things for us , and we'll do the rest, see?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: What do you mean?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: You don't have to do nothing.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Why, I couldn't do that . . . !

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: Why not?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Good heavens, man! You're not suggesting that I?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: We can take blood from anything ?  If it's comin' to us.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: But after all, you can't take blood from a stone.

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: That don't do us any good.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I'm sorry, Dude, but?I?

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: Then what did you want to gamble for? If you'd have beat us out of fifty G's, you'd have been paid, wouldn't you? Well, we want our dough.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I haven't got it.

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: That's your funeral. We've got fifty thousand dollars comin' to us.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I know, I know, Dude. Oh, I must have been crazy! I lost my head completely!

name: Movie
speaker: DUDE
text: You know what we do to welchers, Cluett, don't you?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: What are you doing here?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Why, Matt!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I'll grow a moustache by the time you get out of here.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: I'm not afraid of you. You haven't got a moustache!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: And now fair woman, I have you in my power.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: A misunderstood bachelor.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: What is that, Mr. Bones?[7]

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Oh, you're not so badly off. There's something much worse than being a misunderstood wife.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: You know, there ought to be a Congressional Medal for men like you. America's comfort to misunderstood wives. I never thought I would find myself in that class.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Good for you. Come on.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: No. No, I'm afraid papa isn't that much interested. He's too busy rushing off to Philadelphia to make stuffy, old speeches at stuffy, old bankers' meetings. Too busy closing big, important deals?  I think I will have a drink.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: What's the matter? Afraid papa will spank?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: No. I know the answer to that one.  I think you'd better take me home.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Come on up for just a few minutes. We'll have just one drink, then we'll go.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: I knew I couldn't trust you. You told me you were taking me home.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: My apartment.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: What's this?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Cyril!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: No. No, I'm not. I deliberately avoided you. I was afraid of making a fool of myself. But I won't stand it any longer?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Why, Cyril, you're insane?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I've loved you ever since I can remember, long before you married Tom Dickson.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Now wait a minute, wait a minute...

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Don't you know I've been crazy about you for years?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: What?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I want to be near you!

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Don't you know?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Why are you so anxious?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: No, they won't. Not when you are there. Oh, please, be a sport. Please ask me.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Don't be silly, Cyril. These are respectable people. They'd probably bore you to death.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Now Phyllis, if you don't invite me, I'm coming anyway.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: You? No can do. It's all set. Just a few of Tom's closest friends.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Well, aren't you going to invite me?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Well, what?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Well?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: But I'm giving a party for him - a real, old-fashioned surprise party. Caps, bells, whistles, and everything. I'm really terribly excited about it. I've been planning it for months.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Please, please don't laugh at me, Phyllis. I must see you tonight!

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Oh! Oh, no!  I think I've done enough experimenting for one day. Congratulations, Cyril. You've convinced me that you're a philanderer of the very first order. I shall recommend you highly.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: See, we're getting along famously!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Yes, yes, it does. What are you doing tonight, Phyllis?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Doesn't that come next?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Now let me see, what comes next?  Oh yes, I know - what are you doing tonight, Phyllis?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: But you see, it isn't blarney where you're concerned.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Come on Cyril, try a little bit of it out on me. I haven't had any first-class blarney thrown at me since the day I was married.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Whatever it is that makes you such a riot with women.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Line?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Not bad, not bad at all. Do you know something? I've always been curious about your line.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: If I thought you were the slightest bit interested, I would.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: ?running around. Not your work.  You'd better start reforming, Cyril!

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: What is?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Here, here, here, now! Don't you go back to work on me, too. I'm getting tired of this. Besides, it's beginning to affect your looks?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Liar! You're just suffering from lack of sleep.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Well, you can. You always could.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: For a celebrated bounder, that is an awful admission. Besides, I never knew that any female could do this to you .

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Being alone with you has always done this to me. You know that.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Me?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Am I? Why, I - I don't know any reason why I should be, unless of course it's you . . .

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: What is the matter with you? You're trembling?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Why, I needed a?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: This won't do. Not during business hours . . .

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: I guess I have said enough  I'm just wasting my breath talking to you.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: That will be just about enough! Now get out of here!

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: This is my business. Mr. Dickson's been like a father to me.  What has he ever done to you to deserve a deal like this?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Phyllis, you don't have to explain anything.  You'd do well to mind your own business.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: No?  Then maybe you'll understand, Mrs. Dickson. Oh, gee, he's crazy about you. Nobody knows it better than you. If he ever finds out, it'll kill him.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I tell you, I'm not interested in your opinion.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: You've no right to do this to her, Mr. Cluett. Why don't you think it over? It's only gonna get you into a lot of trouble.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I'm not interested in what you think.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Oh no, Mr. Cluett, if it's all the same to you, I'd rather not wait. It's about you and Mrs. Dickson.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Anything you have to say to me, you can say in the morning.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: It's funny - now that I'm here, I don't know just how to go about it.  You see, I kind of expected to find you here alone.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: I'm listening.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Well, I thought I'd like to have a little talk with you.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Oh, yeah?

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: The butler said I could stay. I told him it was important.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Yes, now.

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Now?

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Let me see your cash book, will you?

name: Movie
speaker: MATT
text: Yes, sir.

name: Movie
speaker: CLUETT
text: Are the payrolls ready for tomorrow?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Well, that's too bad. Mine's all right too.

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: Good morning, Mr. Dickson. My wife is much better this morning.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Of course, let them in! You're late now.

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: Shall we let the people come in?

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: Thank you!

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: That makes it unanimous. I feel all right too.

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: I'm feeling fine this morning.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Wait a minute.  How do you feel this morning?

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: Excuse me?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Got a handkerchief?

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: Much better this morning, thank you.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: John, how's your wife this morning?

name: Movie
speaker: GARDINER
text: Good morning, Mr. Dickson.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: In Cluett's apartment? Well dear, you see, I . . . I . . .

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Listen, dear. Now tell me the truth about this. Were you in Cluett's apartment?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Last night? Er - why - uh, last night . . .

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Listen, dear. I want to ask you something. I know it's a silly thing for me to ask you, but . . . I want you to tell me the truth. Where were you last night?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: No.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Happy now?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: All right. I'll postpone the whole thing until tomorrow night.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Tomorrow night?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Don't you forget that I'm still the head man around here too. Now we'll get the tickets changed for tomorrow night. You and I are going out together. How's that?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Well . . .

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Listen, don't go around being attractive to anyone but me . . .

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Ho, ho, ho, yourself! I wouldn't laugh if I were you. You may not suspect it, but I'm still attractive - to some.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Ho! Ho! Ho!

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: The girls!  I don't suppose it ever occurred to you that I might go out and find myself an attractive young man . . .

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: You can take some of the girls. You can take Mildred - or Gwynn?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Yes, of course.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: That's what it was you planned, wasn't it?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: The theatre?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Listen, it isn't so terribly important. We can go to the theatre any time.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: I don't care whether it's important or not. You said you were going out with me, and if you hadn't promised so faithfully, I wouldn't have gone and planned the whole thing.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: But I have to go, dear. It's a very important banker's meeting.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Now Tom, you simply cannot go to Philadelphia tonight. That's all there is to it.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: I'm terribly sorry. I'd forgotten all about you. I'm so sorry, dear.

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Yes.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Oh, I did have a date with you tonight, didn't I?

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: Nothing. Tom, I thought you were going out with me tonight.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: What's the matter dear? What have I done now?

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
text: Oooh! That has the earmarks!

name: Movie
speaker: MRS. DICKSON
text: It's amazing that your sweet, lovely, gorgeous wife can ever get to see you.

name: Movie
speaker: DICKSON
